Vooraf: ik had een ticket Amsterdam - Londen gekocht met het idee dat ik kort voor de reis zou kijken of ik in Amsterdam of Rotterdam zou instappen. Toen ik contact daarover had met 'James' van de klantenservice vertelde hij mij dat ik alleen in Amsterdam kon instappen en uitstappen. Op tussenstations, zoals Rotterdam zou niet mogen volgens het ticket. Daardoor moest ik veel vroeger van huis vetrekken, ook omdat omdat de Eurostar wegens werkzaamheden een omweg maakte via Haarlem, Leiden, etc. ipv de snelle route: dus eerst 1 uur 15 minuten hobbelen door NL. Op de terugweg bleek dat het geen enkel probleem is om in Rotterdam uit te stappen als je een kaartje hebt naar Amsterdam. Thanx James!
Inchecken in Amsterdam: zelfde procedure als vliegen: inchecken; security; NL-paspoortcontrole; Britse paspoortcontrole en daarna in een overvolle ruimte wachten tot je het perron weer op mag naar de trein.

Heenweg: 2e klas: harde stoel, weinig beenruimte;
Terugweg: 1e klas: dezelfde harde stoel; wel meer beenruimte; eten: ik had warm eten verwacht, (avondreis): was een eenvoudige koude hap: bieten met rodekool salade; bladerdeeg met kalkoen erin en zoet dingetje; wel fijn dat men een paar keer met drankjes/ koffie thee langskwam, ook een biertje of een wijntje (inbegrepen). Maar voor het eten hoef je geen eerste klas te boeken.

Werken in de trein: nauwelijks kunnen werken: wifi werkte superslecht: langzaam en valt vaak weg dus schiet niet op.

Totale reistijd van deur tot deur incl. incheckcircus: 7.5 uur. Beetje langzaam voor nog geen 500 kilometer. 

Volgende keer met de auto via de kanaaltunnel proberen of 's-nachts met Stenaline vanaf Hoek van Holland met de auto.

items.title: Hope they will go bankrupt
items.review_text: Well! I'm travelling with eurostar every weekend from Brussels to Amsterdam and back! This company keeps on lying about the deelays that they know about but play like.they didn't.  When you're almost at the destination they will tell you 20 minutes deelay and after the 20 minutes there will be an extra 30 minutes! It's not first and neither last time when it happens! And they didn't even give you a water bottle or anything! Only to charge you full price for the ticket! I could have paid 30 euro to travel with the IC(intercity) instead of paying 169 euro to have same time and same conditions! I wish they would just stop lying to people and say the real arrival time! Only lying employees at eurostar! Hope they will go bankrupt soon!

items.title: I don’t like the recent woke…
items.review_text: I don’t like the recent woke advertising; I would prefer a larger population to be appealed on for their advertising. I’m doubting whether I will travel on Eurostar with my wife.

items.title: The Eurostar has lost its touch
items.review_text: The Eurostar once offered a delightful travel experience, thanks to its friendly staff and convenient journey. However, that has now changed. Passengers face incredibly long queues with insufficient seating, particularly on the French side, as well as frequent strikes and technical issues that have made the service completely unpredictable. Although investments are expected to improve the situation post-Olympics (I am told), currently, the Eurostar has unfortunately lost its touch.

items.title: What a great team on this Eurostar…
items.review_text:
What a great team on this Eurostar journey. Polite, effective , attentive and downright feel-good! 

Great journey - thanks to you!

12/03/2024 1804 London to Brussels

items.title: Very long queues, non-prohibited items confiscated
items.review_text: A disgraceful experience. Waited 2 hours in the multiple chaotic queues despite arriving earlier than the directed time. The excuse given was "strict border controls". Then had small kitchen (pairing knives) confiscated despite not being listed as prohibited items. The train eventually departed over 40 minutes late. Never again. I'd recommend flying.

items.title: Capacity, behavior and technology sloppiness
items.review_text: Frequently issues with the passport machine and notoriously bad behaved staff treating clients as cattle. Always long queues and what could be a fast check in makes the total journey twice as long an experience as the 2.18 hours crossing. Such a shame for what really is the best way to travel across. And yes.  Brexit is the route course - but that’s a while ago now

items.title: Goede service
items.review_text: Goede service, behulpzaam personeel (Akim) en comfortabele seating area. Aanrader. Zeker omdat je heerlijk in London aan boord gaat en in één zucht in Rotterdam uitstapt. Perfect alternatief voor vliegen👍

items.title: bad customer service and delays
items.review_text: terrible customer service, train was changed last minute to a smaller train and got kicked off it even when people behind us could just walk on and get a and we were changed to the next train with hours to wait in between

items.title: We reisden met 6 personen naar Disney…
items.review_text: We reisden met 6 personen naar Disney Parijs. 3 van ons in wagon 37 en 3 kinderen in wagon 38. Het stoelnummer wat 1 van de kinderen kreeg, bestond niet eens. Elke keer werd hij weggestuurd van de lege stoel die hij kon vinden door de mensen die die stoel geboekt hadden. Logisch natuurlijk! Maar een zéér slechte zaak! Ik kreeg een mail voor een review. Deze bleek maar een paar dagen geldig. Mijn klacht (een dag later) gemaild naar de klantenservice. Deze vertelde dat de reis al geweest was en ze niks voor ons konden betekenen...! Gelijk weer gemaild en gevraagd of er een compensatie voor werd geboden. 10 dagen later nog geen reactie!

items.title: Pire que la SNCF et le RER Parisien ??!!
items.review_text:
Le service de train le plus pathétique que j'ai vu de toute ma vie et pourtant j'ai pris le Rer B et un train SNCF juste avant...

Un retard de plus de 50 minutes, on nous a entassé sur un quai bondé en criant des ordres inaudibles, tandis que l'annonce au micro prévenait que le train était sur le point de partir. On a dû courir sur 500 mètres pour atteindre notre voiture avec la peur au ventre de le voir partir.

Le voyage retour c'est mieux passé mais 35 minutes de retard, j'ai failli rater ma correspondance...

Quand je rentre chez moi, on m'annonce que je peux réclamer une compensation pour le retard ! Tout de même ! Ah mais non car je ne peux plus accéder a mon billet qui a tout simplement disparu de mon application sncf connect car le train est considéré comme "annulé" d'après le site Eurostar. Mon billet a tout simplement été supprimé...

items.title: CANCELLED TRIP AND NO REFUND!!!!
items.review_text: I have called several times contacted you on all platforms and still have no refund nearly two weeks later! You take peoples money and don’t refund us or offer us some sort of compensation for the situation you put me and my boyfriend through. Us and 16,000 others have also been effected on the weekend of new years but there’s no excuse for leaving us in the dark and being told to wait 30 days!!! Honestly if I could leave no stars I would we arrived at the station about an hour and a bit before as stated to arrive at least an hour before to then get told 10 minutes after check in all trains are cancelled! Not only have we travelled over an hour to get to St Pancras we also very kindly got a lift from my dad who did a round trip journey so ended up driving for over two hours for no reason! Also as young travellers who have family’s who also were affected and not being able to sleep due to the circumstances the early morning. I would like a proper apology and a date on when I’m going to get my refund! Please book a flight instead of travelling with Eurostar it’s much cheaper and more likely not to cancel last minute!

items.title: Staggering levels of incompetence
items.review_text: Staggering levels of incompetence.  Refuse to refund a Premium Business ticket which was never used.  Impossible to deal with.  I will never travel with them again.

items.title: Fundamentally flawed. High chance of being stranded.
items.review_text:
I've been using eurostar for a few years now having taken a low carbon approach to travel. We've just had to take a massive self-organized diversion, lost hundreds of pounds in making that work and had 24 hours of stress getting it sorted.

On the face of it eurostar should be the best option.

The biggest flaw is that eurostar will just cancel trains when trouble happens and (this is the bit that counts) they won't then run the train later.

READ THIS CAREFULLY: eurostar has NO meaningful spare capacity. They actually scrapped their spare trains. That means that you will have to find an alternative plan yourself. They literally have no plan to run trains late or add capacity. Monumentally stupid.

Already overseas? Stranded.

On the way to christmas? Tough luck.

It gets worse....

Their terminals at both ends are far too small and understaffed. We often turn up and after spending an hour at passport control we then end up standing in overcrowded departure lounges with limited toilets and seating. Not good if you are tired, have kids, unwell, etc.

And as they have a monopoly, they can charge whatever they want.

We really need an alternative competitor and we also need a sensible way for the governments involved to regulate the eurotunnel and the terminals.

items.title: More helpful than they needed to be
items.review_text: I recently made a mistake, booked my Eurostar on the wrong day and missed the train. Although they're not required to do so, Eurostar switched me to the correct date to help me out. Great service. Thank you.

items.title: Eurostar raakt bagage kwijt en betaalt kosten koerier niet
items.review_text: Ik betaalde 100 euro voor het transport van mijn fiets. Toen ik vanuit London in Brussel aankwam bleek de fiets op de trein naar Parijs te zijn aangekomen. Ik kon niet tot de volgende dag wachten in Brussel. Het personeel was verder heel vriendelijk. Men vertelde mij telefonisch dat ik zelf een koerier moest regelen om de fiets naar Nederland te brengen, omdat Eurostar daar zelf geen contract mee had. Ik zou de rekening naar Eurostar moeten sturen. Ik bracht ze vooraf op de hoogte van het gegeven dat dat ongeveer 260 euro zou kosten. Dat was akkoord. Ik heb nu zelf de koerier betaald en de factuur naar het opgegeven mailadres gestuurd, maar nu een maand later heb ik nog niets gehoord, ook geen bevestiging.

items.title: Overcharges
items.review_text: I have travelled numerous times on Eurostar.  It has a monopoly and abuses that position; over-charging because it can, poor customer service (poor service online - the people on the ground are mostly fine), very bad communications (eg getting a text 30 minutes before check-in that all trains that day cancelled, which they'd known for several hours previously), poor infrastructure (lounges are overcrowded and uncomfortable).  Once you're finally on European trains you see the contrast!

items.title: Eurostar Bruxelles-Amsterdam
items.review_text: Vous indiquez qu’il faut être là une demi-heure à l’avance alors que ce n’est pas nécessaire pour les eurostars qui ne partent pas pour Londres. Vous aviez plus d’une demi-heure de retard. Nous avons donc attendus dans le froid beaucoup trop longtemps pour un train pourtant réservé tout en regardant le précédent partir sans pouvoir y monter… De plus, une fois dans le train, étant donné qu’il avait du retard, il n’est pas allé jusqu’à son terminus. Nous avons donc payé une place assise et extrêmement chère pour se retrouver debout pendant plus d’une heure dans un autre train malgré des problèmes de santé importants au niveau des genoux car tout notre train s’est retrouvé entassé avec les voyageurs d’un autre… Je trouve inadmissible de payer une telle somme pour un service aussi médiocre. Remboursement partiel impossible à demander, je suis extrêmement déçue par la compagnie et ne suis pas prête d’y reprendre un billet.

items.title: Dr. Malcolm come to me
items.review_text:
Wifi is, as Dr.Malcolm would put it: "a big pile of s.h.*.t"

For the price, you should have your own personal satellite.

items.title: Tristes et mécontents
items.review_text: Nous avons pris le Thalys pour nous rendre à Paris, d'où nous décollions vers la Guadeloupe. Pour le retour, nous avions 2h de battement entre l'atterrissage et le Thalys. Air France a accusé un retard de plus d'une heure, donc nous avons raté notre Thalys de 5 min! Le Thalys de l'heure suivante étant annulé, nous avons dû patienter 2h à la gare du Nord. Et après tout ce stress, nous avons pu monter dans le Thalys suivant moyennant un paiement de 120€ par personne ! Plus cher que le prix à l'aller 😒. Nous sommes conscients que le retard n'est pas dû à Eurostar, mais pourquoi ne pas faire preuve d'indulgence ? A l'avenir  nous irons,à Paris en voiture...Cela nous coûtera bien moins cher...

items.title: I booked a weekend Disney break for 6…
items.review_text:
I booked a weekend Disney break for 3 adults and 3 children, Disney can't/won't book two family rooms on one booking - so two bookings.  In their wisdom they placed two adults and one child in one coach, and one adult and two children in another coach.  We needed to be in the same coach.

Disney couldn't change it - speak with Eurostar.  Euorstar couldn't change it due to a Disney fault with booking - speak with Eurostar.  Repeat this conversation THREE times.

We had no hope - Until Hannah at Eurostar customer service got hold of it.  She couldn't solve the problem, but promised to stay on the case.  Two days later she emailed new bookings with all of the family seated together AND then phoned to make sure we were all okay with the changes.  She did this on the St Pancras leg, the Lille leg and the return trip.

Brilliant service from Hannah - take note Eurostar colleagues and Disney staff !  Hannah knows the meaning of customer service.  Thank you Hanna.

items.title: Eurostar, les enfants d'abord !!!
items.review_text:
Que de galères avec Eurostar !!!
Qu'il y ait des problèmes d'inondation des voies, ok. Visiblement ils ont fait le nécessaire pour que des trains repartent aujourd'hui mais nous avons des amis qui sont partis depuis hier . Ils ont dû prendre un hôtel à Lille et maintenant ils sont en train de faire la queue avec un bébé de 1 an et ce que je trouve scandaleux c'est qu'ils ne sont pas prioritaires. On leur a répondu 'on fait ce qu'on peut madame '
Un peu de bon sens s'il vous plaît.
A l'aéroport les familles avec jeunes enfants passent en premier.

items.title: Ive had the best experience with Akim
items.review_text: Ive had the best experience with Akim. We had a good talk about several subjects: life, theater etc. I felt very comfortable and the whole check in progress also went great. Recommend Eurostar!!

items.title: Appalling lack of communication to customers when things go wrong
items.review_text:
When there are major delays, the lack of information to passengers is appalling. If there is an email or text to my phone it is almost when the trai. Was supposed to be leaving. Yet I read about the major delays on news websites, with articles dated many hours before. There are seemingly no communications or backup plans - they just seen to wing it and tell the customers little or nothing.

WiFi service on the trains is appallingly bad.

Also the departure lounges in London Paris are always overcrowded as they don't provide adequate seating (the Paris lounge is simply awful, with uncomfortable benches with no back support).

Frankly, Eurostar needs to realise that they are in competition with multiple airlines (and even ferries) rather than thinking that they have a monopoly (for now) on the rail route.

I hear that National Express and a European rail operator are plotting a competing passenger rail service through the tunnel, and frankly Eurostar needs this kick up the backside.

items.title: KATASTROPHE Würde es keinem empfehlen
items.review_text:
KATASTROPHE Würde es keinem empfehlen. Es ist sehr unorganisiert und chaotisch!!
Es ist eine reine Abzockerei und niemand vom Personal hilft dir!

items.title: Eurostar is the worst provider I have…
items.review_text: Eurostar is the worst provider I have ever encountered. When things go wrong they don't help. The refund policy is a joke and I would not be booking with them every again. They have more catches and cons than that Irish airline! Please avoid using them and hope a new company comes in and destroys the business.

items.title: Net te laat
items.review_text:
Storing van de trein waardoor we 3.30 uur in Brussel bij een zelfgeregeld hotel incheckte ipv ons hotel in Londen. 
Daarna 5 min te laat gemeld de volgende dag bij de incheck balie .. en geen compassie. Regels zijn regels.. te laat is te laat. Jammer.

items.title: Never had a problem!
items.review_text:
Never had a problem!
I use Eurostar about 10  times a year for many years, always been fine.
Best to try to use Standard Premier class iff poss, better seats, quieter .
The Eurostar station in London can get really crowded though.  Still better than flying

items.title: London Amsterdam 3/91
items.review_text:
London Amsterdam 3/91 
The coach is very cold 
When we came in France 
They sent allert message I don’t why 
And all people went in panic
Now we are stop in Brussel from30 minute becouse threre is a problem 
I advice 
Don’t waste money 
Too many problem 
Rating 1

items.title: Ce sont vraiment des varcreux
items.review_text: Erreur de reservation, ils veulent meme pas l’annuler ni de remboursement, incroyable

items.title: EUROSTAR IS EEN SCHANDE VOOR ONS PLANEET…
items.review_text:
Ik heb een ticket van antwerpen naar parijs geboekt, per ongeluk cancelled 
Ik kreeg een mail van geen geld terug dus ook geen trein €250 de vuilbak in 
Ik bel ze op en horen zeggen dat het mijn eigen schuld is 
Schande

items.title: Arnaque pure et simple.
items.review_text: Erreur de sens de voyage (Londres-Paris au lieu de Paris-Londres) dans plus de 3 mois. On appelle 10mn après s’en être rendu compte et échange impossible. 400€ dans le vent. Dans quel monde vit-on ? C’est tout simplement lamentable.

items.title: US visitors have bad Eurostar experience
items.review_text:
We are from the US and had heard so many good things about Eurostar.  Well we had a horrible experience on Dec. 21 returning to the UK from Paris.
The 11:00 train left the Gare du Nord ( I later read that no trains left after 10:30 due to the strike).  We got to the tunnel around 12:00 and the train stopped due to the strike.  We sat there for about 30 minutes then they announced that we were returning to Paris.  When we arrived at Gare du Nord there wasn't anyone to help passengers get to their destination.  Flights to London began to go quickly and we ended up spending $700 between taking the metro to Montparnasse, a train to Nantes, a taxi to the airport and a flight on EasyJet to
Gatwick ( the flight was delayed 4 hrs.).  We arrived at Gatwick at 4:00am.  It was the worst travel day!!!
All that Eurostar refunded us was $198 ( not half of the round trip fare).  They do not answer my inquiries and have not compensated us for anything else.
After reading some of the reviews it sounds like they have no concern for their passengers.  I will never use them again.

items.title: Vreselijke organisatie
items.review_text:
Vreselijk organisatie, ga nooit meer met Eurostar...

We hadden zondag 28 januari de trein terug vanuit Londen naar Amsterdam, heerlijk zou het zijn rechtstreeks met de trein weer terug naar Amsterdam. 

Tot dat je net voorbij Brussel stil komt te staan, daar begon de pech… Wij waren aan het reizen met baby van 8 maanden, dus je begrijpt die wilt niet meer te lang stil zitten en is al lekker aan het rondkruipen… Dus het zou in principe goed te doen zijn die paar uurtjes… Maar niet als er opeens een paar uur extra bijkomen.. 2,5 a 3 uur stonden we stil in Mechelen. Je mag de trein niet uit en het enige wat we toen kregen was een Kitkat ter compensatie… Na die paar uur wachten werd er omgeroepen dat we terugrijden naar Brussel en dat er geen treinverkeer meer verder gaat naar Amsterdam… Door de machinist werd ook omgeroepen dat je of hotel verblijf kon regelen of taxi verder en dat dat volledig vergoed zou worden vanuit Eurostar… Wij hebben gekozen dus om met de taxi te gaan omdat we ook onze baby mee hebben en die was het al aardig zat en had ook niet meer genoeg voeding mee. Nu puntje bij paaltje, krijgen we niet eens de helft terug van onze taxi rit terwijl we ook nog een andere treinreiziger met ons hebben meegenomen… Ook kunnen we geen wachtcompensatie krijgen voor de 2,5 uur die we hebben stilgestaan in Mechelen… 
Belachelijk allemaal, wij zijn woest!!!

items.title: Pray nothing goes wrong...
items.review_text: Their response to dealing with compensation caused by the strike on the 21st December has been a sad indictment of privatisation and this company's approach to customer service.  I am £250 out of pocket from having to make alternative arrangements to get back to Edinburgh before Christmas, something they could not guarantee as the first available train after the strike was called, was the last one out of Paris on the 24th.  There was no connecting train to Edinburgh getting in before Christmas.  So they have offered me £10 for subsistence, and won’t even provide an email I need from my insurance company stating how long the delays were for those affected on the 21st.  Put this in public ownership like sensible countries do and let’s have decent public oversight rather than obscene profits taking 1/4 billion from the system and providing appalling service when things go wrong

items.title: Mauvais service client. èges et places plus…
items.review_text: L'eurostar a des sièges et places plus petits que dans les TGV français. Pas de place pour de grandes valises un peu lourdes. Et vous vous faites engueuler comme un chien par un contrôleur si vous avez le malheur de la laisser sur la plate-forme (vaste, elle) alors qu'il n'y a personne et que le Bruxelles-Paris est direct. Pas confortable. Double contrôle. Mauvais service client et double assurance qu'on a bien payé par contre.

items.title: £500 down and no reply after submitting expenses/compensation claim
items.review_text: On my journey from London to Brussels, there was a one hour delay because there was a tresspaser on the tracks. They get us to leave the train to 'check the train's but let us back on after 20 minutes and no visible checks ... So on top of a delay, I spent my entire outbound journey feeling unsafe. On the day we were due to return to London, we find out on the news that the service is likely to be delayed/cancelled due to flooding. We received no push notifications on the app or any email or text communication regarding this information. Had we found out right away, we might have been able to book onto a train the next day (there was one train showing as available but the app would not allow us to book it). Our whole last day was spent panicking about how we would get home. We decided to the train station and were informed about the compensation for accomodation/meals/taxis, so once our train was formally cancelled, we rebooked a train for two days later (this was the earliest availabile train). We had to spend £500 for two extra days in Brussels, not to mention spending New Year's away from home and missed flight from London on New Year's Eve. I didn't even receive a confirmation email for my compensation/expenses claim. Yet my friend who tweeted Eurostar on Twitter received a response right away. They care more about protecting their image than refunding people who had to spend money unwillingly. Can I please get a response for an immediate refund of my expenses.

items.title: The Absolute Worst - DO NOT USE!!!!
items.review_text: This was our first time travelling with Eurostar-so super excited. All went well till our return journey home. We get an email minutes before we arrived at the Paris Gare Du Noord station, to not come to the station as the trains been cancelled. We had already checked out off our hotel, it was the weekend before Xmas and we had family coming from South Africa on the 22nd Dec. Eurostar staff at the station said they could not help us as there were no alternate trains-they were fully booked for the next 3 days. We had to find alternative ways of getting back home to London (flight to Dublin then to Heathrow). Eventually got home on the 22nd Dec, meeting our family at Heathrow, absolutely shattered. Eurostar website and staff advised what they can reimburse us for. On the 2nd Jan '24 I put in my claims, received my case no. etc. Went back and forth with the Eurostar staff as their system is so old it was not accepting the receipt attachments. Eventually managed to email them across. Received a further email on the 30th Jan '24 that they have initiated our reimbursements and to allow 28 WORKING DAYS for it to reflect..which was going to be the 08th March '24. I rang them today, the 07th March '24, as I havent received it yet. Only to be told by Anamika that the reimbursement was rejected by their finance team. Apparently WE ABANDONED Eurostar by taking a flight home instead of waiting for Eurostar to find us a train journey home!! How furious I am!! Our travel insurance has been waiting for Eurostar to pay what they could and then the balance could be paid by the travel insurance. Anamika is to send me a letter today by 3pm stating that NOTHING is being paid by Eurostar so I can send this to our travel insurance. All I got was an apology. What else can you expect from a French Freakin' company! No wonder we left the EU! Do Not Use them!! Zero Stars!!

items.title: Slechte service
items.review_text:
Slechte service! Wij hebben op de Eurostar website gekeken hoe onze zoon van 15 naar London kan reizen. Daarvoor moet je bepaalde formulieren invullen, handtekening zetten en een copy van je paspoort meegeven. Alles gedaan en de trip naar London ging helemaal soepel. Maar bij de terugreis werd ons zoontje verteld dat hij niet zonder begeleiding naar Nederland mocht terugreizen. Hij mocht mee naar Brussel en daar moest hij eruit. Hij had overigens een kaartje inclusief stoelreservering van London naar Rotterdam gekocht. 
In Brussel is hij ook daadwerkelijk uit de trein gezet en kon hij daar 90 minuten wachten op de volgende trein die naar Rotterdam ging.
We hebben het zelf opgelost door ons zoontje zelf telefonisch te begeleiden naar een reguliere trein die binnen 20 minuten zou vertrekken naar Rotterdam. Dat is gelukt. Lange reis voor hem maar hij zat warm, droog en veilig in de trein. 
Aan Eurostar hebben we niets gehad. Zijn niet telefonisch te bereiken en per e-mail kregen we het antwoord dat op de website staat dat jongeren onder 16 niet durect van en naar  Nederland en Engeland mag reizen. Dat staat inderdaad heeelemaal onder aan de site als een korte voetnoot. En uiteraard, nu we om een refund vragen voor het ticket omdat hij uit de trein gezet is (15 jaar en alleen hè) en hij dus geen gebruik heeft mogen maken van zijn stoel, is het antwoord ook ‘Het stond op de website dus geen refund’. Wat een waardeloze service! Wel het ticket verkopen en vervolgens een jochie van 15 op station Brussel eruit zetten! Echt zeer schandalig en onhumaan! Ja regels zijn regels maar er zijn ook omstandigheden die wellicht om wat flexibiliteit vragen! Nooit meer Eurostar!

items.title: Eurostar has become shockingly bad lately
items.review_text: Years ago, Eurostar used to be great: a reliable service for travel between Paris, Lille or Calais to London in style and comfort. But not now, not any more. They changed the rules about frequent traveller points expiry, without advising of new expiry date following the pandemic. Despite my email address being correct and registered as my preferred means of communication. When I booked a trip 1st time following the pandemic, 16 months ago, I saw that all my points had been deleted just a week earlier. Had they emailed me to warn of imminent points expiry as they should have, I could have saved my points. Customer Service refused point blank to admit fault, and refused point blank to reinstate lost points. Now there are fewer trains - which are more crowded - and intermediate stations of Calais Ashford and Ebbsfleet are now closed (I used to use Calais Frethun station regularly years ago back in the years when I was a “Carte Blanche” holder). When I last travelled with them in October 2022, I found the Gare du Nord was overcrowded, lack of staff, lack of facilities, on the train the standard of service in Standard Premier was "nul", no magazines, surly & unmotivated staff. Return journey: St Pancras horrendous long queue and wait for security & passport checks (Brexit?) waiting area overcrowded facilities reduced: couldn't buy newspapers or magazines & bar replaced with inferior snacks outlet. Impossible to find any staff. herded up the ramp to the platform like so many cattle. I have not travelled Eurostar since then (a year and 4 months ago) although I have visited the UK many times recently, travelling instead by driving and via the Shuttle. So that Eurostar has lost my custom mostly on account of refusing to admit their system at fault / failing to send automated emails and refusing to re-instate my lost points. My subsequent exchange with "customer service" merely enraged me further by their attitude and unwillingness to even look into the problem. I will never travel with them again. (Note "Date of Experience" was actually in October 2022)

items.title: Eurostar: A Fall from Grace
items.review_text:
Living in the UK with my family in Belgium I have used the Eurostar countless times in the last 10+ years. It used to be the BEST way to travel. 

Unfortunately, in the last few years it has completely started to unravel: not only is it incredibly expensive, every time I travel the service is worse. Their WORST issue is that they have 0 communication when things go wrong - my husband's train was cancelled due to the strikes on the 21st of December and mine was cancelled due to the flooding on the 30th; both times it was handled terribly by Eurostar with the website crashing as I tried to rebook and no way to to get in touch and not being told of the cancellation until we were heading out to the train (even though the news was reporting all trains were cancelled for the day, Eurostar claimed trains were still running on time).

Both my husband and I had to book last minute flights this holiday due to their incompetence which I HATE for the planet, but Eurostar really needs to get it together.

items.title: Absolutely disgraceful from start to…
items.review_text: Absolutely disgraceful from start to finish. Unhelpful, rude staff……..etc. etc. etc. I would never use it again. First class paid for.   What a joke.

items.title: Disappointing from start to finish
items.review_text: Disappointing from start to finish

items.title: A Great Service
items.review_text: I have travelled with Eurostar twice now and have found staff very helpful, they helped us change our train without any extra cost. Thank you to the man who helped us in Brussels.

items.title: I did not enjoy my experience
items.review_text:
I did not enjoy my experience, Rotterdam to London! I arrived in more than 30 minutes before hand on another train. I went to the platform...it wasn't clear where to go so I stayed near the platform. I went to the WC which is outside the turn styles. Came back out about 19 minutes before the train time and the doors were shut. There was no line and the staff pointed me where to go to wait for the security line to reopen, but kindly told me they would do nothing to check me in...again no line, the train had not even arrived, but they refused to check me in. I had to watch my train arrive and leave while standing in an empty line 30 ft frome the train to go through their security checkpoint / customs. Maybe they all go on break after the 30 min before the train leaves threshold. 

The excuse was that the security team leaves the train area!!! I had to wait 2 hours in the freezing cold because they refused to check me in. A smal amout of human compassion would have been wonderful. I could understand if there was a gigantic line, but no, it was empty. No concept of customer sevice! They did rebook me on the next train but I missed an important meeting with my boss. I don't know if it is a rule is rules thing or if they are just being difficult. 

The experience was the opposite in London, people were working to get people through the long lines and someone even helped me with a ticket problem I had.

I think I'll be taking the airport next time, and only using this at last resort.

- A very cold and disatisfied customer.

items.title: Terrible Service
items.review_text: I submitted a refund request and was told to wait 28 days. No one got back to me. I think they just hope people forget or give up.

items.title: This is the filthiest train I’ve ever…
items.review_text:
This is the filthiest train I’ve ever seen. I can’t even see an out the window.
Come on guys…I prefer train travel to air but it’s pointless if you can’t see out the window…..

items.title: Het is niet meer mogelijk om met 4…
items.review_text: Het is niet meer mogelijk om met 4 personen een “viertje” te boeken. We zitten verspreid over de hele coupé.

items.title: Un vrai supplice que ce voyage à côté…
items.review_text: Un vrai supplice que ce voyage à côté des portes de la voitures qui s'ouvraient plusieurs fois toutes les minutes

items.title: ABSOLUTE CRIMINAL RIP OFF
items.review_text: Last Saturday we were travelling across France to get the 3.12 Eurostar from Paris to London. Our TGV was delayed over an hour and we weren't going to make it. I phoned Eurostar and was told only 8 seats available on the 5 and none on the 7 o'clock I was strongly advised to take 4 tickets at £ 650!!!! as if Not they would go and we'd be stuck in Paris with 2 young children until the next day. She told me if I go to the stations Eurostar office they would charge me around £ 50 each to go on the next available train which wouldn't be until the next day,  I was about to pay when I lost signal. I got through about 10 minutes later to be told only 5 seats available and now £ 1050.00.  Again as no other option I was going to pay, lost signal again. We went to the Eurostar office at the Gard du Nord where we we're given 4 seats together on a table FOR FREE as there was plenty of seats available, I asked and yes plenty of space on the 7 o'clock also. On return to the UK I  phoned Eurostar and complained, was told someone would come straight back to me with an explanation, they didn't. I phoned the next day, explained again. Was told they would escalate and come back to me, they didn't. Phoned again, guaranteed someone would contact me within 72 hours. They didn't. I phoned again, not at any time did anyone I spoke to know what I was talking about, no one took any notes, no one had any intention of getting back to me. At every opportunity when I phoned from the TGV I was lied to and would have been ripped off, apparently according to the person I spoke to today none of the 3 staff knew about 'hotnat' where they should have transferred for free. However, the lad I spoke to earlier, after the event knew all about it in detail.. they had me at a disadvantage, took every opportunity to try and rip me off and when I complained had no intention of ever getting back to me. Have been told basically, oh well nothing we can do about that. rubbish.

items.title: Heb een kaartje gekocht van Antwerpen…
items.review_text: Heb een kaartje gekocht van Antwerpen naar Zwolle ,Bij het opstappen vraag ik nog of het de goed trein is en reeds vertrokken blijkt dat ik nog een kaartje moet kopen van Antwerpen naar Zwolle omdat het de euro star is , ben nu voor een enkele reis Antwerpen Zwolle 126 euro kwijt , oplichters!!!!

items.title: Quel service déplorable
items.review_text: Quel service déplorable : retard, aucun WIFI, bar fermé évidemment a l intérieur.

items.title: Great!
items.review_text: Fast service between London and Paris, and return. Very pleased with the fare.

items.title: Toilets and seats areas are dirty
items.review_text:
Toilets and seats areas are dirty. 
Also, €7.20 for a normal black coffee and a pain aux raisins !!!!?

items.title: Not even a bench to seat in the cold to…
items.review_text: Not even a bench to seat in the cold to wait for them to let you check-in in Paris Gare du Nord. Such a joke given the price paid.

items.title: Complaint Regarding Eurostar Travel Experience - Booking Reference 4F4D2Nr Customer Service,
items.review_text:
Eurostar Customer Service,

As a frequent Eurostar traveller, I am writing to express my disappointment and frustration with the handling of my current journey on Eurostar, specifically regarding the trip from Bruxelles-Midi to London St Pancras, booked under the reference 4F4D2N.

Despite my efforts to adhere to Eurostar's check-in time, which mandates closure of ticket gates 30 minutes prior to departure, myself, along with several other passengers, encountered an unforeseen delay originating from a situation on a connecting train from Antwerp. 

This delay, attributed to an incident involving a man wielding a knife, necessitated the cancellation of the train.

Consequently, we were redirected to an alternative train, which arrived at Bruxelles-Midi at 18:26. While this arrival time falls outside the prescribed check-in window, it is important to note that this delay was primarily due to Eurostar's own delay of 13 minutes. This delay shifted our arrival within the 30-minute check-in window, as per Eurostar's policy.

In light of these circumstances, it is disheartening and deeply frustrating that despite my efforts to comply with Eurostar's regulations, I was denied boarding at the ticket gates. This refusal, compounded by the absence of any queue at the security checkpoint and the emptiness of the station, highlights a lack of flexibility and understanding on Eurostar's part in accommodating passengers faced with unforeseen challenges.

Furthermore, the option presented to us for rebooking our tickets, particularly the cost associated with upgrading to business class at 300 euros so we could still catch the train on time, only serves to my dissatisfaction with the overall handling of the situation. 

It is unreasonable and unjustifiable to impose such penalties on passengers who have already endured significant inconvenience and distress.

Moreover, the fact that I am now forced to wait for over two hours for the next train is nothing short of scandalous. 

This additional delay further compounds the inconvenience I’ve already experienced, demonstrating a disregard for customer well-being.

In light of the above, I urge Eurostar to reconsider its stance on this matter and to provide a fair and reasonable resolution. I demand a full refund of the original ticket price, as well as compensation for the distress caused by Eurostar's failure to provide adequate service. 

Additionally, I strongly advise Eurostar to review and revise its policies and procedures to ensure that instances of gross negligence and disregard for customer well-being are not repeated in the future.

I anticipate a prompt response to this complaint and expect Eurostar to take immediate action to rectify the situation.

Yours sincerely,
Florence Carlier

items.title: Amsterdam to London.......18 and a half hours
items.review_text:
I am not really sure where or how to start but without question this was the worst experience I have ever encountered in both the travel industry but also in customer service.
My return journey from AMS to LON on 19 January was due to depart at 18.45 and arrive into LON @ 21.57.
The check-in at AMS is awful. Very cramped and uncomfortable with no express lane for Premier passengers. That was the least of my troubles....

We left on time and stopped in Rotterdam. We are now bound for Brussels and onwards to London via Lille. And this is where the horror began.
About 10 miles outside of BRU we came to an abrupt stop. It was clear something was wrong but no information.......and so the saga began.
Every so often there was a very unclear, illogical announcement made by the Train Manager. The long and short of this.......the train had broken down and we had to be towed to BRU by a "rescue locomotive."
Members of the Red Cross arrived on the train about an hour later and started handing out water......this was obviously quite serious. And so we sat in the cold with no power on the train. Toilets are now becoming very nasty and so the night pushed on....
Ok, lets try to make this brief.
The story goes on through the night and we finally get towed to BRU and arrive at 03.15!!!!! We have been on the train 8 and a half hours. We have been told to find a hotel if we can or sleep in the station!
When we are finally allowed off the train into Brussels Midi we arrive in a waiting area which is sealed. We cannot leave the station. There is no information, no Eurostar representation.......a couple of pretty angry looking men in some sort of uniform. People are now getting very upset, shouting and children crying.
After yet a further delay we are allowed into the arrivals are and basically go find yourself a hotel.

So I stayed at the Park Inn at Midi Station and finally reached my room at 04.20 due to the huge number of people who had booked the same hotel. While I was waiting to check in, I noticed 4 staff member from the train who were sitting in the lobby bar having a lovely time and a few glasses of wine.

5 hours later I returned to the station in the hope of getting back to London. I am rebooked into Coach 2 seat 28. The train arrives late (no information of course that the train is delayed 25 minutes) and I go to my seat. I am travelling in Premier for a bit o f extra space and a light meal.
Once we had departed BRU the staff came along with the meal/ drinks trolley. The woman serving my area started asking if you wanted chicken or falafel. The man next to me took the chicken, then it is my turn. Having put the tray down in front me she looks again and says......"you were on the train last night. What are you doing in this seat? You are not supposed to be on this train.......give me back the meal tray!"
I have NEVER been so shocked. She was aggressive, rude, openly hostile and a disgrace. She also wanted to take back the meal from the man next to me but he had already started eating. The 2 guys opposite had also been delayed overnight and she refused to serve them.
I was told she was going to speak to the Train Manager about me! About what?? I was sitting in the seat on my new ticket..........but during the boarding process which was total chaos they changed the coach numbers around to try and keep today's clients separate from yesterday's stranded people.
Apparently we had all caused big problems by not listening to the announcements. I was in Coach 2.....but by some act of God it was no Coach 15!!! How do you know this and why???

I will not bother to write more because if you are still reading you have probably fallen off your chair.
Today's train was due into London at 11.57......we finally crawled in at 12.32.
Amsterdam to London in a mere 18 and a half hours. 
Out of pocket for hotel and food.
Verbally abused by a staff member.
4 hours sleep in a hotel at Midi station BRU.

The situation was pretty dreadful but things go wrong when travelling. BUT Eurostar make a bad situation into a horror story. They simply do not care what happens to you and the "duty of care" does not exist to this company.
Thanks for reading!

items.title: BEWARE: Train cancellations come with little communication and additional costs that they will refuse to cover!
items.review_text:
Trains cancelled two days in a row with no communication beyond a text and email. Their contact centre was overwhelmed and could not take further calls - the lines also remained open strictly within their stated business hours. 

The website provided no live updates on the cancellations and in fact stated that the trains were running.

Essentially you are trapped in the city until the trains run again with little to no information. Details of their compensation policy are also vague - they do not explicitly state what the limits to compensation are so you will likely be hit with additional costs that they will refuse to cover.

items.title: shame on the staff for striking with…
items.review_text: shame on the staff for striking with out notice.

items.title: Cancelled the train 40 minutes before depart
items.review_text:
They cancelled the train 40 minutes before departure time. Passengers stuck in the departure lounge with no way out.

In general eurostar is much more expensive than flying, is slower and now they just cancel trains after passengers have been through passport control. No staff to let passengers out of departure lounger in Rotterdam. TERRIBLE company.

items.title: No wifi
items.review_text: No wifi. Hotspot login cannot open the page because too many redirects occurred. Ex-Thalys train. Get rid of those stuffy trains.

items.title: Victoria at Eurostar Lost Property, St Pancras - 5 star service
items.review_text:
My 16 year old twins left their passports on a train from Brussels. Victoria at Eurostar Lost Property at St Pancras located them. I arranged for DPD Local to collect and deliver. I paid for carriage and an extra £6.00 to increase insurance to £150.00. Victoria kindly packaged them and put label on which I had emailed to her.

Parcel was scanned on collection but not scanned into depot. No further tracking available.

After four months of DPD Local coming up with every excuse under the sun and repeatedly refusing any compensation, I am now to commence legal action against DPD Local and any other company with a similar name.

Top marks to Victoria for being so helpful.

items.title: Nach einer 3 stündigen Verspätung wurde…
items.review_text: Nach einer 3 stündigen Verspätung wurde uns eine Entschädigung versprochen. Diese wurde mir per E-Mail bestätigt, aber das Geld kam nie an. Einfach nur unprofessionell - nie wieder!

items.title: Train en retard de quasi plus d'une…
items.review_text: Train en retard de quasi plus d'une heure sans indemnisation. Personnel qui ne veut pas répondre pas aux clients pour une raison encore à aujourd'hui inconnue. L'attente pour le train Paris-Bruxelles du 8 décembre a été catastrophique. On ne demandait qu'à avoir un ETA sans agressivité malgré le retard et les agents qui nous snobent en rigolant. JE N'AI JAMAIS VU CA.....a quand la concurrence !!!

items.title: Train ride to Paris canceled week…
items.review_text:
Train ride to Paris canceled week before departure, only very early 1st class available for €75 extra per person, lousy service, bad food incl. 1 croissant we had to share.
They have a monopoly and the management doesn’t give a flying fig.

items.title: Nul points
items.review_text:
Nul points. 
Departure lounge overcrowded, noisy, no seats. Chaotic. Resembles a cattle market. Avoid travelling with Eurostar if you can’t afford the outrageous prices for business class. And don’t bother paying extra for Standard Premium. The promises were not kept. A very poor service all round and the management need to get their act together. Paris and Brussels trains need a separate waiting area. The Ryan Air of rail travel.

items.title: Drama trein
items.review_text:
Wc’s te vaak dicht! Te weinig eten mensen konden allemaal fluiten na de broodjes! Overvol! 
 
We wachten juist meer rust te hebben, nou Eurostar jullie doen je heel interessant voor maar this 3x niks met jullie trein!

items.title: Discrimination against a disabled person.
items.review_text: I am a disabled person who booked a ticket to Amsterdam six months prior. I called Eurostar 6 days before my departure to book the special assistance only to be informed that they only provide special assistance for the London leg of the journey and essentially informed me that I am on my own when I arrive at Amsterdam. I explained to the contact centre lady that it is physically impossible for me to walk the length of the platform she was unsympathetic and basically said there’s nothing she could do to help me. Instead gave me the number for what I assume is Amsterdam’s equivalent to National Rail and asked me to sort it myself. I had polio as a child therefore walking is extremely difficult for me and I have post polio syndrome too. So this means every time I walk I feel as though I am going to fall over and I do regularly fall over most days so walking is extremely difficult for me. I walk with a stick all the time but that doesn’t stop me from falling and there’s no trigger. My legs just gives way. Anyway I called the number she gave me but they were also unhelpful. So I tried Eurostar again two days later which is four days before my holiday. This time it was worse. I have never in my life been made to feel like a second class citizen because of my disability and for the first time in my life I was made to feel that way. After 1 hour and 35 mins on the phone and being put on hold several times I was told that there’s nothing they can do because they do not offer disabled assistance in Netherlands. I explained to the lady that they are legally required to as a provider of public transport under the Equalities Act. Nowhere on their website did it say that they do not provide assistance in Netherlands and in fact I have screenshots of their special assistance page that implied that they did for all their routes. The lady then went on to make a judgement and insult me by saying can’t I just use a wheelchair and wheel myself because she sees other disabled people do that. I was so upset by the comment I started to cry. I said how dare she make an assumption like that given that she knew nothing about the nature of my disability. It was the most insensitive thing anyone can say to a disabled person. She then went on to say I had two options. First is to use a foldable wheelchair and wheel myself despite the fact that I already told her it was impossible for me to do because I was travelling in my own with luggage. And the other was to cancel my trip however cos it is less than seven days before departure I will loose my money due to their cancellation policy. I then explained that obviously this is an exception given that I am having to cancel because of them and the fact that they cannot provide a legally required service thereby essentially discriminating against me. She tried to use some silly technicality by saying I should have specified assistance when I was booking the trip and i reminded her that I was never given that option. Plus I read the special assistance section like I always do for any trip I made and it stated that you provided assistance for all the routes, no where did this exclude Amsterdam. At this point I was too upset and was crying cos of the I lack of compassion or empathy from this lady. She said I should take it up with my insurance company if I want my money back or send an email to their complaints team who will get back to me in 28 days. Given that my holiday was in four days I said I refused to accept that because we both know it will be ignored. When I re-iterated how she has treated and insulted my disability she finally felt guilty and said she will raise a case and get someone to come back to me. Anyway she called me ten mins later and said given the situation they will offer me a voucher instead but cannot refund my money. I feel given the way they treated me and that they are breaking the law I expect a full refund because I do not even want to travel with a company that has no compassion for people with disabilities. I will be taking this further and will report Eurostar to the necessary authority body for this discriminatory treatment until I get my money back and an apology.

items.title: Eurostar quelle honte !
items.review_text:
Eurostar prend vraiment ses clients pour des imbéciles ! non seulement ils ne sont absolument pas professionnels mais en plus ils font tout pour que vous ne puissiez pas faire une réclamation. 
J'ai fait une réservation pour partir à Bruxelles mercredi 13 tres tot car j'avais des rendez vous professionnels le matin...non seulement ils annulent le billet au dernier moment et ne font circuler aucun train toute la matinée, mais Ils ont le culot de vous dire que vous pouvez changer votre billet gratuitement ! quel culot !

items.title: Personnel odieux et incompétent
items.review_text:
À Lille, on m’a interdit de monter dans un train pour Bruxelles avec mon chien. Or la règle sur le site d’eurostar est on ne peut plus claire, les chiens sont autorisés à voyager entre la France et la Belgique.
En plus de ne pas connaître le règlement, le personnel a été odieux voire agressif. Je me suis fait crier dessus et me suis sentie insultée. J’attends un remboursement pour le billet du train qu’ils ne m’ont pas autorisé à prendre ainsi que des excuses de la part de ces personnes qui méritent un rappel à l’ordre voire un blâme. Je suis outrée. On ne traite pas sa clientèle de façon aussi humiliante.

items.title: Eric is a superstar
items.review_text: We traveled as a family to Paris on Friday 8th December to celebrate our daughter's 18th birthday. We were looked after by Eric, who was exceptional and made our trip special. I wanted to leave a review to say a big thank you to Eric in particular.

items.title: Zit op het moment van schrijven in de…
items.review_text: Zit op het moment van schrijven in de trein. Parijs naar Schiphol. Bagage moet je in eens meenemen naar je stoel en boven je hoofd maar neer leggen... hoe dan? Daarbij heb ik mijn hond mee, netjes in een reistas zoals verplicht is. Zitten er mensen met honden gewoon op schoot... zeer slecht dat er niets over gezegd wordt. Geef mij de thalys maar weer.

items.title: Trip to Lille!
items.review_text:
I paid for a trip to Lille for 4 of us for my birthday. Booked seats so we could chat, eat and drink together.
Our out bound was ok but on our return when arriving to check in at Lille we found that our seats had changed. I asked why but got no clear answer but was assured that we were all together and that it was just a change of carriage! Once on the train (despite being 50 mins late and with little to no food) this was not the case and we were seperated. Not a good end to our trip. I approached the train manager who agreed that this was not good and I was advised to contact Eurostar on our return for some form of refund and or explanation. Contacting is only via email and despite filling in the appropriate forms and chasing twice I have still had no response. Sloppy to say the least! Poor poor service....

items.title: Heb de terugreis gecancelled, echter beide tickets door Eurostar gecancelled, nog steeds geen geld terug gekregen.
items.review_text:
Heb online een terugreis gecancelled en tijdens proces toezegging gekregen dat de aankoopprijs daarvan terugbetaald wordt. Na online afronding blijken zowel de heen- als terugreis door Eurostar gecancelled te zijn, maar de toezegging blijft maar teruggifte van 1 van de 2 reizen. Ik wacht nog steeds op ontvangst van zelfs de helft van de schade.

2x case aangemaakt op de Eurostar website, na 2 weken nog steeds geen enkele reactie van Eurostar. Thalys reageerde wel altijd veel te laat op problemen, maar reageerde wel en loste het dan op. 
Eurostar laat je gewoon zonder response zitten. Cancellen die hap.

items.title: RETARD !
items.review_text:
RETARD !! mauvaise expérience avec la ligne Paris Amsterdam !! Gros retard à l'arrivée de 1h sans aucune compensation c'est une honte 
Je deconseille vivement

items.title: The service is bad
items.review_text: The service is bad. Staff became even more rude after the merger with Thalys. Carte Blanche membership is becoming almost useless. The benefits are rather on paper than in practice.

items.title: Maandag 4 december vertraging terug 8 december weer??
items.review_text:
Maandag 4 december vertraging naar London oke kan gebeuren nu 8 december terug naar Amsterdam zelfde probleem .
Snelle verbinding van wat ? Snelheid zit er niet in .
Komt niet boven 160km p/u uit.
Fris in coupe'. Slechte wifi. info op tft schermen drama door vertraging geen tijd van aankomt om verder vervoer regelen.onderweg raden waar je bent 
Heen reis geen koffie en warme service .maandag ochtend start begin je met KOFFIE HELAAS  Wel vriendelijk personeel.

items.title: A Nightmarish Journey with Eurostar
items.review_text:
I recently experienced an absolute disaster with Eurostar during my trip from Brussels to London. The train was not only late, causing me significant inconvenience, but I was also stuck in a situation where I had to change my travel plans last minute.

To make matters worse, the Eurostar website claimed I couldn't claim any compensation, despite train conductors announcing on the intercom that passengers were entitled to compensation. This inconsistency in communication and lack of accountability left me frustrated and disappointed and uncomfortable..

Eurostar's handling of this situation was beyond disappointing, and I would caution anyone considering their services to think twice before embarking on a journey with such an unreliable and unresponsive company.

items.title: I can't believe they wouldn't refund…
items.review_text: I can't believe they wouldn't refund our money. I tried contacting them to no avail. It was our honey moon and we was unable to fly out of London due to not having 3 months passport validation. I tried contacting them days before our trip to cancel to no avail, it was near impossible to get in contact with a representative. I just want my refund.

items.title: Arrogant employees
items.review_text:
I am at Gard du Nord. I was told that my train would be late but to queue up for earlier one. When I got to front of line I was let through with no explanation as to what to do next. I simply asked man called Curtis where I wa to go. I then got a lecture in front of everyone that he could not do two things at once in a very patronising manner. He then said arrogantly that I had to wait. As he let me through in first place, with no information all had to was say 2 words Ie go there. 

I thought that I had got a ticket on earlier train and went all the way to the carriage to be told by another arrogant individual that I was still on later train. 

I will Not be using Eurostar again. Your French employees need some training in courtesy when dealing with foreign visitors.

items.title: Je trouve très désagréable d’avoir eu…
items.review_text:
Je trouve très désagréable d’avoir eu 2h de retard en gare et 3h de retard sous le tunnel se qui fait 5h de retard en tout nous étions un groupe de 9 personnes
Donc moi qui détient une carte prioritaire
Et une femme enceinte de 8 mois et trois enfants nous avons vue personne on a même pas proposé une petite bouteille d’eau et trouve que c’est vraiment dommage

items.title: Thalys became Eurostar, a scam
items.review_text: I used to travel with Thalys all the time, their customer service was great and claiming compensation was easy. Since Eurostar took over, claiming compensation or reaching out to customer service is simply impossible. Last Friday, my train was delayed by 5 hours, when I try to claim my compensation, it says: "Sorry, we can’t process your claim". They just want to discourage a client from getting their money back, this is a scam.

items.title: Amsterdam to Paris train is filthy
items.review_text: Amsterdam to Paris train is filthy. Dusty fluff on seats. We don’t know where to sit to avoid it. Then when I asked the controller how come the train is so dirty, he answered in a expedient way that they are more than 30 years old. As if it was a reason to keep them dirty!

items.title: Net buiten Rotterdam staan we weer…
items.review_text:
Net buiten Rotterdam staan we weer stil, hoezo beter voor het klimaat. Vandaag vanaf 11.00 met OV om 17.00 in Brussel te zijn en komen we niet aan.

NS vandaag ook waardeloos!

items.title: Crooks
items.review_text: I was on a train from London to Brussels on 1st December, however due to continuous cancellations, I have only reached my destination on 4th December at night. I've had to pay for three sets of return tickets in UK amounting to £150, which they will not reimburse me for. The night of 2nd December, we were held on the train for 2h30 then told that the train was no longer departing. We were told multiple times that they were going to reimburse me £300 per night for a hotel room. As it was 22:00 and there were UK rail strikes going on, I stayed at a nearby hotel. Now, I am being told that they will not pay me back ANYTHING, costs that they have caused me to incur. This company and their lying staff is to be avoided at all costs - crooks pretending to run a reputable business. Merry Christmas to me being £450 + cost of my ticket out of pocket. Couldn't be more disgusted with your service, you crooks!

items.title: Nicht viel zu meckern
items.review_text: Bei den ganzen negativen Bewertungen frage ich mich gerade, ob wir einfach nur Glück hatten… Allerdings gibt es bei mir nichts negatives zu berichten. 2 Mal auf Eurostar (bzw. Einmal davon mit der Thalys) vertraut - einmal im April nach Paris und zurück und einmal Ende November nach Brüssel und zurück - und beide Male hat alles super geklappt. Ein pünktlicher Zug sowie eine nette Besatzung. Wir würden es wieder machen. Einen Stern Abzug gibt es für die schlechte WLAN Qualität. Jedoch finden wir es ist eine bessere und ökologischer Alternative zum Auto und zum Flieger.

items.title: LA CATA
items.review_text: En terme d'organisation.. l'eurostar fait fort... très fort, pire que la sncf. C'est dire à quel point c'est fort. Quelle honte .. vraiment le 1 étoile c'est gentil

items.title: Eurostar cut the value of loyalty points by half
items.review_text: Eurostar cut the value of loyalty points by more than HALF ! Previously, loyalty card holders could get a free one-way ticket for 450 points, now it is 1000 points! Eurostar has wasted passengers' money on a new logo and a new website. Will Eurostar please publish how much this expense was and how much their executives get paid?

items.title: Terrible terrible terrible
items.review_text: Terrible terrible terrible. Oh how I wished I'd read these reviews before I'd booked. My return was cancelled (from Amsterdam) and though I'd received an email (I was at a concert, a 60th birthday present) I'd obviously not read it (i was at a concert !). No call or text to tell me. Cutting a very long and very stressful story short, it cost us £500 to get home. They did refund the return journey (£188) however but I'm still over £300 out of pocket. Awful awful awful company. 0/10 will never use again.

items.title: Un rachat en mi-teinte
items.review_text: Eurostar vient de racheter Thalys au prix d'une élévation des prix, des conditions. Les retards ne sont plus remboursés au'au bout d'une heure contre 30 mn avant, y compris encore aujourd'hui sur le réseau national.

items.title: Terrible
items.review_text:
Terrible, awful experiece.
Always huge dalays, and filthy trains.
Once I was going from London to Rotterdam.
We were supposed to arrive at 10pm we arrive 9.00 am the day after, what a miserable service

items.title: save yourself the frustration, fly!
items.review_text:
even though the train gets you from Amsterdam to london in one go there are a couple of hurdles to take.
the seats are quite uncomfortable, they recline slightly (actually the seat slides forward) but that doesnt equal comfort.
the trains have on-board wifi but it has awful connection, don't promise me wifi if you can't provide, i would have made other arrangements if i knew i was going to have to listen to a crying baby for 4 hours without being able to stream anything.

the onboard food consists of yesterday's soggy sandwiches for way to much money (€ 7,-) the coffee machine was broken but when it got fixed after brussels the coffee was expensive and horrible (€3,10)

we bought our own snacks and drinks for the return trip, only to find out that the only place to get rid of rubbish is near the toilets, walking in a train is a no-no because i have bad knees.

the positive thing is that you get out in the middle of the city but that is pretty much it, i'm definitely flying next time!

items.title: Volledige re-checkin van de Eurostar…
items.review_text: Volledige re-checkin van de Eurostar naar Londen in Lille. 800 man de trein uit om hun bagage opnieuw door de scanner te halen vanwege 'a security issue '. 1.5 uur vertraging.  Laatste keer met de trein naar Londen.

items.title: Do Not book a package
items.review_text:
I booked a train/hotel package.  Unfortunately I could not travel and asked to cancel.   This was not possible as it was a package, only a voucher could be offered - nothing else.   Voucher expires in 3 months with a loss of all funds.  

Had I booked train only I could have had a full refund.  The package is a scam!!  

Book your hotel separately from Eurostar

items.title: Services between London and Amsterdam…
items.review_text: Services between London and Amsterdam not bookable on certain weekends, Eurostar putting all seats on hold, that is until you get closer to the date then they release them, by which time both the outward and return journey have increased dramatically. Totally incompetent management.

items.title: What a shame!
items.review_text:
What a shame!! They changed their policy on fidelity points where actually now you cannot get any free way at less than 1000 points which were only 500 before without notice! Which mean having spend the 750£ to get one free ticket! This is very unaffordable cost for most of the people and make this transport only for a
Small community

items.title: Dreadful experience
items.review_text: Dreadful experience. Allowed me travel to Paris and then only once we were there did they inform me that our return train was cancelled and we were booked on one the next day. Then the next day, this was cancelled again, with no rebooking. Left 4 mums of young kids stranded overseas. So I’m out of pocket for a hotel night, emergency childcare, 2 taxis and a £160 flight and their website is saying ineligible for compensation. Will be flying or driving in future.

items.title: most insensitive and obstinate customer service EVER
items.review_text: I purchased tickets to travel from Paris to London during December 2021, unfortunately Omicron happened and the UK shut down. I called and messaged Eurostar to get a refund, under obvious circumstances you'd expect to receive relief since I was literally unable to enter the country, Eurostar was a complete disappointment. Never in my life had to deal with a company so irrational and inflexible. I was told my ticket was non-refundable nor transferable from the get go and my only option was to keep pushing out the travel dates to avoid losing my money. I live in the US, chances I will come back to do the exact same route are minimal, but I continued changing dates for almost two years! until November 2023 when Eurostar started trying to charge to update my trip. Called customer service again to get new dates without having to put more money on the tickets, I received no help whatsoever, ended up missing the train and losing my money. This is by far the most unaccommodating company. Covid was a painful experience which should have created conscious to be more understanding. I do not recommend traveling with Eurostar, most insensitive and obstinate customer service EVER.

items.title: Koud en vetraging
items.review_text:
2 keer vertraging van een half uur. Ik had beter een gewone trein genomen, voor de helft van de prijs, denk ik dan.
Bovendien is het hier nog koud ook...

items.title: Brussels Customer Services!
items.review_text: Brussels Customer Services today was rubbish, 2hrs 20 in a queue with one update which had to be asked for. No ability to manage their own team, let alone people waiting. After complaining the member of staff said its been like this for 18years and nothing changes! Not surprised as non of the Board of directors have no customer services outside the rail industry!! Flying next time

items.title: On vous envoie un mail un dimanche soir…
items.review_text:
On vous envoie un mail un dimanche soir pour votre train du Lundi qu’il va être probablement annulé, en raison d’une grève, bien sûr service commercial fermé. 
Vous déplacez votre billet dans l’urgence pour le lendemain à 6h du matin, en fait le train n’était pas annulé et il s’agissait d’une basse manœuvre commerciale car des trains avaient été aussi annulés la veille pour problèmes techniques et ils ont pu ainsi recaser des places de la veille en vous faisant peur 
Le mail ne précisait pas que votre train était maintenu 
Appel du service commercial le Lundi matin après 40’ d’attente une conseillère répétant comme un robot que ce n’est pas leur problème et nous devions payer 200€ de frais pour retrouver notre place
Un scandale !!

items.title: Einfach - gut!
items.review_text: Alles ok, zwar zweimal Verspätung über 30 Minuten, aber immer schneller, entspannter und nachhaltiger als das Auto (Köln -Paris). Früh buchen - viel sparen!

items.title: Je voulais remercier un agent dans…
items.review_text: Je voulais remercier un agent dans l’entreprise Eurostar ! Ma famille et moi sont partis à Londres pour passer des vacances. Malheureusement nous avons reçu un mail à 23:11 le 25/11 pour nous informer que notre train était annulé. Impossible de modifier l’horaire du car dès que nous changeons le créneaux horaire le train était automatiquement annulé. Nous nous sommes donc rendu à la gare de st pancréas pour trouver une solution avec le personnel eurostar. Aucune solution proposée pouvait convenir à notre situation financière car nous ne pouvons avancer des frais d’hôtel de repas supplémentaire. Un agent nous a redirigé vers un autre agent après 2h de queue. Cet agent s’appelle Hispan, il nous trouver une solution à notre problème. Il a pris du temps avec nous pour pouvoir nous éviter d’avancer trop de frais. Il était l’écoute de nos demandes. Le top vraiment ! Nous avons pu monter dans train après plusieurs heures de stress. J’ai pu voir qu’il trouver des solutions pour d’autres personnes. Encore merci Hispan !!

items.title: Bad service
items.review_text:
We took the train from st pancros  at 15.30 now we are approaching the tunnel so far no sign of service of drinks or food etc and we are in business class . 
It is passed 4 o clock .
Bad service

items.title: I am writing to express my deep…
items.review_text:
I am writing to express my deep distress and disappointment with a recent experience I had with Eurostar, which has left me in a state of emotional and financial hardship.

1.  On 24 Nov I had one day trip from London to Brussels at 6.16 am and back from Brussels to London at 3.56 pm. I had traveled for a job interview and was scheduled to return to London the same day. This trip was critically timed due to my responsibilities as a breastfeeding mother. I had left a sufficient amount of milk for my newborn but needed to return promptly to continue breastfeeding, as the absence of regular feeding/pumping was causing physical discomfort and pain for me and baby. 

2. I arrived at the station at 3:30 PM for a 3:56 PM train from London to Brussels. I was unaware of the policy that gates close 30 minutes before departure, as this was not prominently displayed or communicated ( as it’s for example on airplane boarding passes) . As a result, I missed the cutoff by a mere four minutes. I was not allowed to board my scheduled train back to London, as I arrived at the station four minutes after the gate closure time. The necessity to return to London promptly was not just a matter of convenience but a critical health issue for both me and my baby. Delaying my return could lead to complications with breastfeeding, which I had been managing through a strict schedule throughout the day. This was the only option given to me to ensure I could return home in time to care for my newborn, who was being looked after by a kind individual for the day and had HARD STOP and other commitment at 5.30 pm 

3 Upon realizing  mistake, I pleaded with the staff, explaining my circumstances - a breastfeeding mother, a refugee from Ukraine alone with newborn , I don’t have any help here, a job seeker, and a wife to a husband at war very much need take EXACTLY THIS train. Despite my distress and the minimal delay, I was denied empathy and flexibility at all, manager was rude, saying that it’s my problem and I’m bad mother if I didn’t have plan B, it’s not her problem, and “exploiting my position”. She told she would only allow me to get the train if I will buy new Business ticket for the same train , which is 3X times expensive.  waiting for another two hours was not feasible due to my breastfeeding schedule. I didn’t have choice but to buy this expensive ticket to take a train I already had a ticket 

4. This incident has not only caused me significant financial strain but also emotional turmoil. I was forced to spend money that my family cannot spare, and the entire journey back was spent in tears, I didn’t touch food, feeling humiliated and frustrated.

 I understand the necessity of rules and policies, but I firmly believe that there should be room for compassion and understanding, especially under exceptional circumstances like mine.

items.title: Expérience horrible! Victime de harcèlement sexuel
items.review_text:
Expérience horrible à l’instant avec Eurostar de Gare du Nord.
Suite à des embouteillages , arrivée à Gare du Nord , nous n’avions que 10 min pour faire notre enregistrement pour le train en départ de Londres à 21h09. Les agents de sécurité au niveau des contrôles de bagage sont juste horrible. Nous avons respecté toutes les formalités et avons suivi toutes les consignes . L’un des agents un grand black africain a eu des propos très déplacés envers moi et ma sœur , un vrai pervers sexuelle. Il se moquait aussi de nous car nous étions en retard . Toute la scène a été filmée et je vais pas me gêner de porter plainte contre lui . Lorsque nous sommes arrivés au niveau des quais pour prendre le train la douane est venu nous chercher pour nous dire de repasser nos bagages alors que nous l’avions déjà fait ! Et l’agent de douane m’a dit qu’il s’en fiche que notre train part dans 5 min et que nous devions revenir . L’agent de sécurité pervers avait monté tout un coup contre nous , il a dit à la douane que nous avions couru vers notre train sans faire passer nos bagages . C’est absurde ! Dans quel monde des voyageurs peuvent passer les portes sans avoir présenté leurs bagages ? 2 simples jeunes femmes au milieu d’hommes pervers et agressifs. Du jamais vu !

items.title: Customer Contempt
items.review_text:
Like many others here, we were notified on the afternoon of travel (by SMS) that our train Amsterdam-London was cancelled. We were advised to make our own way to Brussels...somehow...? No Eurostar staff available at either Amsterdam or Rotterdam stations. Eurostar told us to pay for a hotel overnight and sustenance...and on returning agreed the amount...we were compensated for the loss of travel...but we are still waiting for reimbursement. 

After several emails, two phone calls and an unanswered complaint to Customer Services, I can see a definite script playing out. It's easy for them to say 'Get a hotel; Eurostar will pay' when they know how difficult it is to get reimbursement. Looks like my next step will be the Small Claims Court.

[After chasing several times Eurostar paid me (£0.56 less than the amount), however, it was not within the agreed 28 days, and they never replied to my online complaint (does this just go into a bin somewhere?). The whole experience feels like customer contempt.]

items.title: Very helpful staff member
items.review_text: Due to a family crisis we had to return from Lille to London at very short notice yesterday. We were both very upset but Simon at Lille Europe station calmly sorted out new seats for us on the next available train. He could not have been more helpful and sympathetic. Wonderful service thank you Simon, you are a credit to the company merci beaucoups!

items.title: service client injoignable
items.review_text: J'ai eu du retard sur mon aller Paris Amsterdam et sur mon retour Amsterdam Paris. J'ai fait une demande de compensation en ligne, on m'a bien remboursé le retard pour l'aller mais pour le retard du retou (+ de 2 heures) on m'a fait un remboursement de 25% alors que c'est censé etre de 50% pour un retard au dessus de 100 minutes. J'ai beau essayé de les contacter par plusieurs mails, je n'ai aucune reponse !!

items.title: What a bunch of....at Brussels !!!
items.review_text:
What a bunch of....at Brussels check in!!!
Didn't let me go in because the gates were closed when i arrived 30 minutes before the departure to London ,btw maybe the Company is interested to know that those employees told me to take the plane if i don't like it, something i will probably do next time.
Bought a 2nd ticket for next Eurostar train and they tried to stop me alleging this time I was showing a nervous behaviour, what a joke!
Finally i took that train...but had a horrible experience.

items.title: Plus jamais Eurostar!!
items.review_text:
Plus jamais Eurostar!!! 

Modifier son billet pour prendre un train plus tôt dans la même journée coûte un bras!!! 250€ en plus du prix du billet (120€).

Comment on fait pour encourager les gens à prendre le train étant le moyen de transport le plus écologique? On gonfle les prix au maximum? C’est honteux!!!

items.title: Wees alert. Trein te laat? Dan mis je de aansluiting ivm douane.
items.review_text: Vanwege vertraging in Nederland te laat aangekomen op Brussel. 25 min voor vertrek Eurostar naar Londen konden we niet meer door de douane. Als je een kaartje koopt waarop de tijden staan dan lijkt het logisch dat treinen van hetzelfde bedrijf weten dat er vertraging is. En wellicht elkaar informeren etc. Ondanks dat we 25 minuten voor vertrek van de trein aankwamen is het vanwege de security niet meer mogelijk om dan aan boord te gaan. Werkelijk bureaucratie ten top. Slechte service en slechts schouderophalend gedrag bij de mensen aan de balie. Dit kan echt zoveel beter en klantvriendelijker. Slechte zaak.

items.title: Tweede keer slechte ervaring met…
items.review_text: Tweede keer slechte ervaring met eurostar. Door vertraging mogen we niet mee met trein van Brussel naar London, ondanks dat er nog 20 minuten zijn voor vertrek. Als je concurrerend wil zijn met vliegen, red je het op deze manier niet. Waardeloos en weinig klantgericht.

items.title: Eurostar Eens maar nooit meer
items.review_text:
Eurostar Eens maar nooit meer
Op zondag 12.11 op tijd vertrokken richting Brussel ? London    Vervolgens door een kapotte trein voor ons ruim een uur te laat in Brussel , en daardoor aansluiting met de trein naar London gemist ( zoals vele met mij )
Volgens conducteur komen we in aanmerking voor compensatie  , nou niet dus volgens Eurostar website 
Verschillende pogingen gedaan zonder resultaat 
Moraal van het verhaal , 2 uur later in Londen en geen compensatie .  Eens maar nooit weer , pak wel het vliegtuig de volgende keer

items.title: Outstanding customer service at St…
