items.review_text: Outstanding customer service at St Pancras International.  My son was delayed on a train from Nottingham to London which meant he would miss his Eurostar train to Paris. His sister in London had his passport and was there to get the train. The staff at Eurostar were so helpful, they looked after my sons passport and went out of their way to support him when he arrived in London. No trains left that evening but he did manage to get on the first one the next morning with their help despite it being completely full online. Omar on Friday night helped my daughter to board the train knowing her brother would be ok. That evening and the next morning so many fab staff members went above and beyond to help sort out new tickets and seats despite it being the rugby World Cup final and a max scramble for tickets already . I was so impressed. Well done.

items.title: zitplaats kiezen onmogelijk
items.review_text: Bij Eurostar is het onmogelijk een zitplaats te kiezen op het traject Brussel midi - Amsterdam. Verlang terug naar Thalys!!

items.title: Great service on board
items.review_text: I was travelling from London to Paris. I was confused about the coach and seat number Sonja And Frederic helped me by offering me a high level of customer service with professionalism.

items.title: Mauvaise expérience
items.review_text: J’ai réservé sur Eurostar pour aller de Paris à Amsterdam. A l’embarquement le train a été supprimé du coup j’ai monté sur un autre train, j’ai resté deboit 4 heures dans la cafétéria car il n y avait pas de place assise.

items.title: Ich fahre regelmässig von Paris nach…
items.review_text:
Ich fahre regelmässig von Paris nach Köln und mit dem Thalys hat früher auch immer alles geklappt.

Der Übergang zu Eurostar war für mich eine Katastrophe. Der Zug fuhr nicht bis zu meiner Station, Umtausch bzw. Stornierung sollte aber nur "nachträglich" möglich sein und ich habe nachgefragt beim Kundenservice (bzw ich habe es versucht) und nie zurückgehört. 
Ach ja, habe einen Ersatzzug gebucht und der fuhr dann zu früh ab. Habe dadurch meinen Anschluss verpasst. 

Jetzt habe ich noch einen umgetauschten Zug von Thalys, den ich stornieren will, aber nicht stornieren kann, da Eurostar die Buchungsnummer nicht akzeptiert? 

Für den ehemaligen Zug, welcher storniert werden sollte, habe ich nie Geld zurückbekommen. 


Mal schauen wie das noch weitergeht..

items.title: Awful
items.review_text:
Awful. No customer service, no one to talk to to resolve issues. If you get a response eventually it’s unhelpful and dismissive. 
There is an error in my account, I cannot collect points, the system is not recognising my club membership. I am not getting response from customer service. 
My daughter had her train cancelled - no one bothered to inform her.
On another occasion - My daughter was advised to forfeit her journey and claim on insurance as the system won’t let her change outward journey date to after return. She had to change both journeys and rebook the original return.
Another situation - My email was ingnored. Eventually I had to write and post a letter to claim compensation for lack of provision of premier standard meal. Not only was the food not served but they ran out of water. Months later got a voucher for a few quid. Waste of time. 
It’s a great shame. I love train travel but this is not working. Eurostar - get yourself sorted!

items.title: Frequent traveller with Eurostar
items.review_text:
Frequent traveller with Eurostar. Very rarely have any issues.
Not perfect service but not bad.

items.title: Thalys/Eurostar merger has failed
items.review_text:
The merger between Thalys and Eurostar has failed. I have lost all my Thalys status, vouchers and points. Only after 5 contacts (including 2 calls) over 2 months, I have received back my vouchers with 5 days left to book a trip.

Still don't know about the rest as I join back of the queue of many unsatisfied customers.

Thalys was not perfect, but at least their customer service was respectful, polite and responsive. Eurostar was terrible in every respect. Now after the merger, the Eurostar culture was adopted and now it's worse than flying Ryan Air.

I'm going to go back to flying. Bring on that CO2.

items.title: Plus rien ne va!
items.review_text: Plus rien ne va!! Impossible d'échanger un billet même en tarif fréquent pass étoile. On vous fait payer 2X plus cher avec moins de droits. Il faut prendre sa voiture ou une autre solution triste

items.title: NOT ABLE TO ACCESS MY ACCOUNT ON THE…
items.review_text:
NOT ABLE TO ACCESS MY ACCOUNT ON THE APP!!! TERRIBLE 
Extremely disappointed with the Eurostar app. I've tried resetting my password multiple times, and I'm not receiving any reset email, even though I've been using the same email for the past 10 years. This issue is preventing me from using my hard-earned club card points. I expected better from Eurostar.

items.title: To be avoided at all costs
items.review_text: Our train to Paris was cancelled a week before our travel day, December last year citing train strikes in the UK which had nothing to do with them. No compensation provided. The refund was in the form of gift voucher with one year validity. They would not increase the validity of the gift voucher and one must book tickets which according to them could be modified any number of times. It is sad to see such pathetic level of customer support and empathy when the issue was totally theirs. It is to be avoided at all costs.

items.title: Never again
items.review_text:
The worst travel experience I've ever had. 
Train from London to Amsterdam got cancelled at Bruxelles. We were told to get off, and that was it. We were given no indication of what to do, no alternative, no Eurostar officers to assist us and the ones we managed to find at the Bruxelles desk shout at us, didn't help at all or even flat out ignored us and left while we were talking.
We were then rejected from two different Thalys trains, with security being placed at every door (so they were obviously aware of the problem). We managed to get on a train hours later, as there was no security for this one.
The plan was to arrive in Amsterdam at 11:15, but we finally arrived at 16:45.
Tried to get compensation online, nope.
Sent an email, and got told they can give me 30% of my ticket, which is what they give for a 60-119 min delay, which is very much not what happened.
Truly a scam

items.title: 4 and a half hour delay in total from…
items.review_text: 4 and a half hour delay in total from Dusseldorf to London St Pancreas and only £40 compensation on a £420 ticket. I had to change rail ticket which on one leg was not refundable costing another £65. Overall experience was poor and probably never use Eurostar again

items.title: The best train I've ever been on!
items.review_text:
The best train I've ever been on!
The employees were nice and there was a delay due to bad weather. 
Very nice service and pleasant journey.

items.title: One of the worst service and very poor…
items.review_text:
One of the worst service and very poor security system in London. 
I brought my power tool during my travel to NL. Idiot security system allowed me without even notifying me. 
It was my first time in international train. 

When I come back the NL security in Erostar took my power tool and was saying it was a restricted item. I am asking myself "why the fk in Lomdon they allowed me to take tool with me?"

Also when I call the London Eurostar customer service, I pressed the option to speak in Dutch, but the fker was talking in English and was saying that they don't speak Dutch. They why the fk you have these options? 
What a cancer system say!

items.title: I had a worst experience travelling…
items.review_text: I had a worst experience travelling through Eurostar from Paris to London on 30th October 2023. I was little late for the train, however managed to complete all the checkin and security checks formalities way before the train departure time, as soon as we reach to the platform we have been told the platform is wrong and asked to do all the checkin and security processes again as we have been directed wrong to out of platform instead of guiding a correct way to the actual platform. I was with my wife and 2 years old son on a buggy running here and there. The security person let other travellers pass through the platforms direct door but not let us in despite continuing requesting, I literally begged but he took us to the security checkin again. One of the worst experiences I ever had, I will never travel to france again.

items.title: Pricing policy
items.review_text:
Hello, I just want to share my thought on this service. I am always taking the train to travel to reduce my carbon footprint. However, the price of the train is litterally x3 the price of a flight ticket London Paris.

I think that these Eurostar prices, in the world we live in today are an absolute disgrace. It only allows well-off people to travel climate-friendly. 

The price ticket should be capped at £90.

items.title: Trein gecanceld en dan???
items.review_text:
Afgelopen week voor veel geld een eersteklas kaartje gekocht naar Parijs vanaf Schiphol. Tot Schiphol ging de reis redelijk (NS) op Schiphol aangekomen is de Eurostar trein gecanceld, bij de info balie zeggen ze er gaan geen treinen van Eurostar meer vanaf Schiphol u moet naar Amsterdam centraal, Met een tekst ‘ dan heeft u alleen geen reservering meer’ . Aldaar (eindelijk) aangekomen wilde de Eurostar trein manager(een absolute hork overigens) mij niet meenemen en moest ik de volgende trein proberen. Weer een trein later opnieuw geprobeerd te boarden en dat lukte, geen eigen stoel reservering dus gewoon even ergens gaan zitten. Dat ging goed tot Antwerpen, nu ben ik in Brussel en heb weer een andere stoel moeten zoeken. Is gelukkig wel gelukt. Mijn gevoel voor onrecht, ik heb veel geld betaald voor een eigen stoel, zorgt voor irritatie en boosheid richting Eurostar. Ondertussen heeft ook deze trein al meer dan 50 minuten vertraging en krijg ik steeds berichten op mijn e-mail dat mijn oorspronkelijke trein, die dus gecanceld was 😳, met vertraging zal aankomen op Paris gare du nord….
Bijzonder teleurstellend deze gang van zake

items.title: Journey took 11 hours instead of 4 hours
items.review_text: Train was delayed for 4 hours in Brussels and the staffs blocked us from taking the next train available, forcing us to take the slow train that takes another 4 hours (the entire journey was supposed to be 4 hours and now it lasts 11 hours). Absolutely horrendous service.

items.title: Terrible
items.review_text:
Terrible. Had to get out of the train in Brussel and on to a normal train to Rotterdam. Train was far to packed. And no personnel of the Eurostar to be seen to assist with luggage or any kind of help. Guess they were hiding. Cowards that is what they are.
My advise: take a plain. Eurostar is horrible.

items.title: Sehr schlechte Werbung
items.review_text: Sehr schlechte Werbung

items.title: Blue Eurostar/Red Eurostar
items.review_text:
I am not sure this is an entirely Eurostar matter but I was travelling with them so I think the responsibility falls mainly to them.  With great fanfare, it was announced recently that Thalys has merged with Eurostar, so now the old Thalys route from Amsterdam to Paris is a Eurostar route.  

Today I was booked on the 12.11 Eurostar from Amsterdam and on getting to the station I discovered it was cancelled.  (I probably did not get personal notification because it was booked for me, for a conference).  The international ticketing office at Amsterdam put me on the next Eurostar at 13.11 but with no booked seats.  They said I should ask the train manager to find me a seat.

The platform for the Brussels/Paris train is shared with the "real" Eurostar going to London.  I spoke to a member of staff working there and she said she worked for Blue Eurostar not Red Eurostar (Thalys) and that when the train arrives I should look for the train manager.  There were no Red Eurostar members of staff on the station platform at all.  It seems clear that the two Eurostar services still operate fairly independently of each other.

My train arrived and no train manager appeared.  I went back to Blue Eurostar lady but she said I should just look further down the platform.  There was no-one.  In desperation I got on the train and just sat anywhere, feeling very stressed.  The train manager was walking through and I explained the situation.  She said the train was full and there were no seats available - I and many other people had been booked on to a Eurostar that was already full. 

She said I could sit in any empty seat until passengers claimed them at Schiphol Airport but it was very stressful and after having to move twice, I spent the rest of the journey on a jumpseat between carriages where at least I would not have to move.

To be fair, it wasn't the fault of Eurostar that a lot of displaced passengers were put on a full train (although presumably they having cancelled a train must have realised we would need to be put somewhere).  It is the fault of Eurostar/Thalys that no staff were available at all to advise us or make the process more human and dignified.  It is the fault of Eurostar that they trumpet this new merger which isn't really a merger at all as the "Blue Eurostar" staff don't know what is going on with "Red Eurostar" (the lady I spoke to at Amsterdam said I'd been given wrong information about where the train was arriving - but in fact she was the one with the wrong information). 

Just a really poor show all round.

items.title: Travellers with Food Allergies beware
items.review_text: On the 28/09/23 My husband and myself went by Eurostar premier to Amsterdam. We pre-ordered a gluten free breakfast as my husband is celiac. He ate this breakfast which included a cake which had no ingredients on the package, shortly after he became ill and collapsed with stomach pains and sickness and had to be taken of the train at Rotterdam by ambulance.  We never heard anything from Eurostar so wrote to complain . Eventually we received a reply on the 17.10.23 saying sorry to hear about my husbands experience and to fill in a form.  Please if you have any food allergies be careful of what you eat on Eurostar.

items.title: Jamais plus
items.review_text:
Pour des raisons de santé, je suis obligée d'échanger mes billets (valeur 400€). On m'explique que si je prends des billets moins chers (exemple 200€) on ne me rembourse pas la différence (!) et si jamais je dois encore les changer (avec des billets à 300€ par exemple) le prix initial est perdu donc il y aurait 100€ de différence à payer entre 200€ et 300€ (!!).
De plus, les échanges doivent se faire 1 semaine avant max, mais pour eux les semaines durent 8 jours donc attention à vos calculs. 
Jamais plus j'achèterai un billet Eurostar de ma vie.

items.title: Youcef and Akim are extremely helpful…
items.review_text: Youcef and Akim are extremely helpful and provided support to me when I was panic! Huge thanks to both of them!

items.title: Impossible de créer mon compte…
items.review_text:
Impossible de créer mon compte Eurostar. Dès le début de la création de son compte, on a une impression d'amateurisme malheureusement vite confirmée.
Impossible de saisir le prénom Jean-Yves (message: caractère spéciaux non autorisés).
Pour information,  j'ai un certain nombre de comptes, mon prénom n'a jamais posé de problème. 
Une fois l'ensemble des champs remplis, je reçois un lien dans ma messagerie. 
Lorsque je clic sur le lien, message: 404 sorry page not found.
Est-ce un stagiaire qui gère le site Web, ne faites vous jamais de tests ?
Attention votre futur concurrent Evolyn est très professionnel. 
Cordialement 

Jean-Yves Bouvier

items.title: My worst international train experience ever
items.review_text:
I’ve been internationally travelling by train for 40 years now, but my recent trip from the Netherlands to London and back with Eurostar was the most unpleasant and at the same time most expensive travelling experience ever. 

We had booked our tickets with Dutch railways (NS). As usual, we got travel advice together with our tickets. Even though we had taken one train earlier than stated on the tickets by Dutch railways, our international train connection from Breda to Brussels Midi arrived 15minutes late - but still 30 minutes before the departure of the Eurostar to London. We all rushed to the terminal of Eurostar, which was badly signed and hard to find.

International trains used to wait in case of delay of important international connections, and the only train from The Netherlands to Eurostar seems to be an important connection to me. I therefore would have expected that we could still board. The terminal was completely empty, security checks would only have costed minutes.

Yet we were told in a very unpolite way that we were late and therefore couldn’t board. That the only International connection from The Netherlands had been late and that we followed the exact travel advice that NS had given us, didn’t matter to the staff.

Imagine, you’re just 4 minutes late for boarding together with approx. 20 other people (and not because of your fault), the terminal is empty and the controls would take just few minutes AND your train departs in 26 minutes, yet you’re being treated as if you needed some punishment - while you did what you could and had been told (and payed € 300 per person for 2nd class tickets on a relatively short distance).

The passengers who arrived with that Dutch train got replacement tickets for the Eurostar 2 hours later while their booked train was still standing on the platform! 

No apologies or even an explanation or whatsoever why we couldn’t board. 

One lady got frustrated and ventilated her anger, but not in an aggressive way and without shouting or whatsoever. She’s been told that she couldn’t board even though she travelled with children. It was evident that she was no threat, just stressed and frustrated - we all were. Nobody dared to say anything anymore. It was tense.

All the passengers arriving with that train from The Netherlands got replacements tickets for the next Eurostar - 2 hours later. 

The waiting room in Brussels was outdated, depressing and filthy, as were the toilets.

The train itself had a more luxurious feel than “normal” trains and staff was much friendlier and service-oriented than the station staff. The train trip itself went smooth, nothing scaring about the tunnel, only the rattling noises outside at high velocity sounded a bit worrying.

I have to admit: it was lovely to arrive in the centre of London and to be able to directly use London’s tube system and arrive in London’s city centre within minutes by tube (or bus)!

For our return trip from London, we had to be at London St. Pancras 60-90 minutes before departure. Again, there was a very unfriendly atmosphere. Station staff was yelling, it difficult to understand their yelled instructions and staff was evidently under high tension. The handling of hundreds of passengers extremely chaotic and I doubt the quality of safety controls is anywhere near the one at airports. Passport check was also extremely chaotic, with unmotivated and grumpy staff.
The waiting room was way too small for the massive amount of international passengers to Paris and Brussels, several hundreds of persons (one Eurostar London - Brussels alone has a capacity of 900 persons) had to stand with heavy luggage in a very crowded space with no crowd control in place. Elderly people and parents with children stood around for an hour, some sat on the ground. There were no gates or dedicated areas. I doubt you could evacuate so many people with so much heavy luggage standing around from such a crowded space.

On our trip from London to Brussels the space between chairs was so cramped that we (1,79-1,83 cm) couldn’t sit upright with both feet parallel on the ground which caused back- and hip pain and made it quite uncomfortable. 

To sum it up:
We wish Eurostar would make safety and customer experience/ service more of a priority. We wish they would train, motivate and supervise their station staff better. 

The huge amount of bad experiences shared here show that unfortunately, we aren’t the only ones with disappointing experiences.

Which is a pity, since travelling by train is not only the more sustainable option to travel to London, but potentially also the most relaxed one.

items.title: Déplorable
items.review_text:
51mn de retard et droit à aucune compensation car c'est à partir de 60mn !
Sans parler non plus du service thalys qui autrefois servait café et biscuits en gare au moindre petit retard. Désormais, rien de rien, juste quelques emplois-jeunes avec des gilets roses qui n'en savent pas plus que les voyageurs. Par exemple, la voiture 16 annoncée en zone B2 et qui arrive en B4, ce qui nous oblige à courir à l'arrivée du train !
Et puis le wagon-bar minable composé d'un meuble métallique ambulant avec deux-trois trucs proposés par une hôtesse au bout du rouleau (et on la comprend) !
Bref, pour Paris-Bruxelles, nous prendrons désormais le TGV Paris-Lille puis Lille-Bruxelles, ce qui a aussi l'avantage d'être bien moins cher !

items.title: J'ai acheté un aller retour paris…
items.review_text:
J'ai acheté un aller retour paris amsterdam départ le5/10 122€ retour le 12/10 99€. Le 6/10 J'ai modifié mon retour pour le 17/10...retour à 149€ paiement de 85€ avec félicitations de surclassement après vérification tj retour le 12 ms en surclassement !!! Je redemandé le 17/10 là paiement de 15€ avec tjs félicitations de surclassement. 
Faus billet standard! moralité eurostar m'a arnaquee de 199€ pour un billet retour. Dans le train une voyageuse sans billet n'a elle payé que 50€ ...baratineuse, jeune, jolie...Faut-il vraiment prendre un billet?

items.title: Rip off merchants
items.review_text:
Eurostar are only interested in milking customers for money. 
I had a standard premier ticket booked from Brussels to London (which already cost over £200) on Monday night. My connecting train in the UK was cancelled so I needed to move to an earlier train or not get home. I tried to move to the train an hour before, which had seats free, and was charged £90 to move to a standard seat. So I was taking a seat that would otherwise be empty, on the same route, 1 hour earlier and in a lower class ticket, and had to pay £90. 
I emailed customer services saying I was disappointed and this felt like punishing customers for being early and got a sarcastic response and no further action. 
Have since read the exchange policy and they actually overcharged me according to that and have ignored my email asking for a refund of the difference. 
Really disappointing - we need good and affordable trains more and more instead of planes. Instead we have these rip off merchants.

items.title: They have taken over the Thalys…
items.review_text: ...service to Paris. Uneventful journey from Cologne, train on time but service in first of a lower standard than before..

items.title: Wifi!
items.review_text:
It is outrageous that they cannot provide decent Wi-Fi on the trains.  This is costing their customers an incredible amount of productivity loss.

Fix this NOW, and I will move you to 5 stars.
For this reason, I will be actively promoting the ferry (which offers great wifi).

items.title: No internet connection
items.review_text:
It is beyond ridiculous that in this day and age, on a business trip to the Netherlands I cannot get even HALF way decent connection. This costs actual money in terms of lost working time, but since Eurostar does not feel that loss, there is no incentive to provide this absolutely MINIMUM level of services. In the end, I had to hotspot from my personal phone, so the signal is there (fair enough, also a bit intermittent), but surely the train company can do better than my mobile phone! 

I am now going to actively campaign in my company against using the Eurostar in future.

items.title: Why can’t they provide Wi-Fi
items.review_text: Why can’t they provide Wi-Fi? £600 for a return business premier ticket and couldn’t load a single webpage all journey. Is this really how they are encouraging us not to fly?

items.title: Used to be a great company
items.review_text: Used to be a great company, with great client service. For a few years now, I only have problems. Last exemple, no way to change the name on the ticket 10 minutes after booking (this message is written in 2023 : we have AI able to recreate art or the human brain, but a commercial company can't find the bouton "modification" on its booking software)

items.title: De airco op vrieskist stand en 3,5 uur…
items.review_text: De airco op vrieskist stand en 3,5 uur lang een keiharde bromtoon in de coupe. Wat een paupermaterieel

items.title: Disappointed
items.review_text:
I have been taking Eurostar for work and leisure purpose since 2014, and I must say I feel more and more like being completely ripped off 
Pricing going up, quality onboard getting poorer.
But they are the only train company linking London to big capitals, so why not carry on taking their customer for idiot… they are talking about being more sustainable way of transport, but at which costs?

items.title: Retard non communiqué sur l‘appli
items.review_text:
Cher développeur de l‘appli d‘Eurostar!
A quoi sert votre appli si vous ne remettez pas les infos de retard sur la réservation enregistrée ? Faut il vraiment etre arrivé à la gare pour en avoir connaissance ?
Retard aujourdhui du 9321 pour Amsterdam….

items.title: Eurostar over the years...
items.review_text:
Eurostar over the years...
- Less leg space/comfort in their new trains in order to add more seats to sell more tickets 
- Decreasing the level of service in the trains (Quality of meals over the years has gone from 5 stars to 1 star)
- Huge increase in their prices and decreasing advantages for frequent travellers
- And now, for their new membership, people who had a free/return ticket before the new membership program, are just entitled to a single ticket 

So for higher prices, you are delivering less customer service, but more in your pockets !!! Thank you, Eurostar

items.title: Veel vertraging laatst naar Londen
items.review_text: Veel vertraging laatst naar Londen, maar verder aan boord was het goed. Beter dan vliegen vanaf Brussel.

items.title: Crickets !!! #08002774
items.review_text:
Crickets !!!
This is what we hear from the Eurostar customer services!!!
I am not sure which is worse, the terrible attitude in the French side or the negative one in the UK side!

Thanks for contacting us - #08002774

items.title: Cher et en retard  sans causes connues.
items.review_text:
Cher et en retard  sans causes connues.
La correspondance est donc ratée.
 Un simple retour de Paris s’apparente à une expédition

items.title: Horrible experience
items.review_text:
Certainly, here's a revised version with improved grammar:

"My experience was terrible. The tickets were exorbitantly priced from the start. The London station was overly crowded, leaving no place to sit except for a small coffee shop. I was on the last train to Paris, but the excessively bright lights made it impossible to sleep, resulting in a headache. Additionally, people behind me talked endlessly. There's a definite need for a complete reevaluation of the overall customer and journey experience."

items.title: BEWARE PREMIER TICKET
items.review_text: No PREMIER service (food/drinks) provided as paid for, no refund given, only a credit for future travel. Im pretty sure they know that Im not going to "bop" over from the USA to use my credit.  Pretty unfair to pay for PREMIER service, they admit they did not deliver said service and btw you will not be getting your money back. Just beware.

items.title: What's the point? Broken website, zero f***s given, customer service just a front.
items.review_text:
Used to be great. Efficient, good service, classy!
Now it's basically Megabus/ Ryanair,  with even worse customer service. 
My boring story:
Tried to reschedule return journey 3 days before returning.
Unbeknown to me, the website was being updated. 
Some system error led to a fault with the drop down date menu, making it IMPOSSIBLE to select new return dates. The dates were all grey, as though unavailable, despite there being plenty of tickets available online.
I was staying in rural France with no mobile reception. I had to travel to the nearest town to sit on the phone in a queue until gone 6. Repeating this the next day.
The last few days of my trip were ruined trying to resolve this  
By the time I did get through, the ticket prices had more than tripled. Meaning it would have been cheaper if I had just booked entirely new tickets 3 days prior.
The customer service lady, 'Ria' denied that this was the case?!!! Saying they could not have been cheaper 3 days ago 😤 and it was 'my word against theirs' without proof? Oh yeah, the proof that every single regular Eurostar traveller knows, the prices hike massively in the days before departure!! 
So there's the difference in price (hundreds) then the smarmy £30 change of ticket cost (£30? Each? Why?) and not one single apology. Customer service simple continue this weird loop of repeating the accusation that I am either unable to use a website or a phone?
Not once have they acknowledged their broken website??
Every decent company who has migrated a website has a procedure in place for the inevitable glitches! It goes without saying that large website are very difficult to migrate, but do it with transparency. Why not admit the issue and at least waiver the £30 fee, offer an upgrade or do as I asked and sell me tickets at the price I would have paid IF I was able to book the b****y tickets!! Why should I be financially penalised for their error?
Well, I'll tell you why- they know what they are doing, they are sharks and the recent incarnation is running what was an amazing service to the ground.
You can prove to be a good company and STILL make profit.
If I liked Eurostar like I did in the past I'd use it all the time! But, like most people here, I end up flying and use Eurostar sparingly.
Why pay more for this c**p?
AND, after all their hard work making a new site, it's awful? Not to mention the rebranding??? UGGG! Who the hell is in charge of this shambles???
Shame on the lot of you
(And for hiring untrained kids that's can't spell to be in charge of email complaints).

items.title: Angenehme Reise von London nach Amsterdam
items.review_text:
Gefahren sind wir mit dem Eurostar am Freitag, 15. September, von London nach Amsterdam. Für zwei Personen haben wir lediglich zusammen 170 Euro bezahlt. Jedoch haben wir das Ticket auch schon fast 6 Monate vorher gebucht, die Abfahrzeit war mit 8.16 Uhr zudem sehr früh. Doch schon 2 Stunden später wäre der Zug an diesem Tage wesentlich teurer gewesen. So ist die schöne neue Welt mit dem "dynamic prizing".
Positiv: Wir sind pünktlich in Amsterdam angekommen. Und das ist man ja bekanntlich in Deutschland von der DB nicht gewöhnt.
Ein dicker Minuspunkt beim Eurostar sind die beengten Verhältnisse im Bahnhof St. Pancras International. Der Warteraum ist, bezogen auf die vielen Fahrgäste, viel zu klein, die Zahl der Sitzmöglichkeiten beschränkt. Es herrscht ein ziemliches Gedränge. Da eine Viertelstunde zuvor auch noch ein Eurostar nach Paris fuhr, war es schon sehr eng. Zumal die meisten Reisenden auch größeres Gepäck dabei hatten. Ich wage mir gar nicht auszumalen, was in den Ferienzeiten los ist. Menschen mit Handicaps sind hier wahrscheinlich schnell überfordert.
Die Fahrgäste konnten auch nicht auf den Bahnsteig gehen. Der Bahnsteig wird erst kurzfristig bekannt gegeben, und dann öffnen sich auch erst die Türen.
Empfohlen wird, zumindest 45 bis 60 Minuten vor Abfahrt des Zuges vor Ort zu sein. An diese Empfehlung sollte man sich halten, denn man passiert zwei Grenzkontrollen. Das aber geht alles sehr zügig und professionell, auch unter Einsatz moderner Technik.
Im Preis inbegriffen sind Sitzplatzreservierungen. Er war eine bequemer Fahrt, und es gab genügend Platz, um die Koffer zu verstauen. Ein bisschen nervig war der Videobildschirm, auf dem die Zielanzeige "Amsterdam" ständig flackerte.
Zu beachten ist: Auf dem Ticket und auch bei der Buchung werden alle Zeiten in "local time" angegeben. So fuhren wir in London um 8.16 a.m. los, erreichten Amsterdam ca. 13.15 Uhr - und waren doch nur 4 Stunden unterwegs.
Der Eurostar ist auf jeden Fall eine gute Alternative zum Flugzeug. Und wer sehr zeitig bucht, morgens früh losfährt, möglichst noch auf die Tage Dienstag, Mittwoch und Donnerstag ausweicht, der kann ein Ticket fühlbar unter 100 Euro buchen.
Dazu kommt noch: Man muss in London nicht einen langen Weg zu irgendeinem Flughafen in Kauf nehmen, sondern aus fast allen Stadtteilen kann man mit maximal einmal umsteigen mit der U-Bahn zum Bahnhof fahren. In nur gut fünf Minuten läuft man von der U-Bahn-Stadion King`s Cross St. Pancras innerhalb des Gebäudes zum Eurostar-Bahnhof.
Also wir würden wieder mit dem Eurostar fahren. Der Preis ist okay, und es ist ökologisch vernünftig. Und wenn ich meinen Weg von Haustür zu Haustür genau kalkuliere: Ich bin auch schneller als mit dem Flugzeug.

items.title: we bought Eurostar tickets from London…
items.review_text: we bought Eurostar tickets from London to Cologne with a stopover at Brussels. The tickets we were given gave us 15 minutes to change trains. Stupidly we thought that this would be plenty of time. The changeover was horridly stressful. There were no signs, no one to ask and by the time we had got off the Eurostar platform due to the number of people we had 7 minutes to catch the next train. We are 65 and 64. We had to run in order to catch the train. This is unacceptable. So much for a stress free journey, and to think it cost us £784 , it feels like we quite literally been taken for a ride, and so hard to find a complaints email online

items.title: Unfair Booking Terms & Conditions - Book with B-Rail - They kept 60 Euros for nothing
items.review_text:
Seat reservations are NON REFUNDABLE under NO CIRCUMSTANCES. So beware, even if you make a mistake of any sort, and under difficult circumstances, they will make NO EXCEPTIONS. Really unfair company policies. I called within a couple of minutes of booking after the mistake happened but no chance to see my money again. They are knowingly keeping 60 Euros that they did nothing for and that I cannot use.

Book through B-Rail - they have actual customer service.

items.title: You just lost my custom
items.review_text: You just lost my custom. 25 years ago I travelled directly into disneyland Paris with my niece and nephew for their best possible holiday. I now have 2 more little nieces and was about to book. We won't be going because there are no direct trains into disneyland Paris. I am not willing to change at lille.

items.title: Indécente maximisation du profit au détriment du client.
items.review_text:
Impossible d'avoir un remboursement partiel quand les prix fluctuent à la baisse juste après avoir pris un billet. Une manière de bien maximiser les revenues de l'Eurostar au détriment du client.

Quand il y a une correspondance il n'est pas possible de choisir son siège dans les trajets qui ne sont pas assurés par Eurostar, malgré cette option clairement mise en avant pendant la réservation. 

Experience décevante pour quelqu'un qui voulait éviter de prendre l'avion. 

Vivement la libéralisation du tunnel !

items.title: Just take the ferry
items.review_text:
Just take the train to Dover/Calais and ferry across.
Or fly, or even just stay at home. 
Every time there is some unpleasant surprise with Eurostar and it is stupidly expensive for the horrific service, and poor experience you get. 
I have travelled on Eurostar 7 times. The most consistently awful travel service I think must exist.

items.title: Anti-sale
items.review_text: Trying to book a trip with Eurostar is quite an undertaking. The differentiated pricing (more expensive after the morning rush, more expensive on week-ends, etc.) adds up to the experience. Worse to come: when trying to pay, the card was refused for an untold reason. So be it, let us try another card. Same reaction. Again with other cards, a card with another person in the travelling group, etc.: still same refusal, the message hinting that it must be the fault of the payment card provider... or providerzzzz for that matter. When trying to solve the mystery with the chat, the bot could only find the usual artificially stupid responses. To access some form of human support, the not-yet customer is supposed to pay a fee! Our sense of dark humour has stopped there. Never again Eurostar. Please Eurostar, learn about the basics of selling, for a start. And ask me never to call you a star again.

items.title: Non remboursement de réservation
items.review_text:
billets A/R pour Londres pris vers 14h.
Je m'aperçois uen heure après en rentrant mes données personnelles sur le site que mon passeport est périmé depuis quelques mois d'où impossibilté de me rendre à Londres.
AUCUN REMBOURSEMENT POSSIBLE.
seulement une modification de dates.
C'est absolument inadmissible !
Où est le droit de retractation du consommateur ?
il devrait y avoir au minimum une temporisation !

items.title: Unpleasant experience
items.review_text: Unpleasant experience. Overcrowded terminals, inadequate storage space for luggage, poor overpriced selection of food and drink, awful WiFi unfit for purpose and more expensive than flying. Eurostar have replicated the worst aspects of low budget fights and rewarded themselves by overcharging us all for the privilege

items.title: Amazing Staff!
items.review_text: Super quick and easy to get through (left plenty of time but had loads to spare too!) Staff were great, especially Akim who was amazingly friendly and helpful; I hope here's here next time I travel through!

items.title: Taking advantage of demand at expense of customers
items.review_text: Pathetic. Overcrowded, filthy and poor facilities  in departure  lounges. Carriages smell of sewage on hot days. Vegetarian baguettes basically just bread with barely any filling (shameful). This company is taking advantage of demand and essentially a monopoly. Only plus are the staff who are polite and friendly

items.title: Megaslecht
items.review_text: Megaslecht, trein kon niet verder onderweg (gestopt in onbekend station Antwerpen overgang op lokale trein), die al laat was aangekomen in Rotterdam en vervolgens kun je in Brussel opnieuw gaan inchecken (met alle rijen en ins en outs, meer dan 3 uur erin gestaan), op een willekeurige eurostar trein. Laat je niet gek maken over milieu-aspecten. Je word behandeld als vuilnis en dan de hele dag onderweg om naar London te komen. Echt mijden! Ze sporen niet daar. Ook staan alle medewerkers je continue voor te liegen, om de kudde mond te snoeren.

items.title: Train bondés
items.review_text: Train bondés, retards, sièges sales même en première. Service client obséqiueux.

items.title: Merci à Nicolas à la gare de Lille
items.review_text: Merci à Nicolas à la gare de Lille qui nous a sauvé pour notre séjour à Londres

items.title: Als je vroeg boekt een nette prijs
items.review_text: Als je vroeg boekt een nette prijs. De communicatie was goed. De afhandeling op de stations vlot, netjes en professioneel. De trein reed keurig op tijd was schoon met goede stoelen. In de rekken is voldoende ruimte voor je bagage. Kortom we zullen vaker van de trein gebruik maken.

items.title: If you're disabled be careful about getting a connecting training with less than 30 minutes to get to the next train
items.review_text:
Arriving from Amsterdam to get a connecting train to St. Pancras, I arrived five minutes late after the gate closed as I'm disabled and needed the toilet.  Unfortunately, the staff at Brussels wouldn't let me through, but they did get me on the next available train home.  There were 17 minutes between arriving in Brussels and getting to the boarding gate.  I had to get help with my bag to get off the train, find the lift, wait for the lift, and go to the toilet.  I then had to find the boarding gate.  I can't walk very fast as I have a walking stick to support the severe ankle arthritis I suffer from.  

I was annoyed because I would arrive home 2 hours later than planned. I contacted customer service and spoke to Callum, who was very caring and helpful.

Even though I arrived late, the staff were fantastic in Brussels.  A chap helped me with my bag to board the train, and one gentleman understood my situation and was very kind.

My advice is, if you're disabled, get a later connecting train.  It's too stressful to be expected to locate the lift and find the Eurostar boarding gate in Brussels in less than 20 minutes.  Even If I hadn't gone to the toilet, I would have only just made it within the 30-minute timeframe by the skin of my teeth.

items.title: Left my family sitting on the floor of the train
items.review_text: Eurostar changed our train time at check in without telling us, resulting in us missing the correct train and then left us (2 adults and 2 children) with no seats and left us sitting on the floor like animals. We had to beg other passengers to at least let our children sit down. And now, after many emails back and forward with the usual generic defensive nonsense, they refuse to refund us or accept any wrongdoing whatsoever "well you made it back didn't you? We fulfilled our service". I would whole heartedly advise people to avoid them at all (extremely expensive) costs!! Shame on you Eurostar!!

items.title: Travelled Euro star standard Premier…
items.review_text:
Travelled Euro star standard Premier with my sister and Granddaughter visiting Disneyland Paris 
On return journey (late evening) the Staff who were working on their shift seemed to think it was beneath them to help with a young child /heavy suitcases struggling to disembark (Health and Safety) to get off the train I thought I was going to fall! Spending over £1,000 return journey I’m certainly going to reconsider my travel arrangements with a child .The food was terrible certainly not a child’s meal mine was vegetarian (starter) regular meal on journey out was the same as vegetarian!!!! 

I have made a complaint about the conduct of a member of staff but was offered No compensation as they need to look into it further . Advice remind your staff to be courteous especially if you have a disability or young children on board (not cheap travel) reconsidering in the near future my travel plans as not sure worth the money

items.title: Disability prejudice
items.review_text: Horrendous experience with Eurostar. myself and my DISABLED partner were kicked out of our seats after they accused us of not checking in properly through the gates at Paris, even though we definitely had!  they'd then sold our seats to someone else on the door at paris. because I speak French and the lady who'd bought the seats had her very anxious elderly mother with her I tried to be helpful but instead they treated us like criminals and made us move to different seats far away on a very busy packed train. we wouldn't have been able to get through the barriers unless we'd checked in so it was clearly a technical fault. but instead of apologising and offering us compensation the staff were rude, unfriendly and cold. not recommended!

items.title: Terrible customer service and unorganised
items.review_text:
Took the Eurostar for the first with my family from London to Paris. The journey in the train was well and smooth. It was comfortable. However, what made the journey stressful and annoying was encountering the staff because of their terrible customer service. The staffs from London, UK side were rude! Straight up rude. Because it was my first time, I wanted to ask questions… I’ve asked a question but the response was unhelpful and seemed like the staff didn’t want to help. So i stopped asking and asked a passenger instead who was a lot more helpful. When we got to the security checks for our luggage, we had a minor inconvenience (we accidentally left one tiny suitcase near the scan lol which was kind of our fault haha) - so I asked the staff if I could get it back - but the staff’s response to me was insulting! The staff said “so why did u leave it then?” - tbh it was accidental to leave it and didn’t mean to leave it and I’ve asked politely. Either way, I didn’t deserve that kind of sass and he should of responded to me in a professional manner. (We managed to get out suitcase back). Overall, the staff are unhelpful and rude to the fact that you as the passenger is too scared to ask them anything, which in my opinion is not right. Them as the staff should be ready to answer any questions in a polite and professional manner and make sure that the passenger feels fine in a stressful environment.

On the way back home (so from Paris to London) -
The French Eurostar security part was fine, it went smoothly and the staff was a lot more nicer! I’ve asked questions and they’ve answered in a calm professional manner (in a very busy stressful environment). The only down side was that, it was very unorganised! They had signs in the screen and I would follow it, but then turns out the signs are useless because the staff changed the lines. So you’d think you’re lining up to the right queue because the train time is shown on it, but turns out it’s not lol (no idea if that made sense). So there were a lot of people confused and constantly on the wrong queue.

I had big hopes for Eurostar and had big expectations… I was very disappointed with what I had experience with the staffs and how unorganised it was. However, I’d like to try Eurostar again to see if my first experience was just a flop and to see if it was just a bad day for everyone. But if I experience it again, then I’ll stick to flying.

items.title: Horrible
items.review_text:
Horrible, mes tickets ont été annulé, on me propose des vouchers mais je n'ai aucune envie de reprendre Eurostar.
Une fois arrivé à expiration, j'essaie de contacter le service client en vain (cela fait 3 ans). 

On ne m'a jamais répondu, une honte.

items.title: Rotslechte service
items.review_text: Meer dan twee uur vertraging gehad waardoor we recht hadden op een compensatie en deze dan ook hadden aangevraagd. Twee maanden later nog steeds niks ontvangen en als je een mail stuurt geven ze geen nuttige informatie en helpen ze niet. Rotslechte service. In de toekomst kiezen wij niet meer voor Eurostar.

items.title: They are thieves and only want your money
items.review_text: Do not book with them. These people are thieves. We have booked to go to Brussels for a day with a hen party. After booking we found out the local trains are on strike and jus I was unable to get to London so unable to travel. Eurostar will not refund my money no matter what. They are too that in sympathetic when you ask to speak to someone in a senior position they don’t even have the guts to speak to you. It’s not my fault I am unable to travel. The trains are striking Friday and Saturday so not even able to come a day before. It is a joke. They have no empathy and they just want to take peoples money.

items.title: Abysmal customer service for bikes
items.review_text: Abysmal customer service. Incredibly expensive. No information about taking bikes on board, no help whatsoever. What a joke this company is

items.title: We travelled to Amsterdam on Standard…
items.review_text: We travelled to Amsterdam on Standard Premier. When we checked in, we were told to go speak to a Eurostar representative as there were air conditioning issues in our carriage. The woman explained that we could switch seats but they would not be in Standard Premier which we had very much wanted given the long journey, however were offered water and fans. We were told we would be given compensation if we contacted Eurostar once home. However on our return I have been informed that apparently I'm lying and this never happened, so no compensation has been given. We travelled in August on a very hot day so comfort was 100% compromised. They also were not able to provide a meat option on the way back to London which I think is rediculous given you pay so much for the ticket. We also arrived 25 min late on the way home which meant we had to run with 4 suitcases to get our connecting train. Worst customer service I've experienced in a long time.

items.title: More space and comfort on Ryanair
items.review_text:
More space and comfort on Ryanair! 

Some of the trains they pack people in so tight it’s incredibly uncomfortable, particularly when you have window seats with no window and a pillar that intrudes into your space resulting in zero space, particularly if you have someone larger next to you.

items.title: Fabulous service…
items.review_text: We had a fabulous experience travelling standard premier London to Brussels on 18 August.  The 9116 Team were so kind and thoughtful. It was my mum’s 70th birthday and they made her feel so special even gifting her a bottle of champagne to celebrate her special day with.

items.title: Nowhere near enough seating in the…
items.review_text: Nowhere near enough seating in the waiting area

items.title: Awful- cancellation process is terrible
items.review_text: The worst non-experience. We were unable to make our trip due to an injury/medical emergency in the family, so we had to cancel our trip. I called a week prior to our booking date and time- maybe an hour before our future departing time. However, I was told because it was outside of the 7- day period, they could not cancel and refund us the money. They are extremely uncooperative and do not care at all about an hour difference of being outside of their “seven day period” for cancellations. We even had insurance, to which the claim couldn’t be made and was said to take 6-8 weeks anyway. Something that could have been cancelled in minutes ended up with us at a loss of $992 and a trip we couldn’t even make. Very unhelpful. Zero customer service consideration. I guess everyone should clearly “read the fine print” if they ever get into an accident or injury or other emergency that prevents their trip.

items.title: The London terminal is awful
items.review_text:
OMG the London terminal is awful and the toilets especially are a disgrace - just appalling.

Would take so little to solve this, just feels like Eurostar has given up. 

Such a shame.  Avoid it if you can.

items.title: Awful experience from the start to the…
items.review_text:
Awful experience from the start to the end.
It is certainly a very lucrative business. 18 carriages filled with passengers paying a fortune for tickets. About 14 trains a day. But passengers only get a minimum necessary. Shame. 
Very noisy, dirty and crowded in London terminal. Not enough seating.
Same in Paris. Too many passengers and not enough space, no seats, very uncomfortable, very limited offer in the evening in the cafes. Dirty, smelly toilet, no soap, broken hand dryers. Shocking.

items.title: Poor service
items.review_text:
Poor service, I wanted to change my £600 tickets from Paris to Lille…. Nope not allowed …… - I escalated receiving  a firm no again.

Promised call backs never happened - I’ll not be booking any further travel through this inflexible company.

items.title: An insult to the human condition
items.review_text:
A sick joke.
This is a train with seats as cramped as an economy airline.
I've travelled on the bullet trains in Japan, where people are typically short, and they have better seats and more legroom.  Whoever designed this garbage needs a good public flogging.
Worse, it has apparently been this way since its inception and, despite numerous people pointing out the problem, they've done nothing to address it.
If you are over 6'2", or have long legs, you might want to travel another way.  I'm 6'5" and my legs are currently splayed around the seat in front of me, they won't fit behind it.
I suppose the train itself was foreshadowed by the waiting room at St. Pancras, where they tell yo to arrive 90 min before your departure, then provide seating for only about half the travellers as you wait a full hour in the lounge prior to boarding.
The final insult, the announcement as you depart about how they are concerned for your comfort.
If this is the best of Anglo-French engineering, I'll count my blessings if I arrive alive.

items.title: Unexcusably terrible service
items.review_text:
We were on a trip from Lille, France to London, UK and the trip was supposed to take 1,5 hours. Unluckily I had chosen to go with Eurostar. We randomly stopped for almost 3 hours tripling the time it took me to get to London.

For the inconvenience we were supposed to get refunds on our tickets if we submitted a request on their site. Not at all surprisingly, when me and my family tried to submit a request, it didn't work. We tried a few times and another few times another day and it never worked. 

So then we decided to send a message to their customer service. There was plenty of time to get a refund, a whole 28 days, so surely we would be able to work this out with the customer service before then, right? WRONG! It has been 2 months now and we have yet to hear back from them. I'm not sure they'd give us a refund anymore even if they did message us back.

TL;DR Eurostar is a terrible way to get to or from the UK and you should stay away if possible.

items.title: Good trip and good staff on train but…
items.review_text: Good trip and good staff on train but the large waiting room was like a cattle pen with the usual limited seating particularly for the aged and infirm and nearly no information re train platforms until 20 minutes pre departure. Why do train services such as the Underground do this? Have they any idea where the train is leaving from till 2 minutes pre departure? If elderly, get prepared somehow.

items.title: Awful experience with Eurostar customer services
items.review_text: Awful experience with Eurostar's customer services, who told me to change my ticket as there are no credit/gift card  options, even though I explained we would be travelling to Paris with our 12 week old baby who could die from the heatwave. We have wasted £400 on TWO economy tickets for us to go with our baby and 3 year old. Eurostar used to offer compassionate customer support (I used to use it for years). Our current experience means we will now throw away £400 and NEVER use Eurostar again. Extremely disappointing.

items.title: Slechte service!!
items.review_text: Onlangs geboekt voor Novemer. In eerste instantie gekeken voor trein + hotel via Eurostar. Daarna voor losse treintickets en hotel los. Dit bleek goedkoper dus treintickets geboekt. Dit bleek uiteindelijk voor 1 persoon ipv 2 personen. Direct proberen te annuleren, maar dit kon niet. Contact opgenomen om de treintickets om te zetten naar 2 treintickets en hotel. Meerdere malen gebeld, maar geen NL medewerkers beschikbaar. Via de mail kon het niet opgelost worden en er is een week geleden beloofd dat ik die dag nog gebeld zou worden door een NL medewerker. Tot op de dag van vandaag niets gehoord en ook geen reactie meer op de mails. Ontzettend slechte service!!!

items.title: For once I took the Eurostar to go to…
items.review_text: For once I took the Eurostar to go to Paris from London as I usually drive. The train stopped at Lille and we were asked to board another train for some obscure reasons (like the other train was unable to cross the Channel). Anyways, I missed my TGV connection because of this and I had to buy another TGV ticket. When I asked to be reimbursed they told me to contact my own travel insurance company. Apparently it's on the small print: they're NOT responsible for any delays. Next time I'm driving.

items.title: Amsterdam to London
items.review_text:
We traveled from Amsterdam to London recently, the no changes journey was fine. However the terminal at Amsterdam Central is not fit for purpose it is far too small for the amount of passengers with toilet facilities that are abysmal. 
What could have been a pleasant journey spoilt from the start.

items.title: Terrible provision for bikes
items.review_text: Terrible provision for bikes. Eurostar staff from both Paris and London suggested the recent need to box bikes was unneeded and enforced by French border forces to spite the British for Brexit

items.title: Wifi was awful
items.review_text: Wifi was awful. Had to wait to get off the train and get good WiFi to post. Sort it out Eurostar, for the money everyone pays surely you can provide better WiFi.

items.title: Ableist, inaccessible
items.review_text: Eurostar already fails to discount travel for disabled customers. On this basis, I was surprised and saddened that, having epilepsy, they chose to charge me to change my trains following the event of a seizure. This is an inaccessible service to travelers with mobility issues of any kind and they expect you to pay for being disabled. In 2023, I expect better and I advise people who care about inclusivity and oppose discrimination to avoid travelling with Eurostar in the future.

items.title: Not great communication
items.review_text: Not great communication when going through check in. Delayed trains both ways. Leave plenty of time to get through

items.title: Terrible service..
items.review_text:
I booked a two way trip through the app of Eurostar from Amsterdam to London and I was supposed to get on the thalys train to Belgium to then hop on the Eurostar train from Belgium to London. 
Then I got an e-mail from the thalys conpany saying that during a period of time most of their trains were cancelled due to maintenance service so I had to re-book the whole trip from Amsterdam to London as there was no other connection available. In their e-mail they told me it was cost-free. However I had to pay the full amount of €280 euro since it was very short notice and it is very difficult to get in contact with the customer service from either Eurostar or Thalys about this issue. 
I had to re-book the trip and pay the jackpot amount for a trip that I originally already payed for. 

Afterwards I tried to contact Eurostar and Thalys about this and they both referred me to the other party clearly not going to help me out. As a customer I felt really betrayed by both of these companies because they seem to not care about their customers at all. After a while I decided to give it another try. I send Eurostar a very detailed e-mail explaining the whole situation also mentioning that in the message from Thalys they told me it was going to be cost-free to reschedule that trip. 

It took 5 weeks to reply and the only message I got was an automated message saying: "Thanks for contacting us in regards of our services. We hope your questions got answered and the problem is solved. This case will be closed but if you require further assistance do not hesitate to contact us again." 

They have not solved ANYTHING they are simply ignoring me and they put an automated system in place to just make me shut up. I am still very angry about this because in the end it is not my fault that the thalys train was cancelled for a trip I already payed for. 

There is literally no help from any customer support and now I feel afraid every single time I book a trip from Eurostar that the very same thing will happen again. 

They do not care a slightest bit.

items.title: Loyalty Program
items.review_text:
Loyalty Program
Being a regular traveller, getting points for each travels.
Firstly the points are not added automatically for most of the time, which is already an issue, and need to do it manually.
For 2 months their website was having a "glitch" and couldn't add any missing travel to get the points.
Once the system was working again it was then too late to claim my missing points because you can do so only after 90 days of the travel.
I called the customer service (took about 30 minutes) and they explained that now it's too late and that even if their website is not working I need to take "responsibility" for my points and I should have called them after each travel.
Seriously ?

items.title: London to Paris
items.review_text: Me and Family went to Paris on 31st of July 2023 from London and at St Pancras Eurostar station toilets and baby changing area was very dirty very bad smell, bins were full, floors were dirty and wet I almost vomited. Staff on the platform so rude and not helpful when I asked a question I was ignored by staff member. Staff really need to go for customer service training. Our train seats were dirty previous passengers food mess was not cleaned. Returning back from Paris to London passport control queue was really long staff was walking around but not willing to help.

items.title: Why is there no separate Business…
items.review_text: Why is there no separate Business Premier track at Paris Gare du Nord and no proper signage to Eurostar, no signage for the lifts. Very few staff and they do not help. Business Premier is a waste of money.

items.title: Terrible company and terrible customer…
items.review_text: Terrible company and terrible customer service. According to their website, tickets are changeable for up to 7 days paying the fare difference. However, when I tried I’m unable to change because I’m booked on a “non-changeable fare” they didn’t inform me of that but I’m left to suffer. Outrageous.

items.title: Mega hohe Verspätung
items.review_text: Mega hohe Verspätung

items.title: Bad Customer Service (Club Eurostar Points)
items.review_text:
I am traveling with Eurostar once a month approximately. When I book my trip, it is always mentioned that my Eurostar points will be added after my journey. However, I checked my account and what a surprise to see that my point have not been added to my Club Eurostar Points that could allow me to get free return tickets or other perks. 
I called Eurostar's customer service this morning and had the most inconsiderate person on the phone. I was explaining calmly that this is not fair because points should have been added "automatically" and what has been answered to me is that "you have to take responsibility over your Club Eurostar membership and connect once in a while to see if points have been added or not". For an "automatic process", this is quite a joke and I was expecting far better given the usual great service we have at the station and in the train. Also, as a recurring traveller, I am choosing Eurostar for ecological reasons but I will now consider taking the plane more often.

items.title: Eurostar Brussels
items.review_text: Eurostar Brussels. A German train arrived late and despite having 30 mins until departure Eurostar refused to allow any non-business passengers through. Several business passengers went through. There was plenty of time to allow everyone through.

items.title: Left my laptop in Premier business…
items.review_text: Left my laptop in Premier business lounge at St Pancras on the 13h of July, wrote to eurostar the next day. The last known location of the laptop was the business lounge. Despite contant reminders, Eurostar has not provided any meaningful feedback. Does it mean that business lounge staff have the right to use their clients private property?

items.title: Booked travel assist as I am a powered…
items.review_text: Booked travel assist as I am a powered wheelchair user. Arriving at Paris from the south of France, the Eurostar staff asked me numerous times if I needed a ramp to get on board. Travel assist did not exist. The staff of Eurostar at Gare du Nord were unhelpful and have clearly never met a disabled person before, as they were certainly acting that way. I will never travel with Eurostar again.

items.title: Eurostar
items.review_text: Trains to and from Paris were late as the boarding process is chaotic. Gare du Nord check-in and passport control is just a disaster. Enormous queues at passport control, virtually no signage and it is impossible to find the access to the Business Premier track. It took over an hour to get through passport control and there is no lift in operation to the upper floor where both check-in and passport control are located. Business Premier is not worth the money, the lounge in St Pancras has limited facilities and a poor choice of food and I couldn’t use the lounge in Paris as there was not time.

items.title: Anita has let other great Eurostar employees down
items.review_text:
So I was on the 9106 from London to Amsterdam on the 5th July. Due to issues outside of Eurostars control (Storm in Netherlands) my train terminated in Brussels.
 
 I opted to stay the night in Brussels and continue my journey on the first Eurostar train from Brussels in the morning (This was the 9106 9.13am train). This part of the issue appears to have been resolved. Advised they have refunded the hotel (still not received it but accept it will take 28 days).
 
I spoke to numerous Eurostar employees who generally were amazing and supportive. I was told to speak to the train manager on the platform and on asking a number of Eurostar employees I was pointed to someone that said she was the train manager, she had a radio and badge stating this.
She advised as I was in standard Premier that I go to the front of the train.
I walked to the front and waited for the train to arrive. Anita (spelling?) then approached me as the train arrived saying ‘you stood there and didn’t speak to me I am the train manager and I say who gets on this train’. I tried to explain to Anita that I had thought I had spoken to the manager but she did not listen l, she was rude aggressive and stated numerous times she was the manager and there’s no other managers. She saw me get on the train in carriage 16.
When the tain left Anita came up to me and was very argumentative from the start she was incredibly rude and would not allow me to explain to her that I was told to speak to the train manager which I did she then proceeded to say she was the only manager on the train. Said to me as my original ticket was coach 14 (still standard premier it was actually coach 1) that I had to move all my luggage to this coach even though there were lots of free seats in the standard premier carriage I was in. I tried to discuss with her that would it be ok to stay where I am. She spoke over me stated I was rude and that she says what happens.
She continued saying how rude I was even looking at other passengers saying he’s so rude. She then left. 
Later in the journey another train manager did an announcement to say she along with Anita were the train managers. Anita said she was the only manager?
 
About 1 hour into the journey Anita came back to me asked for my ticket and said your ticket is coach 1 there is no issue. 
Anita then continued to be very rude not listening to me and again making it clear to other passengers how ‘rude’ I was supposedly being. 
 
She then took the details of my ticket and said she was going to make a complaint about me.
 
As someone who works in customer services and conflict resolution I see the way Anita approached the situation from the moment I arrived at the train was clearly aggressive. Not at any point did she accept anything I said even when I reminded her that the announcement said two train managers. She walked away saying you are very rude loudly so the whole carriage heard.
 
I travel by Eurostar a lot and on the whole the staff are amazing on this occasion Anita completely let the name of Eurostar down.

I have raised this with support however unlike my other requests this has simply been ignored

items.title: Seat reservation cancelled on the day, 2hr delay despite other seats being available.
items.review_text:
I was travelling from London to Paris (with an onward connection) and the seat I had booked on the train didn't exist. I arrived in plenty of time but they had reconfigured the train so the coach I was booked on was no longer running. I followed the instructions to rebook my seat and received a new seat number, but it failed to show up on their system. I was held before security at the desk for 1hr while "computer said no". There were several families who were split up with children having seats, but not the parents, but the staff were unable to reallocate the seating.

The staff could see available seats on the train, but they were unable to allocate them or switch them between passengers and spent >20 minutes trying to open the computer booking system. They continued to sell tickets for the following train while we were waiting, and eventually these were sold out also, so we had to wait a further hour. We were also told that seats were available in Premier Class, but they were unable to upgrade our tickets.

In total I was 2hrs delayed, having not been able to get on my scheduled train or the next one, due to incompetence and outdated computer systems. I missed my onward connection and had to pay an additional 100€ for a replacement ticket. The compensation I was offered was only 50% of the original ticket price (~£30).

items.title: Disappointing Experience!
items.review_text: I never had any problems with the Eurostar until the 4th of June coming back from Amsterdam due to signal failure. That's obviously out of their control but what I found so shocking, was the treatment by the staff on the ground in Amsterdam. We were already waiting for quite some time with no information, when we were told to change the platform. We were then able to board the train, but there was no information from then on. At some point I actually saw the staff pass my window with all of their cases while the passengers still sat on the train with no information. We must've sat there for another hour or so until they told us that the train was cancelled. I just really couldn't believe that they were all leaving, while we were left with no information. Absolutely shocking! I immediately booked myself on the next train going back to London in the morning and paid for it out of my own pocket before trying to find a last minute hotel. The IBIS next to the train station was the logical option, since my train was going at 7:45. So because of the delay in the information about the cancellation, the hotel price went up by nearly £100. So I turned up at 6:45 the next morning only to find that this train was cancelled too. The scenario was similar to the day before, no information of the staff who were literally standing inside the building looking at us, while we were all standing in the cold outside with no clue what was going on. They eventually came out and told us that the train was cancelled and that we would have to make our own way to Rotterdam and then take a bus to Brussels, or take a Flixbus to Brussels. It's about another two hours on the bus to get there, plus the journey to the actual bus station where the Flixbus goes from. I took up that option, but then again, Eurostar wasn't really accommodating and we felt left to our own devices. Now I only get a small amount of what I actually had to pay out of my own pockets, and they only refund you after 28 days and I don't have that disposable income to wait that long! It is really not a very good service at all. I think the problem isn't so much the issues, like signal failures or cancelled trains, it's rather the way they are responding to it, no one seems to be responsible, or takes up the task to inform customers of what's going on. I think Eurostar should start with customer service training first for their staff and then make connections to local hotels or transport companies, they can then give out vouchers and the companies then can handle the details. It doesn't take much....

items.title: I was going from London to Amsterdam on…
items.review_text: I was going from London to Amsterdam on the 5 July. They cancelled the train at Brussels and kicked everyone out of the train. I had to change 7 vehicles to go to Amsterdam from where they cancelled the train. Even though their staff said there will be compensation for the passengers, there is no compensation or refund at all. This is the most ridiculous travel company I've tried. I'll never use it again. They took the money for the train ticket but didn't even complete the route.

items.title: Values money over customer safety
items.review_text: I requested them to allow cancellation of my Paris trip due to ongoing violence. They refused upfront. This demonstrates the ethical standards this company follows. Money over humanity! I wish I could give them 0 stars

items.title: Positive Experience with Eurostar Despite Challenges and Delays.
items.review_text:
A while back, I encountered a few challenges enroute to Eurostar, including cancellations out of my control, and a major incident during my journey. As a result, I was unable to reach my destination on time and had to reschedule for the following day. However, I must commend the helpfulness of Eurostar, and one particular staff member I spoke to over the phone. They guided me through the necessary procedures to change my ticket for the next available train the next morning.
To my surprise, when I called again to finalise the process, another staff member informed me that my request couldn't be accommodated. Determined to resolve the issue, I made another attempt and took the time to explain the situation once more. Thankfully, this time my concern was understood, and my ticket was successfully changed. Although it involved some back-and-forth and took longer than expected, I was immensely grateful and relieved that I didn't have to purchase a more expensive ticket or face additional hassles.
In addition to these challenges, there were some unavoidable delays during my journey with Eurostar, which coincided with fashion week. Considering the circumstances, such delays were somewhat expected. However, despite these setbacks, I found the overall experience to be positive and hassle-free. The convenience of travelling via Eurostar far outweighed the inconveniences I encountered. I am genuinely satisfied with the service and will definitely choose Eurostar again in the future, as it provides a more seamless and enjoyable alternative to air travel.

items.title: Eurostar needs to up it's game
items.review_text: Eurostar needs to up it's game. Queuing is never good. Today trains and stations are filthy. Does this company have any pride in its service? Oh and travelling from Dover to Brussels an hour in the wrong direction and hour back and two hours recommend check-in at Brussels...this should be a one hour fifteen clean seamless journey.

items.title: Awful awful awful
items.review_text: Awful awful awful . Trying to board from France to London today , we have been queuing for 2 hours. It’s a completely chaotic system manned by totally ineffectual staff . People are fainting my and there is a series of seemingly pointless queues . I will never use this service again , it’s marketed as an easy alternative  to flying - it has been absolutely horrendous and dehumanising

items.title: Bad service overall
items.review_text: Terminals not fit for purpose, very poor communication, incompetent (dis) - organisation of boarding. Euros tar seems to be competing with Ryanair for the worst quality of service.

items.title: Extremely disappointed with Eurostar's seat change policy
items.review_text: Extremely disappointed with Eurostar's seat change policy. Spent time for a front facing, windows seat and I received an email for seat change facing backwards with no view. This isn't the first one; it is happening every time. At least change it like for like.

items.title: Learned something new
items.review_text:
I had booked myself a ticket. Later I added my servicedog to my booking. This addition made the entire booking a complete disaster.
After some discussions, debates and a full blown panic attack in a crowded St Pancras, all was resolved and I had a pleasant journey. At least, as pleasant as a journey can be after such an experience. 
Although things were taken care of on the day of the trip, I had to beg for a formal apology. This, thankfully, I got. This trip taught me how to make my next booking. Hopefully things will go smoothly next time

items.title: I think management have given up...
items.review_text:
I think management have given up...
They don't maintain their website anymore, they hardly have customer service anymore, trains run late very frequently with insane queues, they don't put soap on the train and bother you throughout your journey Ryanair-style. I mean, they don't have to, they have a monopoly, why try?

items.title: Is Eurostar on the brink of collapsing?
items.review_text: Is Eurostar on the brink of collapsing? Horrible experience as a whole. Website is limited once you start to create multi family trips and ticket changes require calls to customer services only. Lonnngggggg (expect minimum 1 and 1/2 hours) waiting times for customer services to take your calls (but quite polite people). Customer service by email is inexistant althrough send online form option is available. Add to this frequent train delays ...

items.title: Couldn't organise a proverbial P!$$ Up in a brewery
items.review_text: Where do we start, well at St Pancras of course. The food was overpriced and limited in the terminal, the toilets were so smelly that it actually made me feel like vomiting. Left the gate call until 20minutes before departure, which caused absolute carnage with the boarding, including people getting injured as it was a free for all to get on the train. The hotel we booked as a package with the train was supposed to be 3 star, But it was terrible with a very rude owner, it made fawlty towers look like a 7 star luxury resort. They obviously never stayed or checked it's credentials before making them a supplier, poorest quality of food, facilities and service i have ever experienced. Nobody ever followed up after the complaint and only offered a change of hotel, but couldn't verify the quality or location of the hotel, also offered after the check out time so we was also going to get charged for the hell hole we was in for an extra night with no offer of any financial assistance for the extra outlay or inconvenience. Really ruined a birthday treat to Paris for me and my wife. never even got a chance to follow up on the complaint or experience, Basically they had our money, the trip was over so they don't care at all.

items.title: If you need to be treated like catle…
items.review_text: If you need to be treated like catle then you are at the right place.

items.title: Apprenti chef de gare, des incapables
items.review_text: Des incapables ! Les gens arrivent 3 h à l'avance et les grilles se ferment devant eux pfff impossible de les réouvrir d'après eux et deux adolescents restent coincés à Londres après avoir vu le train passer devant eux... pour une maman,  ne même pas avoir un incapable au téléphone,  c'est inacceptable. En plus, ils doivent aller à  Werchter, vous remboursez aussi ça Eurostar de m... vous avez payé l'hôtel et le train de Bruxelles à Liège,  mais quoi ? Quel sérieux pfff lamentable !

items.title: J’adorais voyager avec Eurostar
items.review_text: J’adorais voyager avec Eurostar. Sur les 5 derniers voyages j’ai eu entre 1h et 2h de retard ou voir même annulation à 23h30 d’un train prévu à 21h... Je me débrouille encore pour trouver du logement et j'annule donc mon ticket pcq il était déjà 22h et aucun remboursement!!  ça devient n’importe quoi.
