4. There is no accessible premier lounge in Amsterdam. They will force you into the terminal 45 min prior to departure and keep you in a cramped space with no seating space. Business Premier Lounge promised as part of the ticket. In London maybe, not in Amsterdam.

5. It's cold in the top Business Class Cabin. Feet and legs freezing. The air circulation is as good as a cheap car from 2014. 

Also I feel the need to mention that the waiters and the managers have so much to learn when it comes to basic service and professionalism. I do wonder where they recruit them from and what kind of training they get. 

How, on earth, do they get away with it? Never again, at least with a flight it only last 40 mins, it's cheaper. Don't give these thugs your money.

items.title: Slechtste klantenservice OOIT
items.review_text: Trein staking op 16 december. Krijg de mogelijkheid om om te boeken, maar de site werkt niet en kan het niet telefonisch omzetten, contactformulier invullen heeft ook geen zin, ze reageren niet. Verschrikkelijk frustrerende ervaring. De zoveelste keer, ben er helemaal klaar mee. Nooit meer, voortaan weer lekker vliegen. Goedkoper, sneller, makkelijker.

items.title: Worst service ever…
items.review_text:
Worst service ever and despicable behaviour from french staff.
Queued up for a hour at Disney to catch the train home only to be told no more passengers were allowed on and it left half empty.
Left stranded at Disney Paris no way to get home. No more trains to London.

items.title: Worst customer service ever
items.review_text: Our train from Amsterdam was cancelled.Eurostar said that we could reschedule it. This has proved impossible,web site doesn't work,app doesn't work,no replies to emails and call centre not taking calls. Also call centre closed at weekends.Worst customer service ever!!

items.title: Worst service
items.review_text: Faced delay of 6 hours and cancelled trains in the past 3 times of traveling with Eurostar. Plus they have the worst customer service, waited for them to pick up the phone after 1.5 hours and still nothing…If there’s another choice of train operator I’d definitely take it.

items.title: A great experience
items.review_text: A great experience, everything ran on time and it was much easier than flying! Thanks to both the French and English teams for making this a seamless experience for us this weekend.

items.title: DRAMA !
items.review_text:
Vertrek ruimte Rotterdam veel te klein voor het aantal passagiers, vertraging op Brussel heen reis 20 minuten.
Vertraging terug 45 minuten op Brussel door defecte trein.
8-12-2022

Wees verstandig en neem het vliegtuig !!!

items.title: Eurostar rips its customers off again
items.review_text:
Eurostar rips its customers off again 

French rail strike, every other rail company is offering free rebooking or refunds EXCEPT the criminals at Eurostar.

items.title: Nul points for customer service
items.review_text: Nul points for customer service. Eurostar say their tickets are completely flexible but it isn't true. My wife who is Chinese and doesn't speak English very well changed her ticket on the website and accidentally upgraded and was charged more. We rang them and asked could they correct what was an obvious mistake. No chance. They just stonewalled referring us to terms and conditions etc. According to the letter of the rules they're within their rights but why would such a huge company behave so badly towards its customers? We're not rich and like everyone else we're suffering from the rising cost of living. Talk about destroying goodwill.

items.title: A company which just doesn’t care
items.review_text:
London St Pancras: a departure lounge with not enough seats for one train of passengers.

Amsterdam: queuing in the rain outside to enter security. Not enough waiting room seats for one train of passengers.  People standing or sitting on the floor for unreasonable lengths of time.

Take a plane for the same money, benefit from getting there hours earlier and having some existent customer service if you do need to contact someone about your booking.

items.title: Standard premier is better seats but whole experience underwhelming
items.review_text: Standard premier basically is better seats but nothing else. Staff disappear after handing out trays. Toilets in Gare du Nord have no working hand dryer and same problem on board. No power sockets on single seats. Long security lines in St Pancras whilst Paris was better on that front. Not sure it’s any less stressful than flying.

items.title: Perfecte manier om naar Londen te…
items.review_text: Perfecte manier om naar Londen te reizen: treinen stipt op tijd , inchecken goed geregeld , ook in economy heel comfortabel reizen en je stapt hartje Londen uit !

items.title: Dishonest comms
items.review_text: Dishonest comms.  Problems yesterday with uk end, delays.  First train today delayed by minimum 50 mins.  Why take our details if not to text us of expected schedule change?  This has never been a transparent company,

items.title: Poor service
items.review_text: Cancelled my train, website failed, nobody answered the phone. Eventually rebooked via Twitter DM.  Then a long battle with Customer Care over compensation as only option was next day, needing hotel. Finally agreed to pay (not quite the full cost) and told money would be in my account within 21 days.  It wasn't.  Mailed, tweeted, eventually told it would take another 3 weeks.  Now waiting.....

items.title: Over 90 mins delay and nothing from Eurostar
items.review_text: Over 90 mins delay to service (still waiting) but other than what I read in online news - absolutely zero communication by staff at station.  The app shows as my train has left.. but all the passengers are sat in the waiting room having queued for an hour after advertised departure.  Everyone stressed (staff and customers alike) but staff just ignoring the long lines of customers.  I fully get things go wrong but if Eurostar made at least some attempt to announce what is going on, what they expect to happen and gave updates every 20 mins or so they would make things much easier for themselves and the paying customers.  Use this service for work trips and will fly next time as longer but I have more trust.  Shame..

items.title: Amazing support and service
items.review_text: I cannot thank Eurostar enough and specifically Mr D Gutierrez-Sierra in the terminal services team. As a charity who travel with large groups of terminally ill children the station is one of our most daunting times and he made things as smooth as simple as they could be. So many families were made to feel at ease. in what i appreciate is a high pressured environment he really took the time to help and nothing was too much. thankyou !

items.title: The WORST!!
items.review_text: Also the worst service, I had bought a dar ticket in EURAIL and reserved a ticket to travel from United Kingdom to France with Aural. the online page didn't work and they didn't answer my e mail or anything before the dar so because in the app says that you can do the reservation on the train station I intended to do that ant arrived 2 hours early to the station, but the men that atended told me that with Aural I could not make it, that he didn't kew why if I had the ticket in my cell phone but if I wanted to travel I had to buy again the ticket with them, and because I had to leave I did, Wasting a lot of money just because the companies aren't efficient

items.title: Eurostar enables aggressors on their trains and xenophobic behaviour
items.review_text:
Eurostar enables aggressors on their trains. I was assaulted by a man inside the train. He tried to take my phone from my hands and throw it away. As a result, I defended myself, and guess who was kicked out of her seat and threaten to be kicked out of the train? ME! because I am a foreigner and I have handicap issues. 

The French manager on the train commanded me to be quiet for the rest of the journey and threaten me in several occasions to kick me out of the train. I have to disclose my health issues so he could stop harassing me while I was crying.

You know what the Eurostar customer service thinks about enabling an aggressor on the train? We are sorry but nothing else we can do. Shame on you and all the services which allow xenophobia and abusing a person in a status of handicap.

items.title: Such horrendous customer service
items.review_text:
Such horrendous customer service. 
I'm still in shock that I have paid so much money to a company that values people so little. 

I have spent over a month trying to contact customer service regarding 3 tickets to Belgium as my booking reference was not recognised on my account. In the end I had to go to Kings Cross to actually speak to someone, who told me the case was closed. Even though I had no response! 

I would recommend that anyone wanting to book a Eurostar train think twice. I will fly from now on.

items.title: Destroyed Bag - Paris Eurostar - Security
items.review_text:
I was traveling on the Eurostar from Paris Gare Du Nord to London St Pancras on 5 August and during the X ray security scanner, my bag was caught in the conjoining conveyor belt and destroyed the leather strap on my bag. Eurostar are now refusing to compensate me for the FULL damage of the bag only part of it - which is absurd! 

NOTE: Eurostar staff say this is an everyday occurrence so my complaint will not come to a surprise. Their conveyor belt is designed for industrial purposes not for everyday passenger bag use. Ladies - be aware of your expensive bags!

items.title: Fly instead. Even Ryan air would be better.
items.review_text:
Fly instead.

Even Ryan air would offer a better experience.

Before Brexit I used Eurostar for business and holidays. This was my first post-brexit use or it will also be my last.

Chaotic, stressful and crowded at St Pancras. Incompetent and surly staff moving queues around seemingly at random and don't even seem to be working on the same system - one guy moving people from the front of the queue to the back and another taking them back to the front again.

Security was abysmal and poor signage for passport control saw many people directed to the wrong machines which somehow work even less well than the ones at Gatwick.

Then you are dumped in a filthy crowded space to wait for the trains, toilets were grim. Some of the escalators to the trains were broken.

The train itself crowded, overheated and smelly with the caridge fittings looking distinctly tired and worn. It was at least cleaner than the station.

Clearly Brexit had imposed some practical challenges on the Eurostar. But inadequate training for staff and poor planning at every stage of the in-station process make a small problem far larger and leave the Eurostar unfit for purpose and to be avoided as far as possible.

items.title: Eurostar/Thalys issues Ams-London
items.review_text:
GENERAL: Usually the service is fine so giving 3 stars average.
THALYS ISSUES: However, not so when I booked a Eurostar ticket Ams->Lon. The Thalys train (ticket provided by Eurostar) was cancelled and no information provided anywhere. Eurostar guided us to international train information where they didn't know what to do. When arriving at Brussels we had to buy new tickets for the slower IC service from our own pocket. There was no information then or now, and the Eurostar website says there is no compensation. I emailed Eurostar and after a very long time received an automated response asking if my query was somehow resolved now considering they had not taken any action... After another response I received a personal email, saying they could only refund the ticket Brussels-Ams that I paid out of my own pocket. This is unacceptable.
TIP: Take care when booking a ticket for Amsterdam, make sure you have a DIRECT connection without Thalys as they get cancelled frequently - this is not very clear on the Eurostar website when booking.

items.title: Not dog friendly
items.review_text:
Every dog can travel on any train in England. 
Every dog can travel on any train in France.
Except on the only one connecting UK and France.

items.title: Juste odieux
items.review_text: Juste odieux. Plus de 45 minutes de retard. Aucune explications ,sauf à expliquer qu'une affluence de passagers en serait l'origine,  juste ridicule.  Il vaut mieux privilégier l'avion, moins cher et plus professionnel.

items.title: Trips is horrible
items.review_text: Tips is horrible! Unbelievable bad! They cancelled without any notications and made me wait 2 hrs for changing the tickets. In the end, I forced to change my day off my trip and all booking of hotels etc was wasted! They also allow people jump into the line and there is no control

items.title: Is Easy Jet Running Eurostar?
items.review_text:
What went wrong this time? What went right? 
Between the unexplained delays coming and going, mad, crazy dash to make our connections very spotty internet service and a security check and waiting room at St.Pancras that made the bus-like conditions on the train feel like a private lounge for royalty!? 
So sadly disappointed!

items.title: Ignored on business from Paris to…
items.review_text:
Ignored on business from Paris to London when it came to being served a meal. The staff hadn’t bother stopping to ask what I wanted after giving me a menu earlier  …the row in front wasn’t occupied and eventually I notice people were eating after hearing the chattering of cutlery and looked up the cabin. Not sure how they missed me…they didn’t talk me after giving me my first drink and menu…I  wasn’t even asleep…they must have rushed passed me, that I don’t notice pushing the trolley with food whilst watching my iPad. The entire section had 7-9 people max…they weren’t even busy! I then walked a couple of carriages to the galley to ask about getting a meal and they said there was nothing left…no fish or meat option it had run out, nothing…then they came over 30minutes later with a salad option which I didn’t want. They said they thought I didn’t want food, so asked them what made them think that when they gave me a menu / drink at the start of the journey then ignored me after why they would have thought that…they could not explain..…so no idea where they got that idea from…really doesn’t make sense sounded more like an excuse.

Then 35 minutes before arriving at St Pancras the officered me what looked to be slung together from left overs from other meals, after what they said there were no other meals how did they concoct this meal… £426 for the excuses was what really annoyed me. 

The train wasn’t even that busy leaving early afternoon from Paris. The audacity of the staff making it up on the fly was enough. After that I wasn’t even offered a hot drink until towards the end of the trip …yes  £426 was the price of the ticket…not sure if they had run out and they tried their luck with not serving passengers…and who was least likely to complain!

I wonder if anyone else have has had the same treatment….I am absolutely flabbergasted of their arrogance and excuses. Asif

items.title: Schandelijke behandeling
items.review_text: Door onduidelijke info 30 minuten voor vertrek bij incheck gemeld. We mochten er niet meer door. Vijf minuten na ons een ander stel dat riep ‘business class’ en wel door mocht. Trein gemist, maar we zouden supervisor kunnen spreken. Die was echter direct na vertrek snel naar huis gegaan. Waardeloos!!

items.title: Horrible!!!
items.review_text: Horrible!!!! Train cancellation at the last minute, very unprofessional rude personnel and the internet is non-existent

items.title: TERRIBLE!!! Don’t waste your money!!
items.review_text: If I could give zero stars I would. We arrived 45 minutes before our train from Paris GDN to London St Pancras only to find the Eurostar security/check in station absolutely deserted. We were unable to board our train, and since that was the last one of the day, there was nothing we could do and no one to speak to about it. Do not waste your money with this sham of a service. I am absolutely livid and will be calling to request a refund and compensation for additional travel costs.

items.title: Worst Customer Service
items.review_text: I couldnt even take the trip. When the borders closed between england and France on Christmas 2021, Eurostar issued refunds in form of vouchers, which we could use to book another journey. The issue was these vouchers had an expiry date. I tried to redeem the voucher only to relaise I was two days past the expiry date, after mutliple days trying to reach the customer service through emails and hours waiting on the phone they eventually got back to me with no solution, so I just practically donated money to Eurostar. They have by far the worst customer service...hard to reach with zero solutions.

items.title: We had almost 3 hours delay
items.review_text: We had almost 3 hours delay, as we went to London Eurostar simply decided to deduct the time difference which meant we weren't able to get the legally communicated amount. I just decided to accept it as it took me 2/3 months to get a response and there is no proper way to reach this company. I'm very dissapointed.

items.title: Je prends l'eurostar pour Londres
items.review_text: Je prends l'eurostar pour Londres, mais sur place, on me change mon billet retour sans me demander mon avis et je ne peux même pas refuser sinon je dois acheter un autre billet ! Alors mon week-end est réduit et de plus je dois par leur faute changer tout mes transferts et correspondance ! Ça c'est du service client minable !

items.title: Pitoyable
items.review_text: L'union de la France et du Royaume Uni ou le pire de chaque. Le hall attente et les toilettes sont sales, le hall et les quais sont strictement non fumeur même si l'on exige des voyageurs qu'ils arrivent une heure en avance...ils se prennent pour un aéroport sans s'en donner les moyens.

items.title: Niet heel enthousiast.
items.review_text:
We gingen heen met Thalys van R’dam naar Brussel, en met Eurostar verder naar Londen, terug hadden we een rechtstreekse trein. We zijn niet heel enthousiast. Wat goed was: de treinrit, supersnel, aankomst in centrum Londen. Vrijwel geen vertraging. 
Wat minder goed beviel: gestress over het halen van onze aansluiting in Brussel, omdat de treinen voor die van ons vertraging hadden (het ging uiteindelijk goed), onhandige info vanuit Eurostar mbt deel van de reis met Thalys (onduidelijk hoe lang je van te voren op het station moest zijn voor Thalys; een sms dat je in Brussel 2 u van te voren aanwezig moet zijn, terwijl onze overstaptijd 45 min was), extreem trage baggagecontrole in Londen, te weinig ruimte op de stations voor zoveel passagiers (1 of 2 roltrappen waar een hele treinlading passagiers tegelijk op moet).

items.title: Booked a weekend trip from London to…
items.review_text: Booked a weekend trip from London to Brussels and the hotel was in a red light district and there were crack heads outside the hotel reception (best western city centre, Brussels). Made a complaint on the euro star website over a month ago. No reply or even acknowledgement. Terrible.

items.title: Customer service is non-existent!
items.review_text: Customer service is non-existent. Eurostar announced cancellations on 3 November but seats on the only available train were expectedly filled up and there were also no subsequent trains available on other days. The request for a partial refund did not work because I could only claim if the journey had been confirmed cancelled? This was for a one time only business trip so what use was a voucher? Flights were organised at great expense and now the trains were announced as reinstated yesterday - 2 whole days after they were cancelled with still no response from Customer Service. Of course, the only options available were to change either the train times or keep our tickets because Eurostar understands that we would want this due to the disruption? What a joke of a company that states “Simple and generous compensation policy for delays or cancellations” as one of the reasons to travel with them. It has been anything but that and the company have basically ghosted everyone affected…

items.title: Terrible customer service
items.review_text:
Made a mistake while booking a ticket with a first name, called straight away to correct it.
Was told that I have to pay for it. 
I explained that it was just the first name and also that I book plenty of tickets to Paris as I often work there.
I was told by a woman on the phone that she doesn't need to charge me for correcting the name on the ticket as a gesture of good will BUT on this ocassion she will, as 'it costs the company a lot of money to change a first name'. 
On a digital ticket! 
Come on Eurostar! 
Such a terrible customer service!!!

items.title: Nobody answers the phone. No emails answered. The request form is a joke.
items.review_text:
Nobody answers the phone. Emails are not returned. Tried to change the name - Impossible.
No flexibility, no service.
Other than that, great.
I suggest: better fly with ANY airline.

items.title: Personne ne répond au téléphone suite à…
items.review_text: Personne ne répond au téléphone suite à un pb lié à un voucher. 1h04 d’appel pour finalement raccrocher parce que personne ne décroche…

items.title: Not flexible at all!
items.review_text:
I booked a London to Paris ticket on Eurostar after seeing that Eurostar offered flexible fares. The terms say: Customers can exchange tickets in Standard as many times as they want without paying an exchange fee as long as tickets are exchanged 7 days or more before the departure time of their individual journey.

I am now trying to exchange my ticket for my journey but it will not allow me to amend it to a later day. It comes up with error message - "Sorry, your departure date can’t be after your return date."

Nowhere in the Terms and Conditions of Carriage does it say that the departure date cannot be after the return date. 

I tried to call the Customer Help to ask them where this was stated, but they hung up on me.

items.title: Shocking experience at ticket booth
items.review_text: My issue is mainly with the ticket control. We were travelling with my daughter and her husband and 2 children 5 & 2yo. The station was busy half term many more of us en route to Disneyland Paris. My daughter with the buggy was called out of the queue to go to a vacant desk and we all followed as we were helping with children suitcases etc. my husband and I were told we couldn’t use that kiosk and had to go to the back of the queue. I was incredulous we were one party but had two bookings. She stood there and refused to let us go through even though the booth was now vacant with the lady sat there waiting for the next passenger. I couldn’t believe she wanted us to go and queue again. We had no option and I called her a stupid woman. She came over to my husband  and I back in the queue and said I was lucky she was allowing me to board the train! I said excuse me if you having  an issue address it to me and she said She wasn’t talking to me she was talking to my husband! Just about me! Absolutely disgusted!!

items.title: Poor support
items.review_text:
I took a train London to Paris. It was delayed (more than 4h). Arrived at 01AM in paris and had to take a taxi of course....
They told us in the train we would receive a compensation. But it is impossible to claim on their website. Either you get an answer telling you your claim is not valid, or it simply send you back to the booking page again!!!!
One of the most disorganized company I know and they have a monopoly!!!

items.title: Almost zero customer service now
items.review_text: Tried to reschedule a booking, no way to do it on the app, no-one ever answered the phone, no response to emails, so in the end the date passed. A couple of weeks later they replied to my email and gave me a time limited voucher as a gesture of goodwill even though I was a no show for the original train! I appreciated that they sorted it (kind of) in the end but this is customer service that has sunk below bad.

items.title: Poor service and even worse customer service
items.review_text: A one-star rating is too good for Eurostar.  I booked a train in July 2021 for a return trip to EuroDisney the following February.  In the November 2021 Eurostar informed me that the direct service was cancelled and that they'd changed it to Paris Gar du Nord only, further advising on multi-leg local services for the final part of the journey.  COVID restrictions at EuroDisney then forced a delay in holiday plans for a year so I tried to change my train booking to suit.  Initially there was nothing available on the chosen dates according to Eurostar so I then made an interim return booking, with the plan that I would amend these new dates when the service was again available on the actual dates coinciding with my holiday.  A couple of months later Eurostar then informed me that the return journey had been cancelled, so I tried to cancel the outbound journey as well to then book a new journey to match the holiday.  Once again the Eurostar on-line booking system showed no availability.  I then contacted Customer Service and waited a week before someone got back to me, via email.  The representative advised that she couldn't make amendments either due to an apparent IT issue.  By this time the outward journey of my interim booking had passed so I contacted Customer Services again and actually spoke to someone who advised that, due to my ticket status as showing expired, the system was not allowing changes to be made.  I then explained about the email I'd received from one of her colleagues and was advised that the IT issue was still causing problems and that I would be contacted when it was fixed.  That was over a week ago and I've still heard nothing.  If I do get to EuroDisney I'll make sure I never use Eurostar again.  Totally abysmal service and very amateurish.

items.title: The weak link in our European rail…
items.review_text: The weak link in our European rail journey across France and Spain. Massive queues and an overall sense of chaos outgoing from St Pancras and long delay. Two hour delay coming back. Eurostar seem to have lost the plot.

items.title: no refund for a cancelled train!
items.review_text:
no refund for a cancelled train!

I have tried for months to get Eurostar to issue a refund for my cancelled train, they keep saying that it was not purchased from them. IT WAS! It was purchased from the Eurostar website, and somehow they have issued the tickets via SNCF Connect, and they claimed that I have purchased from a third party. 

Funny enough, SNCF Connect website clearly states that if the tickets were purchased from Eurostar, then Eurostar must be responsible for the problems. 

They are just kicking away their responsibilities to each other and refused to resolve the problem. What a horror!

This company should be jailed for fraud!

items.title: A loyalty scheme that can’t tell you when your points expire
items.review_text:
Surely if you have a good number of loyalty scheme points for travel you would be able to find an expiry date against them. Particularly, you would think, when you get an email saying your points will expire. 

Club Eurostar seems to think it is an exception to this strange idea. Nowhere on the app nor the website under account is it possible to see the expiry date of your points. Nowhere in their FAQs do they think people might have this question.

Not a big ask if you run a loyalty scheme with points to actually tell the customer next to those points when they will expire.

Either this is pure incompetence, or if one were being cynical, one might think they do it intentionally so people’s points expire without them knowing…

Either way it’s pathetic.

items.title: Train cancelled because of train…
items.review_text: Train cancelled because of train strike, message received by an email a few days before returning from Amsterdam. No alternative trains available for over a week so we flew back the following day. Have tried to get refunds for cancelled train on the website. Although my ticket has cancelled stamped across it when you try and get a refund it states your train was not cancelled so please check your booking. Absolutely no way to get any customer service a web form but they do not respond. Avoid at all costs.

items.title: Eurostar what a disgrace
items.review_text: Ihave never seen such a disgrace using Eurostar recently. We are charged a fortune for a ticket to cross the Channel and i spent 2.30 hours freezing cold in the coach on a very uncomfortable seat. The worst was on the return where temperature didn't improve but, also there was a note on the seat 'SEAT OUT OF ORDER, DO NOT USE' ....what was i suppose to do ? get out of the train, get someone from eurostar on the platform who indicated me a free seat ? both seats were awfully dirty, like if someone vomited on them... How can Eurostar decently sell seats that price for offering you such horrible conditions ?this is very shocking. Gare du Nord fiasco on the border control cannot be ignored also... poor service/poor conditions/outrageous prices/ something need to change!

items.title: Terrible company who couldn't care less about customers
items.review_text:
My daughter and I went to Paris for a short break and travelled back on September 9th - after struggling to get our cases onto the high storage shelves (no mean feat for someone who is only 5ft 2) we found that one of our pre-booked, allocated seats had a 'Not In Use' label on the headrest and the seat was soaked with an unknown liquid.
There were no instructions to say where we should sit instead, and no staff members available in the carriage or on the platform so we could ask what we were supposed to do.
My daughter, who has special needs and suffers from social anxiety, had to sit alone on the dry seat while I sat in the closest empty seat I could find. This was very upsetting for her and also embarrassing for me as I had to move four times as more passengers got onto the train and found I was sitting in their pre-booked seats.
Eventually I was able to find a permanent seat for the journey once the train started moving, but my daughter was very upset that she had to sit alone for the whole journey and I was extremely disappointed that despite booking our tickets back in May I almost found myself without a seat for the journey home and that there was no assistance from Eurostar staff. 
I emailed them when I got home to complain and have only just received a lame response today (a month and half later) saying they would pass it on to their cleaning team and that seats aren't guaranteed??!!! 
If we go back we will be flying next time as it is about a third of the cost of this overpriced train run by people who clearly couldn't care less about their customers - and if we pre-book seats we will actually get to sit in them.

items.title: First time in 45 years I’ve been stranded in another country!
items.review_text: Never in 45 years have I been stranded in another country. Until I get a simple text from Eurostar ‘your train has been cancelled. Sorry for the inconvenience’

items.title: Eurostar insurance (Allianz) is a scam
items.review_text:
Eurostar themselves are okay but do not buy their insurance (Allianz). It’s now been 5 months since making a claim and there has been no response at all, even after repeated emails and phone calls to follow up. 

When you call their customer service, expect to be on hold for a while (it took me 1 hour 45 mins for the last call) before being able to speak with an agent. They had records of my emails to them so they did receive them; they just never bothered to respond. I am still struggling to get any compensation back from Allianz; shameful behaviour and obviously their method of trying to get customers to “give up” during the claim process. 

Avoid at all costs, and get your own insurance elsewhere.

items.title: Noch nie habe ich so etwas…
items.review_text: Noch nie habe ich so etwas unorganisiertes erlebt. So ist ÖV nur grässlich. Never again.

items.title: Ridiculously long q
items.review_text: Ridiculously long q with no effective q management. Poor waiting areas. Poor communications and delayed train....First go with eurostar. Back to flying next time

items.title: Bedenk of je wel met Eurostar wilt reizen
items.review_text: Zeer slechte organisatie van reizigers in Londen, veel te lange onduidelijke wachtrijen. Mensonterend!

items.title: Bad customer experience
items.review_text:
Just got an email that my points expired.

A while ago my vouchers for tickets also expired although I could not use them due to travel restrictions because of Covid.

Not nice at all!

items.title: Sadly things are going badly wrong in…
items.review_text: Sadly things are going badly wrong in every respect, I strongly advise that you don’t even attempt to book and certainly not travel with Eurostar for the foreseeable future. The system is exceptionally broken.

items.title: Very uncomfortable
items.review_text: Randomly stopping everywhere for 20+ minutes, or suddenly take a detour here there, no set route for the journey. Train is packed with people too small place with too many people so the air is very stuffy. And then the train just pause somewhere random for unknow amount of time. Really feel uncomfortable

items.title: Avoid adding a hotel booking to your…
items.review_text: Avoid adding a hotel booking to your Eurostar trains as you lose all flexibility on train times. The customer service department is non existent as I’ve spend 2.5 hours on hold.

items.title: No help from Eurostar during UK rail strikes!
items.review_text:
Very disappointed with Eurostar's unaccomodating handling of my relative's inability - due to the UK rail strikes - to reach London to catch his booked Eurostar train to Brussels, as no local trains running on that day. My brother tried to move his ticket on by a day, but was told he will be charged £133 for the privilege even though not his fault. This uncaring company's attitude is obviously: you sort it out yourself, not our problem. No flexibility at all & no chance of compensation if you're stuck.
We became aware of the planned national rail strike before the weekend, so we tried to get in touch with Eurostar which proved impossible: you cannot call them, only email, facebook & twitter messaging so I sent repeated requests to which I did not receive a reply until Monday. Very frustrating. Email was simply responded to automatically by resending the original booking confirmation which is totally useless. 
Terrible customer service by this uncaring company which misuses tax payers money. They have recently closed down two essential Kent stations, Ashford Int'l and Ebbsfleet, and are now saying are not going to reopen for years if at all, taking access away from local people who had to fund these huge projects through their taxes and put up with years of disruption by the building of this new rail line. 
A couple of years ago my relative could board his Eurostar train at our local station Ashford Intl, serving Kent was the reason for these prestigious new stations being built after all. Instead he now has to take a local train from Ashford up to St Pancras London (and pay extra) before coming all the way back down on the Eurostar passing both Ebbsfleet & Ashford stations without stopping. Utterly ridiculous and disgraceful!! We'll take the ferry next time!

items.title: Service has become terrible.
items.review_text: Today is the 5th trip I’m taking on the Eurostar this year. The service used to be reasonable, but is now awful. They never have enough staff to get people through the queues, and today we have been delayed for hours waiting in the passport queue because the waiting area was completely full. This has happened repeatedly this year, even the business lounge has been standing room only on several occasions including today. We paid for access to the lounge and were denied access because it was too full. On previous occasions there have been no coffee cups available so no coffee. I travel by train because I want to be more eco-friendly, but Eurostar does a terrible job. Less Euro Star than Euro Trash.

items.title: Mais où va l'argent des billets?
items.review_text:
Mais où va l'argent des billets?
Pour 150 Euros l'aller retour, on a droit à:
- des salles d'attente (à Londre et à Paris) 10 fois trop petites et inconfortables. 50% des gens si ce n'est plus sont assis par terre (et ça depuis des années)
- des trains avec le wifi des années 90. On est content quand on arrive péniblement à charger une page web. Travailler dans l'Eurostar est littéralement impossible, très malin quand sa clientèle est essentiellement constituée de professionnels en déplacement pro.
Vivement la fin du monopole.

items.title: Can't contact any customer service…
items.review_text: Can't contact any customer service personnel, blocking me online from changing my tickets and not able to do it on app. This is some kind of illegal scam and shouldn't be allowed.

items.title: Would give no stars if possible
items.review_text: Would give no stars if possible. Booked in August for October travel where the website stated there was upgrade availability with points we had saved if we contacted them. No reply to emails, no phone contact possible until 3 days before travel where they said no upgrades were now available.  So they’ve basically avoided allowing us to use points saved for precisely this sort of trip. Thanks. As someone else pointed out, when operating a monopoly, accountability should be far greater.

items.title: QQQQQQQQQQQQQQQQQQQQQQQQQQQQQQQQQQQQQQQQ…
items.review_text: QQQQQQQQQQQQQQQQQQQQQQQQQQQQQQQQQQQQQQQQQQ

items.title: Belabberd
items.review_text: Bijzonder slechte service. Nul efficiëntie en eindeloze wachtrijen ondanks je hun geadviseerde timing volgt. Dit jaar ben ik regelmatig moeten reizen met hen en werkelijk iedere keer is er vertraging, annulatie last minute van de trein, eindeloze wachtrijen met complete chaos en duidelijk personeelstekort. Eurostar is een firma die het allemaal heel groots ziet maar in werkelijkheid deze aantallen reizigers niet aankan. Bovendien best duur voor een ticket. Ook omboeken van een ticket (wegens annulatie door hen) kost je €40. Geen reactie gekregen op mijn klachtenmail hierover.

items.title: Belachelijk, geen contact mogelijk!
items.review_text: Belachelijk, ik heb in de afgelopen maanden al 5 x een bericht gestuurd en geen enkele respons. Er is geen mogelijkheid om een mail te sturen of te bellen. Ik heb een flex ticket dat ik kan wijzigen. Echter is er ergens op de achtergrond iets fout, waardoor dit niet meer kan voor mij. Nu kan ik dus enkel nog komend weekend gaan (terwijl ik dan niet kan), ik wil wijzigen en een persoon bijboeken (dus er valt voor hun ook nog geld te verdienen), maar dat is dus absoluut onmogelijk. Ik weet het niet meer. Klachtwaardig dat er geen klantcontact mogelijk is of reactie komt! Voortaan via de NS.

items.title: klimaat crises
items.review_text: Ruim 3x duurder dan vliegen en dat in een tijd van klimaat crises. Schandalig!!

items.title: We reply within 28 days!
items.review_text: Who in the world of service sends an email saying:....we will always aim to respond to your e-mail within 28 days...!!!

items.title: Sicherungskontrolle ein Witz
items.review_text:
Zwei Stunden vorher muss man mindestens da sein, wegen Sicherheitskontrollen, die ein Witz sind. Für meinen Campingkocher hatte ich Messer, Flüssiggas, Brennspiritus, ein Feuerzeug etc mit. Also wenn ich all diese Dinge problemlos mitnehmen darf,. wofür dann der Stress mit dem überfüllten Sicherheitsbereich?
Im Wartebereich stapeln sich dann die Leute sodass eine Evakuation niemals möglich wäre. Klimanlage ist auch ein Fremdwort.
Der Zug insgesamt ist etwas in die Jahre gekommen. Mein Sitz war sehr fleckig. Vielleicht sollten die Bezüge Mal erneuert werden.

items.title: I have been left out of pocket due to…
items.review_text: I have been left out of pocket due to Eurostar non-existent customer service when trains are cancelled and their refusal to take responsibility for it. This company needs to be made accountable and reported to the rail ombudsman.

items.title: Get a VPN
items.review_text:
Get a VPN, connect to France or Belgium or Netherlands. Clear your browser history and caches, or use incognito/private viewing. Then check the price of a return ticket for someone living in those countries. 

It's half what it costs people in the UK. 

British people are subsidising the Eurostar for EU citizens.

items.title: Money grabbing monopoly
items.review_text: Arrived for my train 25 minutes before departure and gate was closed. Waited in a queue for 20 minutes to change my ticket to the next train. I went through security in less than 5 minutes and was through on time to hear my original train being called. Closing gates before departure is just money grabbing. There’s no good reason to do it. I wanted to take the train because it’s more environmentally friendly and less hassle than flying but what is the point if companies like Eurostar are looking for any opportunity to shake you down? Really makes travelling a misery.

items.title: Face forward!
items.review_text: We booked this journey on January for September. It was a birthday present. When I booked, I selected a face forward seats. With my surprise when we boarded, the seat was not face forward. I send an email to complain and I did received an unsatisfactory reply where the customer service stated that face forward wasn’t guarantee as for their term and conditions. Why are you asking then? Also will not a first time serve basis prevail? Absolutely gutted

items.title: If you have a problem no way to contact…
items.review_text: If you have a problem no way to contact them. Not even a phone and they don’t answer email. They have even closed the ticket office!!!!

items.title: When they cancel a service dont expect…
items.review_text:
When they cancel a service dont expect a refund. Been waiting 10 months. 
Frankly there is nowhere they go it isnt easier to fly to since they reduced their service. Avoid.

items.title: A contender for the worst customer service ever - EUROSTAR
items.review_text:
I received a disappointing email on 22nd Sept 2022 telling me my Eurostar stop to Amsterdam has been cancelled - the 08.15 St Pancras service on Nov 25th due to engineering works. The App shows clearly that my train is cancelled.
I have not received any answers yet to my questions raised on the contact form and, as it is essential that my party of 4 travel that day, have now booked to fly instead. I felt I had no choice.
Today is exactly 2 months to my due travel date but the refund form which I am directed to complete says my train is not cancelled.
Some digging of my own indicates the train is terminating at Brussels but is effectively cancelled for my destination of Amsterdam.
All I wanted to do was speak to someone. The call centre (which was not free anyway) now no longer accepts calls. It tells you this in 3 languages. Use the form it says! The form to which nobody responds.
EUROSTAR all I want is a swift refund of my money for a service you can no longer provide.
Anyone else tried the chatbot? Never have I met anything so completely and utterly useless.
Get your act together Eurostar.

items.title: Zeer slechte customer service!
items.review_text: Zeer slechte customer service! Niet per telefoon te bereiken. Mail over vervallen reis is onduidelijk. Geld teruggave lukt me niet. Baal ervan dat ik rechtstreeks bij Eurostar geboekt heb. Kun je beter via NS internationaal doen.

items.title: No way of contacting the company as…
items.review_text: No way of contacting the company as call centre is not taking calls, booking reference isn’t recognised to amend booking. Just happy to take money.

items.title: Poor quality hotel
items.review_text: Journey to and from excellent. Hotel (TimHotel Gard du Nord) booked as part of Eurostar package very poor. Filthy carpets, room poorly fitted, in need to decoration and en-suite had black mould all over the grout.

items.title: No customer service whatsoever
items.review_text:
Travelled to Amsterdam on Eurostar. Because of industrial action, no  trains were running anywhere in the Netherlands. It was absolutely impossible to reach anyone at Eurostar for some advice, which was pretty bad. So I had to book a hotel for the night.

I was able to travel on a train the next day and got home.

Now, I need a confirmation for this cancellation from them for my insurance - which really should not be a problem. However, it is still impossible to reach anyone at this company. Just no reply, no feedback, no sign of life from them.

I don't think, I'll ever travel with these people again.

items.title: Their website literally doesn’t work
items.review_text: Their website literally doesn’t work. Four years ago I tried to book a ticket and it just doesn’t accept card payments. So I literally had to go to St Pancras and buy a ticket right before the train left. Now I want to go to Paris tomorrow and they STILL have not fixed their website. It is still incapable of accepting card payments. If you call customer service, they just tell you there’s something wrong with your card (and are not particularly polite about it). Right-all 5 of my cards that I’ve been using throughout the day without any problem are the issue. Really, really shocking customer service. Also the food and wine in Business class is pretty bad.

items.title: Cancelled service and refused to…
items.review_text:
Cancelled service and refused to provide a refund, instead issued a time-limited voucher which effectively constitutes a theft. Ignored all attempts to claim the fare back, a completely dishonest behaviour.
Recommended arrival for St Pancras is 90 mins before departure so no different from an airport, really beats the purpose of using a train service. Hope I'll never have to use their services in the future, lest I risk being robbed by this establishment again.

items.title: EUROSTAR NOOIT MEER!
items.review_text:
EUROSTAR NOOIT MEER!! 
Samen met mijn vriendin ben ik naar Londen geweest met de Eurostar trein vanaf Amsterdam. De heenweg verliep soepeltjes en alles was prima. Tot zover… 
Op vrijdag zouden we eind van de middag met de Eurostar teruggaan vanaf Londen naar Amsterdam. Daar hadden we ook de tickets voor bij ons. Echter op de Woensdag ervoor kregen wij een mail van Eurostar met de mededeling dat onze trein niet zou rijden ivm de stakingen van de NS in Nederland. We kregen een aantal opties. 1) omboeken naar een ander tijdstip 2) e-voucher aanvragen voor een later tijdstip. 
We probeerde een ander tijdstip in de dagen erna. Alle treinen waren al volgeboekt. Dus.. dan ga je verder denken… we moeten toch naar huis. Dan maar met het vliegtuig. 
Nu zijn we alweer een week thuis en proberen de gemaakte extra kosten terug te vorderen. Maar dat gaat niet zo gemakkelijk. 
De reisverzekering zegt: Wij kunnen niks voor u doen op dit gebied, u koet het bij Eurostar zelf proberen te claimen. Eurostar zelf heeft een klantenservice van lik me vestje en zijn niet te bereiken. 
Toen via de rechtsbijstand geprobeert. Ook die komen met een antwoord wat je niet verwacht. 
U heeft rechtsbijstand voor zaken die betrekking hebben op alles binnen de EU. Eurostar is een Engels bedrijf en ze kunnen dus geen zaak aanspannen tegen hun. In feite ben je gewoon je centen kwijt a €428. Er is nog 1 optie en dat is naar de kantonrechter stappen. 
Mensen! Denk goed na voor je met de Eurostar naar Londen gaat want als ze je trein annuleren ga je geheit voor de bijl! Wees gewaarschuwt!! Volgende keer weer lekker vliegen

items.title: Poor service, poor follow up and poor everything really
items.review_text:
I don't even want to give this company 1 star as they are so poor in their customer servce - I would go so far as to say that their customer service is almost non-existent.  
You cannot get hold of them post travel to claim any form of compensation, they do not respond in a timely manner via their website when trying to contacting them and then they have a cheek to only offer compensation for their fault in the form of an e-voucher which is only valid for 12 months.
The station at St. Pancras is a nightmare to travel out from and the staff on the information desk inside the terminal are at best rude.
I would not choose to travel by Eurostar again unless it was the last resort so being offered an E-Voucher is all but pointless.

items.title: St. Pancras is unsafe
items.review_text:
Arrived at check in with the 90 mins advised timescale. Huge queues, 30 minutes to get through security etc. Once into the laughingly named departure lounge, we were met by chaos, no seats, people sitting on floors booking walkways, no aircon.

What needs looking at by whoever gave this place a safety licence, is that it is obviously unfit for purpose and unsafe. There were no green fire exit signs in the whole place we could see. If there had been an emergency there would have been very serious problems.

When they called our train, they chose a platform with only one working walkway, causing an even bigger crush. Somebody hit the emergency stop, and everybody went flying.

I urge the London Fire Brigade to close this potentially very dangerous building down, until Eurostar make it safe.

items.title: Absolutely speechless
items.review_text:
No customer services no matter how frequent you travel, do not expect any answer to any type of contact (emails, phone or texts) within 28 days (no joke!!) 
This company should be rocked out by competitors

items.title: Absolutely awful experience, never again
items.review_text: I booked a ticket from London to Lille. Return journey was cancelled due to industrial strike. I had to immediately cancel all hotel bookings and travel plans. Was offered to apply for a voucher/refund via an email form. Was then notified 2 days later the train was reinstated. No way to reach customer service by phone, trekked all the way to St. Pancras service desk only to be told to send in an email. Sent several contact request forms on their website with no reply. Thought I was being clever by avoiding the stressful flights but I was so wrong...

items.title: Terrible. From bad to worse
items.review_text: Terrible. Service dreadful. Customs completely understaffed. Passport useless. 1 French customs officers whilst the rest are likely sipping coffee and eating croissants. Machines permanently broken down. Hell on earth

items.title: Appalling Customer  Service - avoid
items.review_text:
Train booking was modified, no invoice sent, no way to see booking anymore on website. Very expensive train and no way to get an invoice for expenses.
Customer service - no such thing at Eurostar as a form that disappears and gets ignored and no phone gets answered

items.title: poor refund policy
items.review_text: Journey cancelled due to industrial action, I requested a cash refund and was instead given an e voucher. Why was I given the option of a cash refund if you're going to give a voucher? Honestly Eurostar I genuinely think without Disney this company would've gone under.

items.title: Ondanks diverse mailtjes en 1 reactie…
items.review_text:
Ondanks diverse mailtjes en 1 reactie op een review nog steeds niets vernomen. 82% geeft eurostar een zeer slechte beoordeling.
Ik houd mijn hart vast als mijn reis aanvangt.

items.title: Absolutely appallingly customer service
items.review_text: If I could have put a nil star rating I would have. Customer service is absolutely appallingly. We booked Standard Premier but due to a train change and over 2 hour delay we had no food and no standard premier seats. They did not provide the service we paid for and attempts to obtain a refund or compensation is currently to no avail. It has been nearly a month since I made contact with their customer service team by form filling on their website as to get won't take calls and I have heard nothing.

items.title: Shambles
items.review_text: Eurostar refunded our booking out of nowhere with no reasons as to why, meaning the prices of our original booking increased significantly. There are no ways to contact Eurostar as they don't have a telephone service, meaning each day waiting for an email response means the prices further increase.

items.title: Never again. What a disappointment
items.review_text: Dirty train, cramped seats in economy and  a ludicrously inefficient and chaotic ‘check in’ process in Paris. AC tiny to none existent- despite hot muggy weather. Never again.

items.title: Don’t expect to sit in the seats you book, even if you travel Business Premier!
items.review_text:
A unilateral change to our booked seats left us sitting opposite a complete stranger for our journey and marred the end of our holiday. Unhelpful Train Manager who showed no empathy. 

Really poor behaviour by Eurostar.

items.title: Even business is awful.... !
items.review_text:
The queues for check-in are way too long- there are simply not enough customs officers to deal with the amount of people. 
Also, being a carte blanche traveller, we were told in the lounge it was last call for a train leaving Brussels (and rushed out by the staff) only to board the train and be informed there was a 25 minute delay. The staff in the business lounge should know there is a delay in advance and encourage the passengers to wait until they have to board. Instead, they really do hurry you out of the lounge... regardless of the fact the next train does not leave for 4 HOURS.... why are we rushed? Especially when paying a premium. It's all a bit of a joke.

items.title: Appalling "service"
items.review_text:
I had the same appalling booking experience as others here: selected trains + hotel on website, entered payment details, got an error message after clicking the final 'Confirm' button. The "Customer Service" phone line responded with a "we're too busy to talk to anyone, you must email us" recorded message. So I emailed and then waited 3 days for a pathetic reply from a cowardly 'no-reply' email address.
This service used to be a superb way of travelling between London and Paris/Lille/Brussels. Now it is a sad, over-priced shoddy operation.

items.title: An Excellent Trip
items.review_text:
Had an excellent trip with Eurostar. 

We booked a train and hotel package in Paris and were really impressed by the quality of hotel and the journey to and from London/Paris.

A great first trip overseas with our daughter.

items.title: Inflexible, inhuman and unprofession
items.review_text: I had a reservation for the 14h56 from Brussels to London. Due to a delay in our connection from Genk (BE) we arrived at 14h27 at the gate; one minute after it formally closed. We explained to a Dutch speaking female employee around 30 years old why we were one minute too late and politely asked her if we might still board, since we had an urgent meeting in London. We got absolutely zero compassion from your employee nor her manager (named Gunther). They were like a computer, repeatedly naming their policy, stating they could make no exceptions because then "they had to let everyone through who was late". Weird, since we were the only people queueing at that point. I was surprised and to be honest quite upset by her total lack of humanity and flexibility, so my responses became angrier. Your employee reacted to this from her own emotions and made several angry and hurtful comments. The only option she had to offer was to book the same train two hours later, which would cause us a lot of stress and trouble considering our schedule. On top of that, she actually blamed us for taking the seats of two other passengers who had been waiting for two days now. That one really hurt. So unprofessional. When I asked for her name, she refused to give it, saying whe was only doing her job. At that point, my girlfriend interrupted because I was getting angry. We left with the alternative tickets. Not a nice way to start what's supposed to be a relaxing holiday. I request a appropriate explanation and compensation for our discomfort as paying customers.

items.title: have been trying to book a ticket since…
items.review_text: have been trying to book a ticket since monday, have tried different rates, booking single journeys etc but every time the website fails when you try to confirm the booking.  you cannot speak to anyone, they suggest that you email and then send you an email to say they will get back to you within 28 days.  That's not much use.  No phone numbers on the website so you can not call anyone.....Never come across such an arrogant approach to sales.  if only you didn't have to use them!

items.title: Had a great experience with Eurostar
items.review_text:
Had a great experience with Eurostar, traveling to Disneyland Paris. I had assistance because I was in my motorized scooter and the uk staff were great on the day we left. The toilets were clean and staff very courteous. It wasn’t too great coming back though as the staff weren’t as attentive and I was left waiting on the platform for at least 30 minutes before they arrived with the ramp. After disembarking back at St Pancreas and got off the train I again had to wait for someone to take me to a lift and he was going to refuse to let my family (husband and sons) come with me but I insisted. 
Apart from that everything else was great and I wouldn’t hesitate to use it again.

items.title: Absolutely appalling service
items.review_text:
Absolutely appalling service. Our train was delayed more than an hour. On top of that, we had paid for standard premier seats and were only told after all the food places had shut for the night that there would be no catering service. (so basically lied to us)

Complained and have waited over THREE months for a response back from their customer service and received absolutely nothing.

items.title: VERY UNHELPFUL STAFFS AT ST PANCREAS…
items.review_text: VERY UNHELPFUL STAFFS AT ST PANCREAS EUROSTAR DEPARTURE TO PARIS. THEY JUST IGNORE ANY CALL FOR HELP, HAD TO RELY ON OTHER PASSENGER TO HELP CARRY MY HEAVY LUGAGGE TO THE SCANNER TABLE NO STAFF HELPING ALL OF THEM WILL IGNORE PRETENDING THEY ARE NOT LISTENING CALLING FOR HELP  THEY ARE THE WORST KIND OF PEOPLE I HAVE COME ACCROSS DESPITE THERE ARE MANY STAFFS WALKING AROUND, THEY WILL JUST IGNORE THE PASSENGERS.

items.title: No confirmation but you’ll still take my money?
items.review_text:
My daughter was planning 2 different holidays for September with friends. The train and hotel package for for Amsterdam was booked first. No complaints about that booking everything went smoothly. We will how the trip works out. 

However when it came to booking trains and hotel for Paris that is when the issues started. After completing the card security checks we were not taken to a confirmation page, nor did she receive a confirmation email, nor is it showing up in her account. Instead the page we were taken to just had Checkout in big letters and some T&C’s stuff at the bottom. There was nothing to click and we tried clicking everything. When refreshing the page as there was no refresh waning on this page we were taken back to the start of payment. When I checked my credit card statement there was a pending transaction for the amount of the trip. 

The next morning my daughter attempted to reach out to customer service, their phone lines are closed to “deal increased volumes of calls” (which to me sounds like BS, seriously c’mon people.)

Instead we followed their instructions and filled out the email contact form. Almost immediately she received an automated email confirming her enquiry had been logged and that they aim to get back with in 28 days. (Again people this is not good enough. What if your travelling tomorrow? As it is 28 days is after the holiday is planned for). 

As a response had not been received yesterday a second attempt at booking was made to avoid further increases in cost and for seats/hotel getting sold out with the same result. 

As of this morning the original bookings pending transaction has been refunded and the second bookings transaction is currently pending. She is currently attempting to contact the customer service team via a DM to @eurostar and @eurostaruk on twitter. She is still waiting for a response.

items.title: Impossible d'échanger mes billets
items.review_text: Impossible d'échanger mes billets, un bug visiblement... Mais si ce n'était que ça ! Aucune réponse du service après-vente après un mois, impossible de les joindre au téléphone. Reste plus qu'à essayer les réseaux sociaux. Scandaleux ! ça vous enlève l'envie d'aller à Londres...

items.title: 30 August 2022
items.review_text:
30 August 2022

Dear Sir/Madam



I would like to bring to your attention a case of exemplary customer service!

during a visit to Paris on 18/08/22,  I was travelling back from Paris Gare du Nord to London St Pancras International I left my rucksack behind me while i was in business lounge waiting for my train 9043 at 16:13 and release Letterly after the train has left the station, I was panicking as it contained all my medicine and my money and other important stuff.
The first thing  I have done it is I approached one of on board service staff which i explained to her what happened to me  she was very  polite ;  she reassured me that i don't need to be worry  everything should be alright;  she contacted the train manager after a while he came all the way to my seat e introduced himself as Frederik train manager he asked me to give him the description of my rucksack and the location he quickly act and contacted Gare du Nord Eurostar  terminal to chase it, he later on he came back to me and informed that they find it and he informed me that  I will be reunited with my bag tomorrow. I left my details and my contact number to him .
I believe Mr Frederik has arranged something in a professional way and manner with his colleague Mr Blake.
The next day received a phone call from Blake, he introduced himself and briefly told me about how I can collect my rucksack from St Pancras station.after he gave the trai trai ID 9007 and arrival time.  I was delighted and happy when Mr Blake hand in my rucksack to me by asking to check if everything is in there which I did ..I looked at him i was speechless and same time happy for two reasons, first the action from both train manager showed the team work and second restoring my trust on such big company as Eurostar.
I felt that both train manager Frederik's and Blake actions showed exceptional customer service and as such deserve due recognition. In this day and age people are quick to complain but seldom take the time to show praise and both them deserve a pat on the back for their excellent level of service .

Please extend my thanks to them once again

Kind regards

items.title: This is a terrible Company - do not use it
items.review_text: This is a terrible Company.  My wife and a colleague were booked on a train to Rotterdam today Monday 29th Aug 2022.  Dutch rail went on strike Monday so Eurostar say they emailed everyone on Friday - no email.  By the time we found out it was Saturday night.  Customer services had switched off their phones, the website was useless, and their advice was to fill in an email form - which being a Mon to Fri business - meant there was no response until today!  I have never come across such an uncaring organisation in my life - DO NOT GO EUROSTAR it is not worth it.

items.title: Last minute cancellation of train with…
items.review_text: Last minute cancellation of train with no warning. Offering no support to us now stranded. No offer of compensation for expenses incurred and online refund system not working. Can’t get hold of anyone via any channel - Eurostar are a shambles

items.title: Their call centre is actually just…
items.review_text: Their call centre is actually just closed so you have no option to speak to anyone.. ever. Which is outrageous. They cancelled my train and will not respond to me about a refund so my £350 is just in question. I’m so sick to death of companies just getting away with this stuff!!

items.title: Poor Customer Information and Engagement from Eurostar
items.review_text:
Travelled from London to Paris Gare du Nord in the hot weather on 18th July 22. The train was delayed by 3 hours by signal failure in France, so we were told.  However, later trains than ours went before us. They didn't transfer delayed customers onto the next available train. Very poor customer lounge crowded with delayed travellers. Nothing was offered, not even water despite the heat. No information given to customers about the likely length of delay.  There were many angry customers. Eventually the train was replaced for reasons that were never explained.  The equipment on the replacement train was not working so food and drink facilities were limited.  Overall a very poor experience.  Understand the rail system was stressed on that day but Eurostar utterly failed to manage that situation.
 It's two stars rather than one because they did offer compensation and they did pay it. However, it took them a month to get around to paying and there was no acknowledgement of the compensation claim. No customer enquiry telephone line, only a contact form on the website.  When we submitted a query we got no answer.  The only way to see if your compensation claim is in the system is to try and submit it again.
Considering how expensive it was relative to say, Easyjet, (about twice the price); Eurostar is poor value for money and badly managed.  We won't be using them again.

items.title: Don't Do It...
items.review_text: What a shambles Eurostar has become. Massive queues, so 2 hours check-in; departure pen, like a refugee camp, with insufficient seats. Seats on the train misaligned with the windows...so luck-of-the-draw whether you can see anything at all. Nowhere to sit in the "buffet" car. 50 euros extra pp, if you get through the queues in time, and there's space on the earlier train. Once was enough for me...a great engineering triumph, ruined by incompetent management, contemptuous of its customers.

items.title: i was charged but there was no…
items.review_text: i was charged but there was no confirmation page or email and no booking reference. No response from customer service. Will fly in future

items.title: Bad Throughout
items.review_text:
I am a frequent traveller on Eurostar. It used to be really good, but now I experience problems with about 1 train in 2. My last trip back from Paris was a bad one. Train was shown as on time.  Huge queue for immigration, as usual, but went through OK. Train still shown as on time, but the departure time came and went with no announcement.  A large crowd gathered around the boarding area in the heat. But still no boarding and still no announcement. Then finally they announce  a "small" delay and boarding in a few minutes, which turned about to be twenty minutes. Then a mad scramble to get on the train, since everyone's seat had been cancelled and it was now free seating.  The situation was very badly handled and the absence of information caused physical distress to older passengers who  stood waiting  in the heat for forty minutes to try to board first and get seats near their families. 
Train finally arrived over an hour late in London. A few days later I got a message inviting me to apply for compensation  but the Eurostar system won't recognise the ticket number they gave me in the very same email inviting me to ask for compensation. Their call centre is unreachable and they don't respond to requests for help from their online forms.  All in all, it is a company that needs new management and a sense of customers service.

items.title: Very poor
items.review_text:
Very poor. Paid for the above std class and the food was ok. Seating changed without warning and my family of 4 were split up across the carriage. 
The French blamed the delay on the English Channel , said they arrived on time 20 minutes late , I had boatloads of emails for no reason , I’ve sent off 2 emails to no avail. I’d rather cycle to Paris than be subjected to the misery next time.

items.title: Mauvais nom rempli automatiquement sur billet
items.review_text: Ayant pris 2 billets paris londres pour 2 personnes ( 2 noms differents)de mon compte eurostar je me retrouve avec 2 billets au meme nom. Impossible de changer le nom. Impossible de les joindre par tel depuis 1 semaine. Aucune reponse du service client apres envoi de mail et message twitter....

items.title: Très bien pour aller à Londres…
items.review_text:
Très bien pour aller à Londres rapidement,par contre 1h de retard à l'aller et le contrôle de sécurité était long au retour, heureusement que le conducteur nous a tous attendu car tout le monde était en retard !
Par contre le wifi a bord est Médiocre

items.title: Eurostar holidays limited - nooooo!
items.review_text:
I wish I had followed my normal procedure and check here before I made the error or booking and then when it went wrong coming to check.

This relates to Eurostar holidays ltd where I though I booked a weekend train and hotel online but the final page gave no reference and just jumped back to asking me to pay again.

There was no email confirmation either so it left me wondering.
Finally I checked my credit card used to make the booking and indeed there was a pending transaction seen .

After a day with no contacted with the company , I contacted the credit card but they were unable to take action until the company claim the money.

I did immediately following the booking called the listed number and with the recording saying THE ONLY WAY TO CONTACT US is by completing their online form.

So I attempted that and found I need a couple of references if the form was to be completed correctly, references that I did not get , in the end I managed to send a general message using the form without the references.

Moments later I received a confirmation email that my query was received and they aim to respond within 28 days.

Who is that good to if you are travelling within 7 or 14 or even 27 days.

Really folk this is a summary of all the actions I took. Even though it may seem long.

3 days after I made the booking that was not. Logged into my credit card and found 2 transactions plus and minus.

Contacted the credit card and they confirm the payment had been returned.

I did not speak with them 
The credit card company did not speak with them 
Begs the question, what the **** happened.

I proceeded to book the hotel and train separately myself. 
Cost a sum more but it’s a better hotel and I feel better because I have the train tickets and the hotel confirmation.

In summary
A company that cannot be contacted j would suggest customers should think carefully and perhaps do the wise thing and stay clear

items.title: 1.5? Dat is wel HEEL laag.
items.review_text:
Poeh, wat een negatieve score krijgt Eurostar!

Waarschijnlijk gaat deze review kris kras door elkaar, but bare with me!


Ik ben vertrokken in Juni van Amsterdam naar London. Het eerste wat mij opviel (wat niet te verwijten is aan eurostar?) hoe extreem asociaal de Marechaussee was! Zij drukte letterlijk oude mensen aan de kant om ''eerst'' naar binnen te gaan. Ik stond er echt even van te kijken. De check in ging echt suuuuper snel! Dit terwijl het wel super druk was. Het is echt lopende bandwerk, en to be honest, mijn voorkeur gaat uit naar vluchtigheid, proces en soepel verlopen. Dus ik verwacht en eis niet een ''lach'' of een ''goed woordje'' van elke euro star medewerker. In de wachthal, wat ontzettend ruim was, is het inderdaad wel karrig. Een snoep machine en banken + stoelen. Helaas waren er flink wat arrogante britten die lang uit gingen liggen op de banken waardoor mensen staand moesten wachten, wederom niet de schuld van Eurostar MAAR : ik miste hier een medewerker, iemand die een rondje liep die vragen kon beantwoorden en dus dit soort zaken kon oppakken. Je moet inderdaad wel even wachten voordat de trein aankomt, het is minder comfortabel dan Schiphol waar je honderden meters kunt lopen en ontzettend veel winkeltjes hebt. Maar goed, dit weet je van te voren.

De trein was prima, ontzettend schoon? Nee, dat niet. Ik zat bij een raam met het geluk dat ik bij omboeking een eerste klas kaartje had. Dus een stoeltje alleen :D . Het raampje had nog een vette kuif afdruk van de persoon die voor mij op de plek heeft gezeten. Ik heb de heen weg geen vertraging op gelopen, de trein voelde soepel en ging lekker snel. Ik kreeg ook nog eten! Tjah, het is en blijft ''vervoervoer''. Ik verwachte niet een vers bakkersbroodje uit Parijs met zalm uit de noorse rivieren en zeewier van Korea. Het is maar wat je verwacht en hoe je bent ingesteld. Ik vond het prima! En ik zat er vol van, dat is voor mij het belangrijkste.

England was super, lekker veel Harry Potter dingen gedaan :P

Nu de terug weg.... Dit ging (veel) minder vlot.

De wachtruimte bij Kings Cross was nog minder comfortabel dan die in Amsterdam. En je raad het al , 1 uur vertraging terwijl ik mijn boekje zat te lezen op een houten stoel. Maar toch, viel mij op dat de medewerkers daar ontzettend aardig waren! In de trein was ging alles weer vlot. Wederom had ik een gelukje, ik had namelijk een normal seat, en zat naast een vent die later gewoon een eigen plekje kon gaan zoeken. Tijden het rijden kregen we nog eens 30 minuten vertraging. Mensen... het zijn spoorwegen, vertraging gebeurd nou eenmaal. Daar kun je boos op worden (zoals ik in veel reviews lees) maar het lijkt me sterk dat Eurostart dit met opzet doet. Onmacht heet zoiets.

Al met al was mijn ervaring met Eurostar dus eigenlijk echt wel goed! En let er op , veel reviews die ik heb gelezen, heeft te maken met Covid. Gecancelde treinen waarbij mensen een (niet)werkende voucher hebben gekregen, dat lijkt mij ook superkut. Ook lees ik veel over vertraging en mensen die niet meer mee mochten omdat ze zelf niet goed hebben gelezen op de ticket > 45min voor vertrek aanwezig zijn. Waar ik wel van schrik is de service die mensen ervaren als ze bellen... daar heb ik zelf geen ervaring mee. Ook was ik nog super bang, want ik heb gereisd een dag na de grootste UK Train strike. Dus ik zag de bui al aankomen... maar nee hoor, alles ging dus goed!

Zou ik het adviseren? Nou dat ligt er aan. Vind je treinen super interessant? Of ga je met zn 4en en je wilt lekker een wijntje drinken met wat nootjes? Dan zal ik Eurostar adviseren. Maar als een single trip, ga ik liever (achteraf) met het vliegtuig. Vergeet niet, als je met de trein naar London gaat dan ben je totaal 4.5 uur onderweg. Met de vliegtuig is het ook ongeveer 4.5. Maar van de 4.5 zit je bij de trein... IN DE TREIN, dus 4.5 uur op dezelfde plek, zelfde stoel met ''genoeg'' beenruimte. Terwijl je met het vliegtuigje hooguit een 1.5 uur in het vliegtuig zit en de overige uren lekker kunt shoppen en wandelen op schiphol. Voor mij was het prijs technisch ook niet perse goedkoper dan vliegen...

Dus, puntje bij paaltje : Naar mijn mening verdient Eurostar zeker geen 1.5 ster. Ik geef ze 3 sterren. De 2 sterren die er af gaan zijn door de lack van personeel in de wachtruimtes, de toch-niet-zo-schone stoelen/ramen in de trein/ en de karrige 20.50,- vergoeding die ik heb gekregen voor 1.5 uur vertraging. Dit terwijl mijn kaartjes bij elkaar opgeteld meer dan 300,- was. 

Als je met Eurostar reist : Succes! Hoop dat je een goede reis hebt :)

items.title: A call centre that is fictional as no…
items.review_text:
A call centre that is fictional as no one ever answers the phone.
A chatbot that is completly useless.
An email address that must go into someones junk mail box at Eurostar as they never answer.

items.title: Fantastische ervaring
items.review_text: Fantastische ervaring! Afgezien van een beetje vertraging (15min) op de terugweg, was het een hele fijne ervaring om van Amsterdam naar London & terug te gaan. Snelle service, vriendelijk personeel, en een prima café in de trein! Toiletten waren schoon en genoeg ruimte voor koffers etc. Stoelen waren prima comfortabel.

items.title: Das reinste Chaos
items.review_text:
Eigentlich Null Sterne da:
- beim Checkin wird keine Rücksicht auf Personen mit Handycap genommen. 1 Std. Schlange stehen geht für Gehbehinderte gar nicht.
- das Boarding verwechselt Eurostar mit einem Boarding eines Flugzeugs mit nur zwei Zugängen. Die Eurostar Züge haben aber mehr als 10 einzelne Zugänge!
- Am Sonntag 14.8.2022 15:13 ab Paris wurden teilweise die Sitze doppelt verkauft! Betrug? Das reinste Chaos! Da muss dringend in der Management Ebene aufgeräumt werden.

items.title: Dacht ik mooi het luchthaven gedoe te…
items.review_text:
Dacht ik mooi het luchthaven gedoe te omzeilen en mijzelf te verwennen met een business premium ticket van Londen naar Amsterdam......
Ik ben een flexibel en tolerant mensch.....maar mensen..... NIET NIET doen.....geloof mij....

items.title: Is Eurostar dan oplichting? In ieder geval teleurstellend.
items.review_text: Door een staking kan vertrekken niet op de gewenste dag. Omboeken werkt meermaals niet. Zowel via de app als de website lijkt alles goed te gaan, tot het afrondscherm met een optimistisch 'Bijna klaar'. Echter duren de 'enkele ogenblikken' van die 'Bijna' in werkelijkheid enkele uren, zonder resultaat. Uit wanhoop dan toch maar een vliegticket voor de heenreis geboekt. Nu maar hopen dat we wèl van de terugreis gebruik kunnen maken, zonder de heenreis te hebben verzilvert. Wat een teleurstelling dat Eurostar!

items.title: 19 juli is onze reis gedeeltelijk…
items.review_text:
19 juli is onze reis gedeeltelijk geannuleerd.  Konden maar tot Brussel en hadden een vertraging van een uur.
Konden vergoeding aanvragen voor de vertraging en geld terug krijgen voor geannuleerde reis. Inmiddels 3 berichten gestuurd want als je het formulier in wilt vullen krijg je als antwoord dat je reis niet is geannuleerd terwijl in de app staat dat je reis wel is geannuleerd. 
Nu hopen dat ik mijn geld ooit nog terug krijg.

items.title: Unaccountable, Unavailable, and Disappeared Customer Service
items.review_text:
Who is Eurostar's Regulator? How does one report Eurostar to them? 

It is incomprehensible how an international train company can cancel trains, and then fail to offer any customer support. Their telephone lines have a flat message that they're not taking calls. Their website offers the option to get an alternative booking for free, but their booking system fails to work. 

I have sent several emails to them, and their response time is 28 days, whilst my cancelled train is in the next 8 days. 

I mean, are Eurostar saying that they are not accountable, and they can do as they please?

items.title: Une vraie bande d'incompetents!!
items.review_text:
Une vraie bande d'incompetents!!! Une heure de retard sur un trajet aller Paris-Londres, sous pretexte d'un problème de nettoyage du train, résultat meme avec une heure de retard le train était dans un état pitoyable!!!
Et le trajet retour même blague, une heure de retard histoire de vous planter votre correspondance!!!

items.title: Outstanding limited mobility support
items.review_text: The trains ran on time and were comfortable and quick. The special assistance support for my limited mobility father (wheelchairs were provided at Brussels and St Pancras) was exceptional.
