We were met straight off the train by helpful, engaging and positive staff without delays or excuses. First class service Eurostar.

items.title: The call center has been unavailable…
items.review_text: The call center has been unavailable for ages. There is no way to amend information, or for anyone to provide any support. My confirmation states the actual trip I want to make, but the ticket I received and the website have a different one. I needed to add my 3-year-old son but it cannot be done other than on the phone (did I mention the call center is unavailable?). Overall, an apalling experience.

items.title: Just don't use this company
items.review_text:
If I can give you any piece of advice, just don't take this company. 
If you have any problem, any question, anything, they will never answer your question. They wrote on their website they will come back to you within 3 months.

We definitly need another company to make them change.

items.title: Website and app are useless
items.review_text: Their website and app are not allowing me to make the next booking and they have closed their contact centre for calls. It's almost as if they don't want any future bookings, whilst at the same time they keep on sending me adverts about booking future trips...

items.title: No contact
items.review_text: I am struggling to contact anyone at the Eurostar to change my train booking. The longer it gets left the more expensive it is becoming. I have sent 3 contact forms and 3 emails and no one is replying to either. I am extremely disappointed and this is my last hope.

items.title: Absolutely appalled at the travel…
items.review_text:
Absolutely appalled at the travel insurance wording which are completely misleading!. When purchasing it, it clearly states cancellation and travel insurance. Yet when you ring up the travel insurance provider to cancel the booking you can’t actually cancel and get a refund! The insurance only covers additional cost of any extra costs you may incur to amend the booking. Absolute farce! Now I have to amend the booking, pay the extra and then put in a claim.. 

Also was a nightmare to make the booking!

items.title: Gets you there but don't expect compensation or a reply
items.review_text: Over an hour delayed from London to Amsterdam but it got me there. They said I'd get compensation within 28 days if I applied for it, but it's been over 2 months and still nothing. I've tried to contact support but they don't reply so don't bother.

items.title: Randomly reassign some seats without consideration for seating plan
items.review_text: Terrible service given how they randomly reassigned seats before the journey and split 3 passengers from a single table across the whole carriage.

items.title: The whole process is smooth- but check you can wash your hands in water in toilet before loading with soap
items.review_text: The whole process is smooth. However running water for hands in toilet is slow. So slow when your hands are covered in soup you have to move too next 2 carriages to find one that works. They have a sign saying it takes awhile but I waited for 2 or more minutes. This was both 2 and from both directions it happened. They need to fix this it is a problem

items.title: No refunds No credit No telephone
items.review_text:
No refunds No credit No telephone

They do not offer refunds *ever* not even a freaking credit voucher when you can't use your ticket. 
And they explicitly say "the ONLY way to contact us is by the contact form, and *we* MAY call you if we think we need to"

items.title: Absolutely appalling company.. they need competition!!!
items.review_text: This honestly is the worst company I have ever dealt with. I use this frequently and am constantly having problems with booking and customer services hardly ever answer calls. If they do it takes at least an hour to get through and even then they sometimes cut you off straight away. They also never reply to emails. I really hope that they are either taken over by a company who cares about giving an excellent service or that better still they get some competition as I’m confident people would never use this company again!!!!!!

items.title: Delayed 90 minutes, cold temperature, unresponsive.
items.review_text:
Delayed 90 minutes, the temperature in the train during four hours of the journey was 15 degrees maximum. I asked multiple times for them to turn the air conditioning off but the staff did not react.
The trip made me completely ill - I had a flu-like cold for almost two weeks. I wrote a complaint, but I was ignored.

items.title: How poor can this company be
items.review_text:
How poor can this company be?  Answer - lamentable 

They don't answer emails or phones.  You will be better off swimming the channel.  You should be ashamed all you cynical vile people

items.title: Het is niet duidelijk klantenservice is…
items.review_text: Het is niet duidelijk klantenservice is niet goed bereikbaar. Alles is superslecht geregeld. Site klopt voor geen meter

items.title: VOUCHER No. 079842946
items.review_text: I had a voucher from the Covid lockdowns which I only partly used along with other vouchers to make a booking. The Eurostar system clearly stated the credit would remain on the voucher. On wishing to use the remaining credit, it no longer existed and the voucher had not expired being in June. I have now completed two contact forms but no reply, no acknowledgement or no reference to quote. Amounts are relatively small but may resort to a Court Claim (Small Claims Court) on principle just to stuff Eurostar.

items.title: Terrible customer service. They take your money and run
items.review_text:
Have been trying to get cash compensation for over 2 months now following a 7+ hour delay. 
I requested cash compensation but was issued with an e-voucher that expires in 12 months. Eurostar (Shaun) say this is due to the fact the booking was made through e-voucher. This is true, however we only used an e-voucher as they cancelled our previous booking!

As an aside, the customer service on the day of the delay was also hopeless. We were stuck in Paris station with no water, air con or communication for 7+ hours along with ~3k other passengers. I understand problems on the line can happen, but you are in control of how you treat your customers thereafter, something you chose to overlook.

Give me the cash refund I am entitled to as I will not be travelling with you again.

items.title: The worst customer service ever
items.review_text: The worst customer service ever. I had evouchers for my cancelled trip to London, and they told on their website that they would extend the expiration date. Well, they didn’t, and they never responded to my emails (5 in total). So in the end, I had to book a train ticket without my evouchers (because the person I’m traveling with did get a response and booked her ticket already), so that cost me 260 euro’s plus the 100 euro’s I already spent on the previous tickets. This is really not okay for an international train service

items.title: Health and safety issue.
items.review_text:
Health and safety issue.
Positive.
Train was on time, and staff did the best they could for managing people and trip.
Negative.
I bought sandwich with bread I believe at least a week old. It was not eatible .  The bread was like piece of rubber which me and my wife couldn't bite. It's like monthly bread multiple times refresh in microwave. I believe all food should be inspected. I got refund for sandwich. I paid 6.4 euro for small sandwich. The refund was a coffee worth 4.5 euro based on Eurostar price. Very disappointed.

items.title: Catastrophique
items.review_text:
Catastrophique, les 2 trains que j'ai pris avaient plus d'1h30 de retard, et j'attends toujours la compensation financière promise... 

Bref, prenez l'avion!

items.title: You ain't getting your money back
items.review_text: I purchased tickets for my wife and I on the London to Paris train 3 months before our trip. Unfortunately, her tourist visa for the UK never came through, that's a whole different story. So we needed to rearrange our entire European itinerary, which meant we weren't going to need to take the train. When I went to cancel our train reservation about 2 months before our trip, I found out our (2) $125 tickets were non-refundable, no I didn't read the terms and conditions, it nerver occurred to me that would be the case. In reply to our cancellation request we were advised that it is not necessary to contact Eurostar if you need to cancel your reservation because 'you ain't getting your money back'.

items.title: Customers come last
items.review_text:
At the Amsterdam train terminus whilst queuing to return to London I witnessed passengers wanting seats being turned away claiming that there was no room, and having to wait to the next train, which was the following day. However travelling back to London the carriage was 90% empty. 
I raised this with Eurostar Customer Services, after eight weeks I received a stock reply, worded as if I had a self interest and not one aiming to help Eurostar.
I see subsequently their Customer Services Dept. comes in for a lot of complaints.

items.title: Keine Kommunikation möglich
items.review_text: Eurostar ist ein Unternehmen, mit dem man nicht kommunizieren kann. Sie halten einen auf Abstand, die Telefon-Hotline ist zu keiner Zeit erreichbar, zugesicherte Erstattungen werden nicht gewährt, Kommunikation mit einzelnen Kunden sabotiert. Der Laden ist ein einziges Ärgernis.

items.title: Abysmal customer service
items.review_text: Booked a train + hotel package and immediately identified a problem with the hotel booking. Eurostar will only deal with hotel bookings by phone, but it is impossible to get through. Had three minutes of trilingual announcements before being cut off. Tried again later (hint: they don't tell you this but press 1 to skip announcements - not that this will help much) and queued for 45 mins before giving up. Tried yet again later and there was an announcement saying they were not accepting any more calls that day. It's an absolute disgrace. I know perfectly well that I am simply shouting into the void by posting this review, but at least it's therapy of sorts. All I can say is that if you have to travel by Eurostar don't on any account use their hotel booking service because it's rubbish and probably won't save you any money.

items.title: Congrats to Eurostar for maintaining a…
items.review_text:
Congrats to Eurostar for maintaining a A-level service to travel to Europe at a time when airports, airline, ferries, governments and every other just let us down! 

You are the last man standing in the UK travel industry

items.title: no customer service
items.review_text: what is wrong with eurostar?? Customer service you go through all the languages then when you select the department it says they are not taking calls. Emailed the 21.07.22 and still no reply. This is ridiculous.

items.title: Trein geannuleerd en krijgen geen contact met de klantenservice
items.review_text:
Dinsdag 19 juli zou ik met twee vriendinnen een week naar Londen gaan. Aangekomen op Rotterdam Centraal bleek er een storing te zijn op het internationale treinnetwerk, waardoor er geen treinen meer reden naar Brussel/Londen. Een uur voor vertrek kregen wij in Rotterdam te horen dat de trein door de storing die avond niet meer ging rijden. Er was geen informatie op de borden en er was niets te vinden op de website van Eurostar. Wat onze alternatieven waren, kon het personeel ons ook niet vertellen. 's Avonds belden we met NS International en die kon ons alleen vertellen dat er donderdag nog een trein naar Londen ging die nog niet volgeboekt was. Op de website van de Eurostar stond dat alle treinen voor de rest van de week volgeboekt zouden zijn; inclusief de trein van donderdag (advies NS International). Kortom, er was geen trein meer die wij die week konden pakken om alsnog naar Londen te reizen. Onze vakantie viel dus gelijk in het water.

Nu alles niet door kon gaan wilden wij onze (hotel)kosten terugvragen. Het Hilton-hotel was via booking.com betaald en die willen niets terugbetalen. Door de overmacht - veroorzaakt door de storing bij Eurostar - vinden wij dat Eurostar alle kosten moet vergoeden; reis- en verblijfskosten. 

De klantenservices van Eurostar is op geen enkele wijze te bereiken. Het enige telefoonnummer dat te vinden is op de website, is alleen voor toekomstige reizen. Als je deze probeert te bellen, dan krijg je te horen dat de lijn overbezet is en word je uit de lijn gegooid. Een andere optie is het contactformulier op de website invullen, zodat Eurostar met jou contact opneemt. Echter, ik heb deze al drie keer ingevuld in de afgelopen week en ik heb nog geen e-mail of belletje van de Eurostar gehad. Voor ons nooit meer reizen met Eurostar! Een organisatie waar de klantenservice niet van functioneert en die je als reiziger in de kou laat staan.

items.title: Nul 3 heures de retard
items.review_text: Nul 3 heures de retard

items.title: Easy travel, but rude employee
items.review_text:
I choose Eurostar because at the time it was the easiest and cheapest option for me to head home. And, to be fair, everything related to the travel went well- passing through security js fairly fast, and simpler than security at the airport as there are less restrictions. However, I didn’t have a nice experience because of a single employee.
When waiting for my turn at security, this employee proceeded to tell me to move forward. However, people were in front of me and all spots were used, as such I waited for a space to open- this is my fault, and I should have still listened to him (though I’m still unsure as to what exactly he expected me to do)- and when I finally went ahead, he proceeded to treat me like an idiot because I didn’t do what he told me to do. I understand I should have listened to him but I don’t believe I deserved to be humiliated, and this caused me to feel bad for the rest of the trip (silly, isn’t it). 

This was my own personal experience, and this single interaction doesn’t mean the Eurostar service is bad- however it didn’t make my experience of it enjoyable.

items.title: Train ticket canceled
items.review_text: My ticket from Amsterdam to London on July 27th has been canceled and I can't get a hold of any Eurostar help service. I am trying to exchange the ticket for another time, but neither the app nor the website process the exchange, loading forever. If we do not reschedule the ticket for another time on the same day, my family and I will lose our hotel reservation in London. If we reschedule for another day, we'll end up getting there without a hotel to stay at. I don't know how to solve this problem. Who takes responsibility for this?

items.title: Un scandale - Aucune réponse du service client pour Échange d’un billet
items.review_text:
Un scandale, un train de 1ere classe à venir dans une semaine et
- Impossibilité d’échanger le ticket, même si je suis prêt à payer un supplément 
- Impossibilité de joindre la hotline après ….. 17 min 56 secondes d’attente sans interlocuteur, du jamais vu 
J’espère être recontacté suite à ce message car je désespère du service client de cette société

items.title: Hire more helpline workers!
items.review_text:
Hire more helpline workers!
How can a large company be this bad at customer service

items.title: Na 1 uur in rij met 38gr geannuleerd
items.review_text:
Met 38 graden een uur in de rij gestaan op het perron van Amsterdam.
We kregen nog wel een flesje water. Vervolgens vlak voor het eind van de rij te horen gekregen dat de hele trein niet rijdt. Wij konden naar huis en morgen naar Brussel en vanaf daar proberen in Engeland te komen met de Eurostar. In het hoogseizoen. Kansloos natuurlijk. Engelsen  stonden daar zonder hotel in hoogseizoen en geld ook vaak nog op.
We zouden een e-mail of sms krijgen. Nooit gehad. Klanten service voor eventueel omboeken of restitutie niet te bereiken. Formulier online ingevuld, krijg je bericht dat je het alleen kunt inleveren als trein geannuleerd is!? Dat was hij ook!!! Uiteindelijk reactie van 3 verschillende mensen via Facebook die waarschijnlijk het zelfde formulier in hebben geprobeerd te vullen, met de reactie dat het niet lukt en een verwijzing naar een link waar je niks mee kan. Naar ons geld kunnen we waarschijnlijk fluiten. Nooit meer met de Eurostar. Een 1000 euro kostende teleurstelling.

items.title: Points from my latest journey have not…
items.review_text: Points from my latest journey have not been added to my account (even though I included my membership number when I booked). Have messaged them on Twitter AND filled in the missing points form online and they still haven’t been added. Eurostar customer service is absolute garbage, I assume the staff is all WFH ie watching Netflix.

items.title: Eurostar left us stranded and does not even provide a refund.
items.review_text: Eurostar cancelled our service from Paris to London. We had to travel by ferry, train and coach to get home because there were no alternative options available. I have requested a refund of my fare six weeks ago. Eurostar have not even responded to my request.

items.title: Lack of Eurostar service
items.review_text: Absoolutly rediculous why Eurostar are not operating even one service per day from and to Ashford International. To travel to the continent from East Kent by rail you will have to travel 40 minutes to St Pancras and then travel back on the same rail line passing Ashford where you could have actullay boarded. Needless to say I will not be travelling by Eurostar anytime soon and instead travelling by Eurotunnel in my car. I wonder how may others are doing the same?

items.title: Shambolic experience - Easier to fly
items.review_text: Booked a Standard Premier Eurostar ticket through Trainline. Needed to adjust it within 75 minutes of booking (partly because it transpired that Standard Premier was not ‘First Class’ as Trainline listed it, but merely economy with a meal). There is no Eurostar support on the weekend, and no ticket flexibility. Not to mention that my one way Eurostar ticket cost £275…at midday on a Tuesday. Whole experience is dreadful.

items.title: I booked a trip in 2020
items.review_text:
I booked a trip in 2020, because of the pandemic it obviously got cancelled and I was issued with vouchers. In fairness to Eurostar they did keep extending the date of when I had to book the trip by.
I tried to ring them two weeks ago to say I wanted to extend the vouchers as I’m not off till end of May 23 and in the website I couldn’t book that far ahead. No response, either by email or phone. I decided to book in April for a short break. I booked the insurance and was in the booking conditions I was permitted to cancel the insurance within 14 days. I tried to cancel. What a joke! Eight emails and five phone calls later, no matter what day or time I was in a queue for a minimum of 10 minutes, and still no response. Unprofessional, no customer service at all. 
What is the point in insurance if you cannot contact them when needed.
Absolutely disgusting way to treat people. Take money of customers then totally disregard them. 
Somebody should investigate the company. 
Disgraceful!

items.title: We were booked on a same day trip to…
items.review_text: We were booked on a same day trip to Paris from our vacation in London on July 15, 2022. We were told by our travel agency that our vaccination cards were fine but Eurostar representative pulled us from line because our vaccines were 15 months old. There was nothing in our literature that mentioned updated vaccine cards. No one had informed us of this even though we had received correspondence from Eurostar. The train was way overbooked and we had to get a Covid test that made us miss our train. We were Not alone. They refused to refund our tickets and could not get us on a train except one where we would arrive in Paris less than two hours before the next train departed.Filling our our seats and still charging us for them is not what I would consider an ethical practice.

items.title: 30 minutes on the phone and no answer!!!
items.review_text: Stuck on the phone for 30 mins and no-one answers. The response to my email is that they won't reply directly and to go to their website. I want to change a return ticket (within their time rules) to a later time and different location. I literally want to give them MORE money but they won't answer. What horrible customer service. If I could give them less than 1 star, I would.

items.title: What had happened to Eurostar?
items.review_text:
I always used to enjoy my trips on the train. Recently took my family and it was absolute chaos at check in both ways. At St Pancras I was booted out of the line with two young children and told it wasnt open until 20 mins later depsite another member of staff telling me to queue in that line, then a minute later someone else opened it up again and I was stuck at the back. 

At Gare Du Nord we were penned into sections that seem to be completely jumbled up with different train times, queues for ticket changes, family passport queue took forever, then had to run with 2 under 3s to make the train. 

Not an easy or pleasant experience for families and I will be taking the plane next time.

items.title: Better quality than flight companies
items.review_text:
Better quality than flight companies

We went to London from Brussels and back with Eurostar. The bad: the train had a 60 min delay on our way to London. The good: Eurostar gave us 46 euros voucher for the inconvenience. I would have preferred cash back, but oh well, nice gesture. When coming back from London, we arrived quite late at St Pancras, but because my husband had a clutch, everybody was extremly nice to us and they made sure we didn't wait in the long queue to check in and have our passports checked. Definitely a better service than most flight companies nowadays.

items.title: Catch a plane
items.review_text:
I was on the 10.22 train from London to Paris on 12 July 2022. Half way through the journey the train broke down and had to be towed all the way back to St Pancras station with no electricity or air conditioning.

Had to urgently re book a 7.00pm train which was also late. Now it’s after 1am and I am wandering the streets of Paris alone looking for my Air B and B accomodation.

Will never use this service again.

items.title: Train cancelled due to power failure and NO refunds or responses!
items.review_text: I raised a compliant via Resolver on 06/06/22 to get reimbursed for a cancelled train due to a power failure at Gare du Nord on 05/06/22.  Despite multiple follow-ups, still not a single response!  And now I'm paying interest!

items.title: No response to emails 14 days ago
items.review_text: No response to emails 14 days ago. Terrible service.

items.title: I felt like this was their first time
items.review_text:
Just total chaos at both London and Paris. I cannot believe that they do this multiple times a day, every day. 

Trying to change a ticket on the UK side  (after they cancelled a train) was like a kafkaesque nightmare. “Do it online” the website suggested. Nope, it wouldn’t allow us to split the booking which we needed to do as one passenger needed to travel on a later train from the rest of us. “Call us because you can’t do it online” they then instructed me. Ok, so I tried that but didn’t even make a phone queue. The recorded message suggested I email. At this point I had no faith in an email being effective - if there were no staff to answer phones who would deal with emails? - so I decided to go at Pancras well before our rescheduled journey and do it in person. Well even that didn’t work. There were TWO staff members dealing with a mile long queue of desperate travellers trying to reschedule trips due to train cancellations because the system wouldn’t let them do it online and the phone service was non-existent. We finally got to the front of the queue and watched as the poor attendants computer timed out as she tried to reschedule my husband’s ticket. She shrugged and said “I can’t help - try emailing”. 

It’s just a farcical level of service. Both trains were late. On one my seat reclined of its own free will with every bend in the track.

Look we did at least arrive alive (although I am assuming that because we are not actually there yet - I am writing from the train) which seems like a miracle because if the engineering is run like the customer service (and let’s face it the train and line maintenance is not even visible so it could be worse) God help us all.

Never again. I will take my chances with Easyjet. I’m sure they will be appalling too, but it will cost half as much.

items.title: Scam
items.review_text: I booked a train ticket and almost immediately after got a message that my train was cancelled. No problem, they said in the mail, I could easily rebook to a different train or get my money back. But none of the links in the mail really work. I've been mailing and trying to call them for 4 weeks, but no response. Result: they still have my money but I don't have train. I booked a plane ticket now which have gotten very expensive because it's last minute. Complete scam.

items.title: Rip Off Voucher Policy
items.review_text: Their rip off policy which gave less than 6 month to use a voucher is a rip off.  They pocket nearly £400  - why did the vouchers have to have a time limit?

items.title: What a shambles…
items.review_text: This company is a customer services shamble and the leaders should be totally ashamed, can't speak to anyone about a forthcoming trip and the mail service states it will respond within 28 days !!! Avoid it at all cost.

items.title: Company is a joke
items.review_text: 9 times asked for a password reset 3 weeks ago as I cannot book a trip without my log in. Have the staff been abducted by the aliens cos how long does it take to reset a password ! Absolutely apalling service and if I could give a mark below 1 I certainly would!

items.title: Shame!
items.review_text: I have suffered a damage during the luggage controls (the Eurostar staff broke my glasses and damaged my passport microchip) and literally have opened 8 customer service tickets so far and processed tens of phone calls without being able to get one single reply or even get an apology. This is to me unacceptable.

items.title: Customer service
items.review_text:
I received a response to my email from the CEO office in less than 24 hours advising that my query was being addressed. In the interim I tried re registering under another email address. Success. No need for a password reset which seems to be a recurring issue. I can now access my account so problem solved. 
Have to say I was very impressed with prompt response to my email from the CEO office so only fair to score accordingly.
Very interesting reviews as ~I have recently experienced a similar situation. Booked with Eurostar for the first time. Fortunately my journey is not affected but I have been unable to register online as I am not receiving a password reset. This makes me reluctant to book any future journeys as i would be concerned if I needed to make amendments. This is a lot of money to risk. I too tried customer service only to be told that they are only taking calls for bookings and to go to their website. I filled in the required email form and have received no reply. No way am I booking any further trips if I cannot communicate with the company involved. I have just emailed the CEO as it seems customer services is not available. Not sure I’ll get a response but figure sometimes you have to escalate matters to the accountable individuals. Will update accordingly. Not sure Eurostar monitor Trust pilot but I have alerted the CEO to these messages.

items.title: Waste of money.
items.review_text:
I bought two tickets to Paris but I need to change dates for one of them but I’m unable to do so online. I’ve been trying to get hold of them on number provided for two weeks but they’re “too busy to answer your (my) call”.... this is literally the automated message given. 
I’ve emailed but no response either. 
I’m about to lose the ticket and very probably the money but there’s nothing I can do about it. 
Surely this contravenes consumer rights...?

items.title: Despair!!!!!
items.review_text:
Despair!!!!!!  Have tried for 2 weeks to get through to Eurostar and written E-mail.  No response whatsoever.  Just keep getting cut off.  
How do you contact them?

items.title: Nooit meer.
items.review_text:
Nooit meer.

Reis van Amsterdam naar Londen. 

Heen door stakingen in Amsterdam en daardoor extra stop in Brussel 1,5 uur vertraging. Kan Eurostar niet veel aan doen.

Terug werd bij Brussel gemeld dat de trein niet verdergaat en dat we moeten overstappen op een Intercity. Totale vertraging 3 uur.

Op de site staat dat dit de vleigreizen en / of autoreizen moet ontmoedigen. Niet voor mij in ieder geval.

items.title: Heenweg vanuit Amsterdam 75min…
items.review_text: Heenweg vanuit Amsterdam 75min vertraging naar Londen terugweg 2,5 uur en moesten overstappen in Brussel in een normale trein naar centraal! Wat een drama geen Eurostar voor mij meer

items.title: Tried for 5 days to contact Eurostar
items.review_text: Tried for 5 days to contact Eurostar - just message and music, no one answers!!!!  Sent email - as advised on website but still no acknowledgement.  How do I contact them???

items.title: Eurostar’s Wi-Fi service is getting…
items.review_text: Eurostar’s Wi-Fi service is getting worse. Very poor and unreliable for this journey from Brussels to London 2/7/22. Don’t believe the hype. You will need to use your own mobile connection.

items.title: Despairing!
items.review_text: Booked for 4 family members to go to Lille for long weekend to visit grandfather's grave. Two of the party tested positive for Covi d so tried to contact Eurostar yesterday to reboo k but they are not taking calls, you hold on listening to all the options then they hang up. Went to the website to try but you cannot do it online! Sent numerous emails but still 30 hours later no one has been in touch. They are very quick to take your money though!!!!

items.title: Changing names on Tickets
items.review_text: I have just booked 2 tickets to Bruges for next April. I made a mistake with the names so I needed to change them. I phoned customer services at dead on 8am this morning and spoke to a really helpful gentleman. Sadly I didn't get his name, but he immediately realised what the problem was and sent me two new tickets without any issues at all. Will see how the travelling goes next year...

items.title: There's no possible reason to offer 'service' this bad!
items.review_text: I've never come across a major company so totally unwilling to engage with its customers. Simply impossible to communicate with. Phone service is officially suspended. Emails are not even acknowledged. Twitter messages are not replied to. Awful.

items.title: Eurostar cancelled my train journey for…
items.review_text: Eurostar cancelled my train journey for the end of July. They gave me the option to exchange it but when I try, it won't show any availability. However, when I go on the website I can see availability on the same day, but at a higher price than what I paid. I've called them several times to try and exchange it on the phone but they don't give you the option to stay on the line as they are receiving 'unprecedented calls and the wait time is too long!' SCAM.

items.title: It gives me migraines
items.review_text:
When your on the train everything is perfect. But booking and getting on the train is a f***ing nightmare.
I've booked a trip two months in advance, then two weeks before the trip the canceled the train and said I can just switch to a other connection. Which would be fine If they had a other damn Train on that day but they don't.

In conclusion
s*it service, good train!

items.title: Poor customer service
items.review_text: Poor customer service. As soon as you ask any complicated questions you get ignored. I Hate companies that encourage this type of employee behaviour!

items.title: Onbereikbare helpdesk, hun bedrijfspolicy is zo min mogelijk service verlenen.
items.review_text:
Mei 2022 retour Amsterdam London, twee dagen voor terugreis mail ontvangen dat de Thalys van Brussel naar Amsterdam uitgevallen is. Zelf nieuw ticket geboekt bij Thalys op andere tijd. 
Eurostar gaf aan dat ticket te vergoeden alleen hebben ze dat nooit gedaan. 
Daarna meerdere malen steeds urenlang in de wacht gestaan om een medewerker aan de lijn te krijgen echter zonder resultaat. Nog steeds geen geld terug. Ontmoedigingsbeleid heet dat. zeer slechte service.

items.title: Don’t book business class
items.review_text: I was downgraded from business class. They didn’t tell me this was what was happening even as they were doing it. So I only found out on the train. I was offered a £3 sandwich to compensate for the £80 upgrade to business. I am still trying to navigate the complaints/refund options after being given lots of misinformation by the EuroStar staff

items.title: Beware Changing Outbound Dates To Europe!
items.review_text:
A word of warning for anyone planning to use Eurostar to Europe this summer. As if travel is not already stressful enough, given the airlines cancelling flights, rail strikes, baggage problems, etc, etc, be very wary of booking with Eurostar, specially if you choose a particular Outbound date and then due to unseen circumstances have to change that Outbound date, whereas the Inbound dates remain unchanged.

They will screw you and charge twice, keeping the original booking costs of £000s, and then re-charging all over again, whereas Trainline alters the new booking dates and charges a small adjustment, for connecting trains to Kings Cross rather than like Eurostar pocketing the entire original Booking, maybe for some summer staff knees-up !

I paid £173 for travel to Amsterdam but had to re-book due to unseen circumstances. I got charged a whopping further £185 for the re-arranged Outbound date only. Trying to call them is a sheer waste of time as they hide behind that chestnut, ’all our agents are………’(what, at 8am??). And trying to reach them by email is another total waste of time.

Avoid changing dates with Eurostar like a plague or they will rip customers off !! Last time I ever travel Eurostar

items.title: I'd rather eat ricin.
items.review_text: Absolutely terrible. I tried making a reservation over the phone as it won't let me do it online. My honeymoon is in less than a week. Spent over an hour on the phone numerous times and still couldn't get through. Tried calling the complaints team and it said they were;t accepting any more calls due to high volume. When a company is so poorly run that you can't even get through to log a complaint about not getting through, you know they're in dire straits. Will never use them again. Hate flying but would rather do that.

items.title: Worst customer service experienced in a…
items.review_text:
Worst customer service experienced in a very long time.
Drives people to take a plane instead which makes Eurostar a big contributor to global warming.

items.title: Mieux vaut prendre l'avion
items.review_text: J'ai acheté des billets par carte bancaire peu avant la pandémie, pour aller a Londres en juillet 2020. Forcément, à cause du COVID, impossible de partir, train annulé et au lieu de rembourser, Eurostar donne des bons d'achat. Pas le choix de ne pas les accepter car aucun remboursement n'est proposé. Je dois attendre 2022 pour enfin pouvoir partir. Seulement suite a mon accouchement, je ne souhaite plus partir et veux céder mon billet a un ami. Impossible et impossible de les joindre. Je ne peux pas changer le nom sur les billets donc je suis obligée de partir. Je change les dates, je paie le supplément mais pour des raisons techniques propres à Eurostar, le train du retour est annulé, encore... Du coup, je demande le remboursement pour enfin en avoir fini avec cette entreprise... Et là, surprise, je reçois a nouveau des bons d'achats! J'essaie a nouveau d'appeler mais les lignes sont en panne depuis le mois de mai!!!! Les mails, pas de réponse !!! Via Twitter, on me dit que j'ai des bons d'achats parce que j'ai payé par bons d'achats... Oui,sauf que le voyage initial a été payé par carte!!! En gros, mieux vaut aller à Londres en avion et fuir Eurostar...

items.title: Don’t waste your money
items.review_text:
Warning if you spend hundreds of pounds to get the Business Class service from Amsterdam to St Pancras don’t bother. 

Fly or go standard class instead. 

There is no business class facility at Amsterdam station but you have to be there 90 minutes ahead of train time.

 Food is not served until AFTER Brussels - 3 hours after you get on the train. 

We have not eaten since breakfast as we thought we could get a snack at Amsterdam and lunch on the train. 

It’s now 4.30pm and they are just about to serve “lunch”.

items.title: Impossible to make changes to ticket once purchased and no response to complaint form or telephone.
items.review_text: I have been trying to change my Eurostar ticket dates for 4 days now but every time I try online I get an ‘Oops error’ message after the payment stage and a message to try again or phone. I have tried over 20 times and even though the dates and times are still available, the error message still comes up. I have even tried different payment methods, phones and laptops but still the same reply. The system is obviously faulty! Phoning is also impossible as you can’t get through whatever time of day you try. I have also filled out their complaint form three times, emailed them directly and tweeted but still no reply as yet. I booked with confidence, buying expensive tickets on the premise that the dates could easily be changed, which I believe is false advertising as it was very easy to book and take payment, but impossible for me to make any changes. Now, after today, my tickets will be within 7 days and accordingly to their terms and conditions should incur a fee which I will not pay as it is not my fault that their system is faulty. I don’t know what to do or who to contact now to get this resolved. The experience has been very frustrating, stressful and upsetting. I have lost all confidence in Eurostar as this company is very unprofessional to allow this situation to happen and their customers to be treated in this way.

items.title: We had an awful time with Eurostar at…
items.review_text:
We had an awful time with Eurostar at the beginning of June. 
Our Eurostar was delayed therefore we missed our connection in Lille and we got no help from them (booked as one ticket London to Disney changing at Lille). There were no employees of Eurostar to help us at Lille, not speaking french we had no idea where to go (we ended up having to go to a completely different station to get a connecting train!). Awful service by Eurostar , we felt like we had just been dumped in a foreign country. We then arrived two hours late at Disney. 
On the return journey there were then delays at Lille again with no communication as to why and we left 2 hours later than planned. The toilets at Lille Eurostar were disgusting and obviously not been cleaned for a long time, had no toilet paper and no soap. When reported to a member of staff they just responded with oh. The toilet then once on the train had no running water to wash our hands. 
I’ve tried to contact Eurostar numerous times since our return with as yet no response.

items.title: Geen reactie, laat staan excuses
items.review_text: Onze vouchers voor een reis naar Londen ter waarde van 768,50 euro, wegens Corona drie jaar opgeschoven, blijken uiteindelijk niet inwisselbaar door een niet werkende vouchercode. Contact hierover, telefonisch of email is niet mogelijk. We hebben tot 30 juni a.s. de tijd om te boeken maar krijgen geen reactie, laat staan excuses!!!

items.title: Why is management not embarrassed?
items.review_text: Six weeks on and still no reply to my email and reminders.  Auto response advises a reply will be sent within four weeks but even that, if it had been met, is far too long.  An hour wait when calling to speak to someone only to be informed "we are very busy" ... my response: "hire more staff".

items.title: Ik vind met de Eurostar reizen geweldig, maar je moet geen service nodig hebben van een klantenservice.
items.review_text: Dit weekend met de Eurostar naar Londen geweest. Stoelen online wijzigen werkte niet, contact met de klantenservice is onmogelijk. De trein was iets te laat in Rotterdam. Paspoortcontrole was niet gelukt, dus moest de hele trein leeg in Brussel, allemaal door de controle en toen weer door. Uiteindelijk 72 minuten later in Londen. Treinreis was verder prettig. Personeel van Eurostar onderweg vriendelijk. Blij verrast dat ik makkelijk restitutie kon aanvragen, maar teleurgesteld dat ik geen refund krijg, maar een e-voucher, hier had ik niet voor gekozen en het 2e kaartje van mijn reisgenoot is niet meegenomen, wil ik daar nu een claim voor doen, dan zegt Eurostar dat er al geclaimd is. Zoals eerder gezegd is contact met een klantenservice volstrekt onmogelijk. Ik vind met de Eurostar reizen geweldig, maar je moet geen service nodig hebben van een klantenservice.

items.title: Prima verbinding tussen Amsterdam en…
items.review_text:
Prima verbinding tussen Amsterdam en Londen.

De eerste keer met de Eurostar naar Londen. Prima ervaring. Trein vertrok keurig op tijd uit Amsterdam en was ook keurig op tijd in Londen. 

Er moet wel duidelijker gemeld worden dat je door een controle moet! Inclusief koffercheck en paspoort controle door zowel de Nederlandse marechaussee als de Engelse. 

Voldoende ruimte voor koffers. 

Prima alternatief voor een vliegreis.

items.title: St Pancras to Rotterdam . do not use !!!
items.review_text:
We caught Eurostar 13.01 London to Rotterdam. 
On arriving at Brussels Midi to get 16.52 connection Train 9357 we could not find any reference for our train.  (Brussels Midi to Rotterdam Central )
We managed to eventually find a ticket inspector who informed us our train was cancelled.
He advised us to get another train that left half hour later which took 2.5 hours to get to Rotterdam.
The train was packed and all 5 of our party could not get a seat. We arrived at Rotterdam Central 1.5 hours late. We missed our meal reservation and therefore missed any opportunity to get meal as restaurants in Rotterdam generally close at 21.00.
We booked Eurostar believing it would be a relaxing way to traveling to Rotterdam instead we arrived stressed.
There seems no way of complaining , they wont pick up the phone , don't reply to emails and the online forms are a joke .

items.title: No "contact us" option!
items.review_text: No "contact us" option!! At all! (Save chat to a bot). They cancel the train, emailed me about this, but the continue sending "prepare for you journey" emails... Real joke Customer Service

items.title: vreselijke ervaring dit anderhalf uur…
items.review_text: vreselijke ervaring dit anderhalf uur van te voren aan moeten komen nergens niet eens een peuk kunnen doen, dan kom ik in de trein en kan niet eens normaal zitten omdat er zo achterlijk weinig plek is,ben na een uur opmoeten staan omdat me knieen en me lichaam zo zeer deed dus ben maar rond gaan lopen in de trein... toen ging ik 1 blikje cola halen met 1 broodje ham en kaas koste me godver 10 euro en het broodje was nog niet te vreten ook!! AUB GOOI GEEN GELD WEG EN GA NIET MET EUROSTAR OP VAKANTIE!

items.title: Non existent customer service
items.review_text:
I’ve sent them four emails in the last few days without any response. Tried calling but absolute waste of time.
Planning a trip to Amsterdam in August but now getting nervous in the light of all the terrible reviews.
BUT will flying be any better???
And Eurostar prices very high.

items.title: Chaos
items.review_text:
Chaos management. Staff had no idea how to effectively and efficiently manage the waiting passenger lines.

The cost to travel on this service isn’t worth it. Horrible experience in Paris for a journey to London…. Don’t waste your time!

items.title: Rotterdam to London StP in Standard…
items.review_text:
Rotterdam to London StP in Standard Premier:

- waiting area in Rotterdam very cramped and no catering apart from a poorly stocked vending machine. Advised to be there an hour in advance.
- very noisy kitchen throughout journey. Doors to passenger area kept open for convenience of staff (who were generally friendly)
- no working toilets in any of the standard premier carriages
- meal inedible (grey, dry chicken, wilted salad). 
- half hour delay in channel tunnel because of signalling problems (train manager provided frequent updates)
- tickets over-priced. 

Overall this should be a great alternative to flying and it isn’t, even in a time of busy airports.

items.title: Don't recommend
items.review_text: Booked a trip to London with a few friends, suddenly get messages both our to and from trains are cancelled due to "operational reasons". We tried to re-book to another train but now there isn't enough room for our whole group on the same trains. This on top of the very expensive prices make for an awfull experience. You're better off buying a cheap plane ticket to somewhere else.

items.title: Eurostar Rail Strike Response
items.review_text: I was due to  travel to Bruges 20th to 23rd June.  On 7th June RMT announced strikes.  I contacted Eurostar by Twitter as phones always busy and on 8th June was told Eurostar services unaffected.  On 12th June I discovered you could not book Eurostar for evening journeys on the RMT strike days.  Twitter messages three days running requesting clarification not replied to.  On 15th June I finally managed to speak on the phone after trying all day and being on hold over an hour and was told strikes having no impact.  Next day I get an email telling me how to prepare for my trip and then a text advising my return journey could not be guaranteed. Finally, later that evening Eurostar put the first message on their website.  Today I learnt a general strike in Belgium was announced on 14th to take place on 20th June, again there is no information on the Eurostar website.  Eurostar obviously cannot control strikes but they do control their website, their phone service and their social media accounts.  The response and flow of information has been woeful to the point of non-existance.  I don’t really think they are competent to run international train services.

items.title: Wat een rotbedrijf
items.review_text: Wat een rotbedrijf. Trein geannuleerd en kan niet opnieuw boeken. Klantenservice niet bereikbaar, totaal 2 uur in de wacht en maar opgehangen.

items.title: Customer service? What customer service?
items.review_text: I have emailed them twice, tried calling multiple times and get told they are too busy to speak with me, have tweet/retweeted, sent a facebook message. Their customer service is dreadful! Now been on hold to their complaints team for 15 minutes but know im not going to get anywhere.

items.title: Schandalig, gangsterpraktijken
items.review_text: combiticket voor 4 personen geboekt (trein + hotel) voor meer dan 2000Euro via de website van Eurostar. Na 1 week een E-mail ontvangen dan de trein geannuleerd is. Op geen enkele manier kan je omboeken of geld teruggestort krijgen. Ik krijg de melding dat mijn tickets niet zou bij Eurostar geboekt zijn, hoewel dit wel zo is. Wat een gangsters, pure oplichterij. Dit kan toch niet voor zo een groot bedrijf.

items.title: Getting worse each time I use them
items.review_text: Trains run late, massive queues to check-in, wifi/internet never works and tickets get more expensive by the day. One would think it can't get worse. Unfortunately, it does get worse each time I travel with Eurostar!

items.title: Too expensive
items.review_text: Trains from London to Paris way too expensive. Better to go by car or bus to Calais (3-4h), then take a local bus or train to Paris. Or order train to Lille only, then take a SNCF train to Paris (twice cheaper).

items.title: Is anyone even there?
items.review_text: I've emailed and I've called multiple times. No one is answering any communications. I was on the phone today for 50 minutes and they just hung up on me. There is no acceptable excuse for this.

items.title: The bad, the good and the amazing!
items.review_text:
The negative; huge queues (probably because the airports aren’t working at the moment) and the trains look tired and no water in loos even at the start of the journey. 

The positives; left on time even if it was a tight call. 

The amazing: the staff. With a monumental queue and getting very close to missing the train we (and lots of others around us) interacted with the staff a lot. To a man (or woman) they were polite, professional, knowledgable and reassuring. A credit to Eurostar. 

Going through passport control, with just minutes to go to our train and the French passport officers being particularly officious, I queried to one staff “ will we make the 11:04?” To which I got the reply in a reassuring but friendly voice “ we leave no-one behind”…. Brilliant!

items.title: Absolutely bad that a train ticket can…
items.review_text:
Absolutely bad that a train ticket can cost much more than it's counter part flight ticket?

We would rather take  atrain an better for the environment also but not at this outrageous prices!

items.title: Just avoid
items.review_text: Just avoid. They randomly cancelled our train last week and then provided no support. Asked us to find a way back to London from Paris. An airline can't do that. This company should be banned or should be brought under proper regulation. Eurostar can't be trusted.

items.title: First and last time I take the Eurostar…
items.review_text:
First and last time I take the Eurostar from Amsterdam to London.

Firstly, it doesn’t actually exist yet. You have to change at Brussels and then take the Eurostar from there. Secondly, it’s impossible to find the platform in Amsterdam Central, and thirdly when you do get onto the Thales train it is delayed to the extent that you miss your actual Eurostar. 

I was waiting for 5 hours in Brussels for the next train to London and then THAT train was delayed again. I spent all day in limbo / travelling - it was a total waste of time, I missed all the meetings I had lined up in London. I just wish I had taken the plane!

items.title: Worst company to try and deal with
items.review_text: Once you’re on the train it’s great, but Customer Service pre/post travel is abysmal. with half your workers still working from home why should your standard response for emails be 28 days? And i’ve never actually been able to get through in the phone. Management strategy delivered by muppets - you should reinvest some of that profit into more staff and better managers.

items.title: Crappy unfair policies
items.review_text:
Bought a Eurostar ticket me and 2 passengers (3 total), but I remembered an hour after that my passport was still being processed and needed to cancel. The trip was for more than 2 weeks away but when trying to contact Eurostar it says you can't cancel your tickets for a refund, just don't show up if you can't go.

What a load of bullsh*t, you can also change your ticket dates if you want but you might have to pay more if the price is costlier (fair enough) but if the prices are cheaper, they won't refund the difference (how convenient the bloody scammers).

I would rather go by boat than go Eurostar due to these sh1tty policies that verge on being extortionate. I understand if people cancel at the last minute but if you just bought a ticket and need to cancel straightaway your money is basically gone.

Eurostar can do one.

items.title: Honteux
items.review_text: Service client en cas de retard ou de problèmes de train laissant à désirer !

items.title: Worst costumer service ever
items.review_text:
Worst costumer service ever! Website crashes most time, noone replies emails or phone calls. Even when managed to speak to someone on the phone they ask you to send an email that noone reads or reply!!!

Never again using Eurostar. Similar price to flights but inexistent customer service if there is any mistake. Not worth.

items.title: Awful
items.review_text: I travelled from London to Paris and couldn’t recognise what used to be a reliable and excellent service. Firstly,  I was advised to arrive 1h30 minutes before departure, even if the security and passport check are the same as before Covid and Brexit. All that time was spent in a huge queue and I managed to board my train only because there was a 50 min delay. Not enough passport control points and overcrowded lounge. Obviously, as people arrive long before their departure. On my way back some trains were cancelled due to power supply disruption in Paris. I only received an SMS advising me not to travel that day. I had to, due to work commitments. Spent the entire day monitoring their site that didn’t provide much information regarding estimated delays for trains that were not cancelled. Eventually boarded my train that was delayed approx 2h30 minutes. Got a voucher as compensation, but I don’t know what makes them think I’d want to use their service again? It’s definitely cheaper to fly and the hassle (arrive at certain time before departure, long queues etc) is exactly the same as when flying. I must say that the staff was polite but they did not have much information either. Awful communication from Eurostar.

items.title: Solution erreur billets
items.review_text: Jai eu des soucis d’erreur de saisie des noms pour mes billets. Apres quelque difficulté  a joindre la hotline, jai ou échanger par email avec Dieynaba du service client qui m’a solutionné en un eclair et qui était vraiment tres gentille. Merci encore a elle pour tout ce qu’elle a pu faire!!

items.title: The worst brand by far
items.review_text: Delays going out from Kings Cross, due to a passengers illness and delays going back to Kings Cross..Power failure. This brand is absolute trash. Will never use Eurostar again.

items.title: AWFUL SERVICE . IMPOSSIBLE TO GET SUPPORT.
items.review_text:
TWO DAYS tryng to purchase a Paris London ticket,  for travel  in a couple of days' time. 

Computer throwing me a message indicating tickets have not yet been released?  

30 MINUTES  WAITING onEurostar phone line . No oone picking up

15 MINUTES TRYING THE ST PANCRAS TELEPHONE number... NO joy either. It rings a few times then the engaged tone..

I HAVE HAD BETTER SERVICE FROM BUS COMPANIES IN AFRICA AND MEXICO

ILL CONSIDER FLYING.

items.title: Un scandale
items.review_text: Manque d’information sur le site internet et service client inexistant…

items.title: I have had the worst possible…
items.review_text: I have had the worst possible experience at euro star ‘business premier’ train from paris to London, I would like to name Binca which is by far the worst possible staff I have ever witnessed from the first look as soon as I boarded she constantly gave me unpleasant and unwelcoming attitude and looks throughout my time on the train whenever I asked a simple question as to where my seat was she was aggressive and unhelpful. when I asked for vegetarian/halal options she said there was no options and you would have to book in advance when I asked a different staff member he said vegetarian options are available. she served all the other passengers before me and my friend, the last straw was when my friend was waiting for a drink for 15 minutes I tried to avoid her but was left with no option but to ask her for a drink and she said in the rudest way possible “SAY PLEASE” I refused as it was not a kind request I didn’t believe it felt right, in her head it was a power play so I refused she started shouting a lot of different things like you are not getting your drink in a very childish way I then asked for the manager. Now the manager which his name was Mansour, before even approaching me spoke to her first and then other guests in and around our area most of it was in French which they probably realised I did not understand, then came to me in a very unfriendly way he requested I get up and follow him to the front of the train which was very embarrassing as it felt like a I had done something wrong and made me look bad in front of the other passengers. The way he was speaking it felt like he had already written me off and was not listening to my side at all. As the train was coming to the destination I practically gave up as the manager had taken her side she constantly walked past me with again unpleasant looks at that point I realised no disciplinary actions would be taken this route and decided to leave it. I would be very surprised if I EVER book the euro star again definitely not paying the extra for business premier as you would expect better service for the money you spend.

items.title: Recht op refund nooit gekregen
items.review_text: Ook wij krijgen nog honderden euro's van Eurostar omdat onze trein de avond van tevoren gecanceld werd en we daardoor de boot moesten nemen (midden in de nacht moeten regelen) maar hebben volgens de website geen recht op een refund. Op mails tweets telefoontjes wordt niet gereageerd. Absoluut geen betrouwbaar alternatief voor vliegen boot of auto. Nooit meer Eurostar voor mij.

items.title: Klantenservice via internet loopt vast en telefonisch onbereikbaar
items.review_text:
Klantenservice via internet loopt vast, dus omboeken omdat de trein is geannuleerd lukt niet. 
Bellen: voor de derde keer meer dan een uur in de wacht gestaan, maar niemand aan de lijn gekregen. 

Zeer slecht en zeer triest georganiseerd. Het lijkt er op dat ik beter kan gaan vliegen omdat Eurostar haar zaakjes totaal niet op de rails heeft.

items.title: Slechtste customer service ooit
items.review_text: Slechtste customer service ooit, ze annuleren je treinrit een week voordien en wanneer je refund aanvraagt kan dit niet!! Niemand bereikbaar via mail of telefoon ... €350 euro voor twee treintickets en dan krijg je dit, schandalig.

items.title: Belgian bus and train strike nearly left us stranded and was sooooo stressful…
items.review_text: Eurostar was fine but we discovered there was a national train and bus strike in Belgium on 31st May - the day we were travelling back from Spa to the UK. We bought the train ticket as part of the Eurostar ticket. It would have been good if Eurostar had let us know as we could have changed our plans and stayed the last night in Brussels. There were no buses provided by Belgian railways to replace the trains. You were supposed to use local buses but not all were running and there seemed no way of knowing which bus would come. It was so stressful. We got up at 5am and were waiting for buses that didn't come wondering if we would make it back in time for the Eurostar train. Not speaking the language and there not being anyone at the stations to ask. We followed the suggested routes and buses on the SNCB website but buses didn't come. The info kept changing too. Desperate we got a bus to Liege and were trundling our suitcases trying to find the station or tourist info. Found there were no buses or trains we could get. Kindly staff in a cafe rang a taxi for us. Spent £64 euros to get to next town hoping bus would arrive there to take us to St Truin train station. Waited 3 hours for bus in the heat. Two of the buses due to come didn't come. From 5am to 2.45pm only ate a banana we had with us as too stressed to eat and didn't dare risk wasting time/missing bus. Finally got train back to Brussels but it was horrendous and has put me off travelling by train in Europe. We felt left adrift with no help.

items.title: Nice straight forward trip
items.review_text:
Travelled back from Brussels to London. Booked Standard Premier and had a good trip. I hate traveling backwards but the booked seats were rear facing - the steward found us alternative seats which was great. Food/drink adequate and service fine.

Arrived on time at St Pancreas and on local train to get home within minutes.

items.title: Ik heb Eurostar geboekt
items.review_text: Ik heb Eurostar geboekt. Eerst werd mijn reis omgeboekt naar een onmogelijk vroeg tijdstip. Maar OK. Vervolgens werd de trein helemaal geannuleerd. Ik kreeg een mail dat ik kon omboeken (dat betekende een extra hotelovernachting in London). Toch maar gedaan, maar de omboeking wordt niet bevestigd. Gebeld. Ongeveer een kwartier aan de lijn gehangen, geen enkele respons. Wat is dit voor een oplichtersbende?

items.title: Was asked to come 90 mins ahead
items.review_text: Was asked to come 90 mins ahead. Spent the 120 mins in queues carrying bags. No signage. No info.  A stain in St. Pancras Station. Second time I went to paris in a month and the same result. Over 1 hour delays. The compensate for the delay with 40euros that can only be used on eurostar trains. So it's like monopoly money as I will never use this train again! Maybe I can contribute the compensation towards proper signage? Might as well call themselves ryantrain or essytrain. Pretty comparable service

items.title: Close Eurostar Kings Cross down
items.review_text: Close Eurostar Kings Cross down. Absolute joke of a service. People queuing a mile down the road, the queue is so long it goes out the back of the station (and Kings Cross is a very big station) down the road and round the corner. Everyone missing their trains. Horrendous service. The queue for Eurostar is so long that general public cannot enter the station or underground. Disgusting, cant even call it a service. Shut it down.

items.title: I travel regularly on Eurostar between…
items.review_text: I travel regularly on Eurostar between Brussels and London. I would agree with a lot of the negative comments posted here. There has been a significant decline in the quality of service on Eurostar trains since 2019 caused by last minute cancellations, delays, toilets out of use, poor cleaning, etc. which one could probably put down to cost cutting and sheer incompetence on the part of senior management. There needs to be a clear out at executive management level and new quality leadership brought in. If I could travel with a different operator I would.

items.title: Vertrek uit Rotterdam erg onduidelijk…
items.review_text:
Vertrek uit Rotterdam erg onduidelijk als je alleen de barcode op je telefoon gebruikt. Op station geen duidelijke verwijzingen waar je je moet melden waardoor ruim op tijd op station toch te laat om in te checken terwijl de trein pas een half uur later vertrok.
Ticket is wel omgeboekt maar vertrokken dus pas drie uur laterr

items.title: Trying to contact by telephone.
items.review_text:
I have been trying to phone as I have two tickets for the same name and one missing. Held on for more than half an hour and gave up. Why not say how long the wait is?
No reply to my email request for help with this issue yet either.

items.title: I wish I can give them less than one…
items.review_text: I wish I can give them less than one star. Yesterday, I was not allowed to travel DIRECTLY to the Amsterdam from London by the French officers at the station who claimed that I needed a visa after BREXIT. Still, I have all the legal documents that allow me to travel and the website clearly says that I can go without a visa if it is for less than 90 days, which was the case. They also said that I can travel by plane but not train!!!!!!!!! This horrible experience has caused me emtional and financial damage accompanied by huge distress. Obviously, no one knows what the rules are and it seems that many laws and legal rights are getting violated because of their carelessness and ignorance. Moreover, no one has explained why this happened!

items.title: Inexistant phone support which is required by Eurostarstar to be used
items.review_text: Horrible phone service as none. Some actions on the website require reaching to the Eurostar phone support which has a phone number but nobody is there to pick up the calls for hours and weeks ...

items.title: sunday 22 may cancellation
items.review_text: sunday 22 may . service cancelled back to london . Awful service no help in finding accommodation even though it was a eurostar hotel and travel package . Chaos . Monday morning service Chaos too . What a shambles . This used to be a great service by a great company - i think new management needed soon .

items.title: AWFUL COMPANY
items.review_text: Absolutely non existence customer service! Attempted Booking online, £1700 taken from my credit card then no tickets issued.  Website gives customer service telephone number which constantly states “ too long wait times ring back later”, no acknowledgment of email sent to complain.  Wish I had seen these reviews before dealing with this shambolic company.  Trading Standards need to investigate.

items.title: Sunday 22 May
items.review_text: Sunday 22 May. One and half hours to get through boarding at G de N.  No assistance from staff. Total distain and disinterest. Missed our train. Disgraceful service.

items.title: Paris to London: rude staff and unpleasant experience
items.review_text:
I will be avoiding travelling from Paris to London on the Eurostar if I can. To begin with there were no clear signs as to which line was for which train, which there was from London to Paris. The staff were generally rude and dismissive, and the difference a particular lady treated standard versus business premier passengers would be hilarious if it wasn't shocking. I understand business premier pay more, but it shouldn't be "bonjour Madame/Monsieur" smiley smiley and polite, and on the other hand shouting at people to get there passports ready and physically stopping them if they don't. What are we boarding the Titanic??
Our train was delayed due to electrical failures, fine they can't control that. But there was NO explanation as to why from the staff and we were left standing there dumbfounded for hours. When a lady asked when we would be boarding, she was completely ignored. Finally they changed our tickets to an earlier train (still massively delayed), but it wasn't clear as to why we were getting our tickets changed and to what train. When I panicked a bit (I think understandably), she LAUGHED at me and shook her head. Appalling behaviour and the staff should be ashamed of themselves for the way they "handled" the situation. I understand you can't control technical issues, but for the love of God there should be some contingency plan that doesn't include being flippant and extremely rude to people who have PAYED to board your service. I can only give two stars because the London to Paris side was very well organised and the staff were very polite and lovely.

items.title: Awful awful experience
items.review_text: Awful awful experience. Eurostar has really become an absolute joke. From convenient train travel between the UK and France, it has become the worst form of travel imaginable. They cancelled the train to Paris as we were standing in line to check in. They gave me a new boarding card when they rebooked me on the train for two hours later, which ended up being delayed by quite a lot. Then they made all passengers get ANOTHER new boarding card because of the delay? Why?! It was an absolute MESS with confused passengers just trying to figure out what they were meant to do. There were hardly any staff around and those that were in the waiting area seemed completely harassed and unwilling to help. What is going on?? Why has Eurostar become so awful??

items.title: Heb kort geleden gesolliciteerd
items.review_text:
Heb kort geleden gesolliciteerd , en werd van he kastje naar de muur gestuurd .
Alles is erg onduidelijk , zou een training krijgen van een week .
Vrij geregeld , baan opgezegd. 
Moest alleen nog gesprek afronden uit Londen .
Was niet gemotiveerd genoeg ??????? 
Heb een hele goede CV en erg veel horeca ervaring .
Begrijp helemaal niks van dat bedrijf , werken allemaal langs elkaar heen .
Mooie belofte geven , niks doen .
Waardeloos bedrijf !!!!!!!!

items.title: Could be so much better...
items.review_text:
The Eurostar trains are comfortable, there is plenty of room to stow luggage and there are even sockets available (both EU and UK sockets) to charge your mobile devices. Wifi is available, but, as on most trains, relies on 3G technology and is therefore unbearably slow and for all practical purposes inadequate. But that is not unique for Eurostar. 

Where it all falls apart for Eurostar is customer experience. Especially when it comes to informing passengers about delays and logistic handling at both ends (Amsterdam and London in my case). I expected queues for security and customs, but not at the magnitude encountered. At the Amsterdam end it took approximately one hour to clear check-in, security and customs. During this wait, there is no indication whatsoever whether you are in the right queue (for what destination). Passengers are completely exposed to the elements while waiting so I was lucky it was a sunny day. Had to wait for thirty minutes in a cramped waiting room, too small for the amount of passengers that fit in one train. Without any announcement a set of doors opened an a certain point and, while staff was there, passengers were left up to their own devices to figure out what would happen next. 

At the London end, things were pretty much the same, save that the queue was completely inside this time. Due to weather conditions, some trains were canceled and others delayed. Eurostar couldn't be bothered to inform their passengers about the current situation and where to go. Their app simply stated that all was well; this led to long lines for the info desk as it was fairly obvious that all was not well. Eurostar could have so easily prevented this by providing information through their mobile app. 
There were several lines for the various cancelled/delayed trains, but it was completely unclear which line to join, if any. The staff was extremely rude to passengers being in the wrong line and ushered them out of it in a rude manner. Eventually, and unannounced neither by app, displays or spoken, an employee opened a line for my train. The indicated destination was incorrect, but I happened to be close by and noticed it. No other option but to queue and wait for what's coming. After another exorbitant long wait I managed to clear the check in and security. All of it was inefficient and chaotic. Customs were cleared easily, only to arrive in an overcrowded and therefore throughly unpleasant departure hall. No seats available (I was accustomed to that meanwhile) so nothing do to but wait around for what would happen (tunnel was closed due to bad weather). At the time the gates should open to board the train, there was an announcement that service through  the tunnel was suspended for an unknown amount of time. Or, at least, that's what I understood as the speaker volume was low and the message not repeated for clarity. Meanwhile, passengers having cleared customs kept streaming in leading to even more cramped conditions. Their app provided no information and staff shone through their absence. The queue for the info desk had grown to impressive proportions as Eurostar again couldn't be bothered to use their various digital platforms to provide information. 
The delay turned out to be just 30 minutes; had they not kept the suspense by providing information, the wait would have been less stressful. Boarding was fast and the train left. But the journey wasn't over just yet...
By the time we reached Brussels we had caught up on the delay by ten minutes. But we had to wait for a crew change for a whopping 50 minutes which increased the train delay to about 75 minutes. A single muffled announcement was the only info provided, and the passengers where left to stew for the duration. Suprisingly, things changed for the better with the new crew; no more muffled announcements, but a crisp female voice that not only provided information on connecting trains, but also repeat the messages in case they were completely heard the first time! More staff like her, please, Eurostar! Sadly, with the 75 minute delay we arrived at Amsterdam late at night - the staff promised the passengers to go coach-by-coach to discuss travelling options that late, but that promise wasn't kept (I was in the last coach, so maybe they didn't make it that far before Amsterdam).

So all of it left a bitter sweet experience; the train can be a viable alternative to airplanes (the train is comfortable), but not like the way Eurostar implemented it... This leaves me to conclude pretty much the same as most other reviewers: Eurostar, work on your provided (and currently nearly absent) customer exprience!! Starting with adequate information provision; you have an excellent app so there is no excuse not to do that.

items.title: Eurostar used COVID as an excuse to permanently stop calling at Ashford
items.review_text:
Eurostar used COVID as a pathetic excuse to permanently stop running trains from Ashford 
International in Kent.

items.title: Awful
items.review_text:
Awful. Been ringing for weeks. Got the same recorded message basically in a nutshell… we can’t be bothered to answer your call. 
I’ve got vouchers that need to be redeemed and can only do that by speaking to someone. Fat chance. If I lose them I will never travel Eurostar again…. I’ll go by flix bus and bla bla coaches before wasting my hard earned money paying for a third world response from what is supposed to be a first class travel company. Out of 10 …. 1.
Buck your ideas up

items.title: Great service
items.review_text: Travelled to Paris last week and throughly enjoyed it, on the outward journey getting through security in London was fast and efficient. The Eurostar is very good and in Paris very fast, travelled premier standard so got a small snack and drink. The return journey a couple days later, travelling standard,  we ended up changing our ticket for a earlier train, which we done for €50 per person. Security was fast the journey was great! Will definitely use the Eurostar again. 5 stars!!! top tip when they announce the train is ready to board you don’t have to race (like most people) to jump on the train all seats are reserved anyway.

items.title: No customer service.  Telephone access non existent
items.review_text: These reviews evidence a clear pattern of no customer service.   My experience is that you cannot obtain refunds or exchanges to which you are fully entitled because it is not often possible online, and the lack of any access via telephone (a variety of shameful excuses or none) is disgraceful.  If this were widely known they would have to respond.

items.title: Eurostar: een mislukt project
items.review_text:
Daar zit je dan. Volkomen verbijsterd op een bankje naast het treinstation. 

Net als velen anderen mocht ik vandaag niet de Eurostar in. Reden: ik stond ruim op tijd (45’) op het perron te wachten, maar had het hokje waar je door de controle moet niet gezien. Daar was ook niemand aanwezig aangezien de check-in een uur voor vertrek sluit. 

Het argument van Eurostar dat we de website hadden kunnen lezen is ongetwijfeld correct, maar we hebben het hier over iets dat verder gaat dan regeltjes. Er zijn op 1 avond meer dan 15 mensen geweigerd om in te stappen, terwijl het Eurostar personeel gewoon aanwezig was maar zich afsloot in hun kantoortje. Er stonden naast mij allemaal reizigers die heel bewust de trein wilden  nemen in plaats van het vliegtuig en iedereen was op tijd aanwezig op het treinstation. Eurostar doet echter niets om klanten te helpen, maar lijkt bewust de boel te frustreren en kleineert haar klanten. 

Nadat de trein vertrokken was en het personeel ineens verscheen - mensen die ons ook hadden kunnen inchecken - was de houding vijandig en onbeschoft. 

Ik geef dit bedrijf 1 ster en hoop dat men aan de slag gaat met het verbeteren van 1) communicatie, 2) aanwijzingen op vertreklocaties en 3) klantvriendelijkheid. 

Tot ik reviews zie die deze verbetering aangeven kies ik voor ander vervoer, en ik raad allen die dit lezen aan hetzelfde te doen.

items.title: Turning customers away!
items.review_text: I'm trying to book travel for a group which I can't do online - their website says I have to ring.  Which would be fine if they actually answered the phone.  What sort of company greets potential customers with a message saying that they aren't accepting any more calls today as they are too busy?  I'm trying to be eco-friendly and not fly but they don't make it easy.

items.title: Disgustingly bad customer service.
items.review_text: Booked a trip to Brussels many months back, 3 weeks ago realised I wouldn't be able to travel so attempted to change journey. Couldn't do it online so we asked to call, I've now phoned every day for 3 weeks and been greeted by a lovely mix of technical difficulties to a queue so large they automatically cut me off. Here I am less than 24 hours before the journey and have been on hold for over an hour and a half and the grim reality I'm about to lose a significant amount of money.

items.title: Prachtig idee, na brexit waardeloos
items.review_text:
Prachtig idee, toen er nog geen brexit, na brexit zit je net als bij een vliegtuig met een inchecktijd van 60 a 90 minuten van te voren aanwezig.
Conclusie: vliegtuig is hierdoor een beter en sneller alternatief
Ook switchen ze personeel in brussel hier rekenen ze een halfuur voor.
Waarom???? Onnodig en totaal ongewenst, voegt 1/5 aan je reistijd toe.

Kortom eens , maar nooit meer.
Thalys en ice heb je dat soort problemen niet omdat je binnen eu blijft.

items.title: Trip … London to Paris
items.review_text:
We recently went to Paris for a few days on Eurostar, the check-in and journey was almost faultless, with this element of our relationship with Eurostar went without a hitch and we enjoyed the trip very much.
However, Eurostar After Sales is awful, difficult to get through to Enquiries, long waits and often service 'unavailable'. Eurostar clearly need to employ more Customer Service Consultants and extend Helpline opening times. After many days of trying I eventually got through to a really kind & pleasant lady, who was really helpful. My tip is, ring the minute the lines open in the morning, before there’s time for a queue to build up!

items.title: Comfortable and exciting
items.review_text: Comfortable and exciting. The only thing I would say is that the waiting area is not that comfy.

items.title: Customer service non-existent
items.review_text:
I noticed an error in my booking and sent an email requesting help. Over 72 hours later, no response. Tried ringing them and after many attempts to get me to use the website I finally got a dial tone - but then I hear the message “we are not answering calls at the moment due to technical problems”. Never heard that from a call centre before!

Generally I choose train travel over flying but Eurostar do their best to make me rethink.

items.title: Eurostar won't issue a refund when my train was cancelled
items.review_text:
I wasn't able to travel because of covid travel restrictions and I still haven't received a refund. 

Their customer service has been extremely slow to reply via email (wait times of weeks and weeks!)
I haven't tried calling recently, but tried several times in the past, waited and waited and never managed to speak to anyone.
#06944537

items.title: If I could give 0 I would
items.review_text: If I could give 0 I would
