items.title: Peggio? Non si può!
items.review_text:
Ho utilizzato questo servizio per un rapido viaggio Parigi-Londra e ritorno dal 14 al 19 di Aprile 2022 e sconsiglio a chiunque di utilizzarlo.
A parte il poco simpatico effetto "scatola di sardine" delle sale d'attesa e dei treni, non viene praticamente fornita alcuna assistenza né ai passeggeri disabili come me né ai passeggeri normodotati.
Anzi: se si prova a chiedere informazioni si viene verbalmente aggrediti da dei pitbull vestiti da donna. I numeri di contatto non rispondono e le mail non ricevono risposta.
Io mi auguro che presto questa compagnia fallisca ed il servizio possa essere svolto da una azienda seria che si doti di Personale ben educato e competente.

items.title: Cheaper and faster to fly?
items.review_text:
Poorly organised and frantic service.

The appeal of travelling between the UK and Paris via train goes away once you realise the Eurostar requires you to queue for c.90-120 minutes (to get onto your train just in time!)

items.title: Eurostar who is always proud of that…
items.review_text: Eurostar who is always proud of that they don’t have weight limit for baggage; however, at Amsterdam station, the security checking table is at waist high, and they don’t care how big and how heavy your baggage is, they ask you to lift your baggage on your own to the table. Also the staff at security is very rude and cold. I’m a female solo traveler they asked me to lift my 30kg suitcase on my own, and said “this is your bag not mine”. If you don’t want to damage your body, AVIOD Eurostar at Amsterdam!!!!!

items.title: Money taken, no booking
items.review_text: I just booked train + hotel. Over £1000 has left my bank account, but the website displayed an error and I don't have a confirmation email. Customer service had limited opening hours and there is messaging all over their website basically saying they will probably be too busy to answer. They say they will respond to my email within 28 days. Feeling like I've been robbed and wishing I hadn't bothered!

items.title: Friendly service
items.review_text: Great and friendly service from the manager and the team on the 20.56 from Brussels to King Cross. Whilst the train was busy, they took the time to consider what customers' needed. This was much appreciated. Consequently I look forward to our next trip.

items.title: Euro star flexible tickets
items.review_text:
Poor customer service. My mother purchased flexible tickets but could not change the dates not via email, phone or website for over a week due to EURO STAR technical issues. 

I managed to contact them via Facebook. They then insisted on adding extra costs according to prices today and not according to the date of my mother's initial request for amendments. 

EURO STAR never answered my mother, only to me. I found it very discriminatory as their service should be accessible to all ages, especially for the elderly. Shame on you!

It seems like these technical issues are the perfect way to make money, and I found the way they handle it to be very unsettling.

items.title: been ILLEGALLY withholding my money!
items.review_text: Poor poor poor. Booked through this company around Sept last year (2021) to go away during new years. Trusted every step due to the company being well known and trustworthy. However trustworthy is the complete opposite of what they. Our trains got cancelled due to covid which we were then sent an email regarding claiming a “refund” or an “exchange”. That’s fine, processed the refund ‘we’ll get back in 3 months’. March came to be told we can’t have either!!! What kind of company can say that after promising refunds. Such crooks. Over £500 gone to a business which is ILLEGALLY withholding my money!!!!

items.title: Disrespectful service
items.review_text: Avoid if you can. I had a ticket for 14:13 and started queuing 90mins before departure, despite 45-50 advices on ticket. After more than 1h queuing NOBODY in Paris or by email or text told us what was happing, there were people there queuing for 12.13 train! Staff only spoke in French to passengers who started raising questions. Emailed IMPORTANT PERSON to complain about the NO service. The only thing they replied is that their policy is compensation. For 60’ delay. Not 55.THE COMPLAIN IS ABOUT NO SEVICE. And this policy explains why they left people in Paris still waiting to board and rushed to depart! Despite people running on platform.

items.title: Costumer service is complete 0
items.review_text: Costumer service is complete 0, I have no idea why the put a number to contact the costumer service when we have an issues. There is no way to get in touch with someone. Called more than 20 times. Word service I have ever seen. Will never ever use Eurostar again

items.title: Beroerde klantenservice.
items.review_text: Wekenlang was de heenreis van Rdam naar Londen €76,- per persoon. Toen ik wilde betalen kreeg ik 3 keer een foutmelding tot ik te lezen kreeg dat de laatste tickets voor die prijs nét door iemand anders geboekt waren en de nieuwe prijs was €91,50. Dit uiteindelijk maar geboekt, maar een uur later was dezelfde reis ineens weer €76,-. Hierover geprobeerd te bellen maar de wachtrij is standaard 25+ minuten, via Facebook duurt het dagen voor je een knip/plak antwoord krijgt en op de 2 webformulieren die ik heb ingevuld en verstuurd heb ik uberhaupt nooit reactie gekregen.

items.title: A fuir
items.review_text: Service client désastreux, injoignable que ce soit par mail ou par téléphone, aucune possibilité d'annulé le voyage sans avoir une petite compensation c'est une vraie honte !!!! A FUIR ABSOLUMENT

items.title: The worst customer service ever!
items.review_text: The worst customer service ever! Clearly advertises about flexible booking online but in reality -it's NOT flexible at all, as you can't even request a destination change, let alone requesting refund/ credit note.

items.title: Poor telephone waiting times
items.review_text:
Two hour wait time for customer service so would have been one star.

They were really helpful though, so bumped up to 3.

items.title: Appalling customer service
items.review_text: Like many other Eurostar travellers, I had a very poor experience.  The train from London was on time until it stopped just outside Paris Gare du Nord and apparently wouldn't restart.  The wait and delay was 90 minutes.  I was travelling across Europe so missed all my connections, eventually arriving at my destination four hours late. On my return I received an email offering me (modest) compensation for the delay. However, my registration for the compensation was not recognised.  I tried to call Eurostar but gave up after an hour of holding.  I sent three emails over the space of a month asking for support and an explanation.  I have received no response of any kind.  I love the principle of Eurostar - train travel to France and into Europe in a way which is far greener than flying.  But Eurostar has a monopoly which plainly permits it to offer absolutely no customer service.  A very frustrating and unsatisfactory experience.

items.title: Absolute terrible experience
items.review_text: Absolute terrible experience. Crazy long disorganized queues on both sides of the channel, but it was on the French side we really saw a new level of incompetence. None of the e gates were working but they still managed to feed people into the queues. 4 highly incompetent border control employees standing around doing absolutely nothing to solve the problem. We wondered if they had to call their union to check what was expected of them. I knew Eurostar were challenged in terms of service levels but this is a new low. We won’t be using Eurostar again, ever.

items.title: Very smooth rides and their customer…
items.review_text: Very smooth rides and their customer service is great if we need to rebook for any reason. I don't think we've ever seen a delay on their trains.

items.title: Terrible service
items.review_text:
Terrible service. Two hour delay on way out and delayed on return

Told to arrive on time and sit and wait for a train that was delayed

On return told train ready to board and left standing for 30 minutes when it did not arrive

You would be better and take less time if you walked

Never use this service

items.title: Take a plane
items.review_text: I’ve been taking the Eurostar for years while living in both Paris and then London, for both business and pleasure. This is one of the most unreliable services there is and they treat their customers abhorrently (whether you’re part of their ‘carte Blanche’/VIP program or not) - you’re better off taking a flight.

items.title: long queues and difficult for the…
items.review_text: long queues and difficult for the elderly and infirm, maybe they can put something in place for them

items.title: Mixed experience today
items.review_text:
Mixed experience today . Long Queues to be expected ..wearing a mask to be safe . Staff wearing masks kept us informed and moved the queue according to need . We got to the French Passport control queue to find ourselves being shouted by a member of staff not wearing a mask . Telling people to move down the queue . I made a verbal sign to him to wear a mask and to stop shouting. It’s a sure way of spreading COVID . OMG his reaction was to shout telling me I was being abusive . I had not raised my voice . 
Eurostar please give him a bit of training on how to stop the spread of COVID and a chill pill ..
All the rest of the experience was fine ..Felt safe and procedures seamless

items.title: Refund policy following the pandemic is ridiculous
items.review_text:
It’s good when everything goes smoothly BUT
My recent experience was rather bad. At the end of 2021, I was forced by Eurostar to utilise vouchers given as a substitute to a refund at the start of the pandemic. I had to make decision hastily and now I cannot go. Eurostar would not refund or issue vouchers - they only suggest to rebook without a compensation if future chosen tickets are cheaper but you have to pay on top if they are more expensive. How many times in real life and not their imagination can you rebook not loosing money - with high probability- zero. Poor customer service, Eurostar. 
Next time I will take a plane.

items.title: A drama
items.review_text: A drama, shows another failed EU project. Tickets very expensive. No service, not always direct. Avoid it, take the plane.

items.title: I have tried to book a trip today to…
items.review_text:
I have tried to book a trip today to Paris on the website 
I received no confirmation Email or booking ref no 
So I tried twice more still receiving no confirmation or booking Ref
I’ve just checked and found my money has been taken three times by Eurostar 

I still have no booking confirmation 
And they have over 2000 pounds extra of my money 

Not happy

Well it’s getting worse it’s now Monday after 25 mins trying waiting for a call taker I’ve now been transferred to a number that just keeps ringing. 
Still no confirmation Email or numbers a truly appalling company

Final update still truly awful experience but credit where credit is due after 2 hrs of waiting on calls I finally spoke to Sarah in train and hotel bookings, she was very professional and assures me my money has not been processed. I still don’t have a booking but at least I’m not out of pocket!!

items.title: Customer service does not exist!
items.review_text: This is the third time in a row that the passport gates are not working at @eurostar. Queues are over 1 hour even if you’re a carte blanche member. Trains are delayed as a result. What’s the point of having carte blanche if you can’t even use it to your benefit (including using the lounge as there is no time left given queue duration). Additionally, they have cut the customer service line - so if you can’t change your ticket online for whatever reason (which has happened to me twice already), they refer you to the customer service line (which is not working) and as such, you loose your money without having received the service. Surely this goes against consumer law.

items.title: Bought 'Cancellation & Personal…
items.review_text:
Bought 'Cancellation & Personal Possessions Insurance' for a return trip to Amsterdam and was told that doesn't actually allow cancellation.

It buys me the option of moving the dates of travel, and limits the cost of this move to just the excess AND admin fees.

This company is a vulture, will never be travelling with Eurostar ever again.

items.title: No innovation since the 1990s (or earlier!) juding by experience
items.review_text: Call queuing systems, which tell you how many other people there are in front of you on the customer service line for been a thing since the 1990s. And yet Eurostar don't use this. This gives an indication of how must value they actually put on the customer's experience (been waiting for 36 minutes so far...). And don't get me started on the lines of queues running up and down the station at St Pancras. Lazy operator with a fairly capative audience. Apparently mangement feels this means that this is no reason to improve.

items.title: Tried calling their customer service…
items.review_text: Tried calling their customer service line as there is a mistake on my booking but it is "currently closed due to technical issues". I'm faced with travelling to the station without being sure if I will be allowed on the train!

items.title: Awful company!
items.review_text: Awful company! They absolutely do not care about the customer experience. Damaged train caused over 1h delay in the first half of the trip and ended up leaving all passengers in Belgium, half way from Amsterdam to London. Technical issues do happen, but what followed was total disregard for passengers’ time and needs: they refused to wait for the passengers to join the next train from Belgium, and a group of 100+ people was left to their own luck, hoping to be able to join the last train of the night, which would leave over 2 hours later. The entire group ended up arriving in London over 4 hours later than originally planned. Very frustrating!

items.title: Terrible wait times and queuing for…
items.review_text: Terrible wait times and queuing for over 2 hours at st Pancras very badly managed its not a cheap option more expensive than flying and to be handled in such a shoddy fashion is unacceptable , experience on the train was pretty good to be fair

items.title: Train ok but wait is awful
items.review_text:
If I had known that I would have to stand in a queue for 2hrs to get on the teain I would have gone to Amsterdam another way, and will do so next time. Good trains, shocking operation.
Don't bother.
Judging by the reviews they don't care much anyway. Need to be replaced ASAP.

items.title: Very rude
items.review_text:
Very rude, argumentative and unhelpful check-in staff at  Eurostar St Pancras International station. I wrote to complain to Eurostar and three and a half weeks later I still have not had an acknowledgement let alone a reply.
They obviously do not care what the public think. I will not be using their services again.

items.title: Je prends régulièrement l'Eurostar pour…
items.review_text:
Je prends régulièrement l'Eurostar pour me rendre à Londres. J'apprécie la rapidité du voyage (2 h 15) et le fait d'arriver au cœur même de la capitale.
Il est régulièrement possible d'obtenir des billets à prix raisonnable (à partir de 44 euros le trajet).
L'application permet de changer les billets, de vérifier et modifier sa place.
Je trouve la gare de Saint-Pancras beaucoup plus adaptée que celle de Paris gare du Nord. Passage à la douane plus rapide, espace d'attente plus spacieux. 
Je n'ai rencontré aucun problème durant les confinements et restrictions. J'ai obtenu un e-voucher et pu modifier mes trajets sans souci.
Enfin, je me suis inscrite au club Eurostar qui me permet, notamment, d'obtenir des points et des réductions sur mes futurs voyages.

items.title: Le service client est en dessous de…
items.review_text: Le service client est en dessous de tout. J'ai acheté des voutchers que je n'arrivais pas a utiliser suite à un problème sur leur site. Bien sur, ils sont completement injoignable. J'ai perdu mes voutchers sans remboursement.

items.title: Harvey - Great Group Booking Service
items.review_text:
I booked a Eurostar and got great advice from Harvey... he took time to go through dates and was very attentive throughout the booking experience ensuring my group booking to Amsterdam was spot on. 

I then came to pay the balance, and forgot to add the booking reference, silly me! I called back and got through to Harvey again who added it to the booking and saved the day. Great service, shout out Harvey. Thank you!

items.title: Terrible - do not book
items.review_text:
Terrible - booked tickets last year via their website. Trip cancelled in Dec 2021 due to Covid border closures and given evouchers no refund. 
When challenging this, we were advised by Eurostar, they did not cancel the train and therefore vouchers are only available and this is, in their minds, beyond generous!! 

We spent £600+ on our tickets, we no longer need to reach that destination, in fact we can get to Europe a lot cheaper at the moment via plane when that option was not available at the time and the future dated Eurostar ticket costs are half the price we paid so we miss out all in all!! 

I’d love to know how an empty train is travelling to Europe with an expectation you can still travel and entered when borders are closed to U.K. citizens!! 

Eurostar have been unsympathetic, unhelpful and a nightmare to contact. 
I’ll be contacting the consumer ombudsman as I can’t see how they can get away with this sort of treatment and enforcement on people during difficult, uncontrollably circumstances!! 

My family, friends and I will never be booking with Eurostar again. 
Feel totally controlled and financial sharks 😡

items.title: Don't risk your money booking tickets.
items.review_text: We booked for return trip for April 2020. Cancelled due to covid. Had vouchers to use. initial expiry 2.4.21. Then extended to end 21. Then extended again to April 22 but couldn't use vouches as couldn't book online - dates not available - and no answer to phone.  after hours of unresponsive waits, cut off. filled in 2 proforma ' help' request over a month ago. No answer. Now not responding to anything. if you manage to get on a train , staff may be helpful, but no office in uk to visit, how can I get my money back ??

items.title: Je n’ai jamais eu de bon d’achats d’eurostar alors qu’il ont annulé d’eux même !
items.review_text: Bonsoir, je m’adresse à vous car Eurostar sont des arnaqueurs !!!!! J’ai réservé le 26 décembre jusqu’au 28 décembre, on m’as annulé mes billets suite au variant micron qu’il y’avait à Londres. Donc je n’ai pas pu partir, je n’ai jamais eu de bon d’achats de leur parts alors que c’est eux même qui ont décidé d’annuler. Et quand je les contactes, ils ne répondent ni au téléphone, ni par mail !! Inadmissible !!

items.title: Totaal lak aan slechte communicatie
items.review_text: Afgelopen vrijdag probeerde ik met mijn vader de trein naar London te pakken en stonden we voor een gesloten deur (met nog 20 man), ondanks dat we 25 minuten voor vertrek aankwamen.Helaas stond nergens in de mail duidelijk vermeld dat de poorten een half uur voor vertrek sluiten en je de trein niet meer inkomt. Tot onze afschuw zagen we vervolgens de reacties op internet dat dit continue gebeurt en Eurostar hier klaarblijkelijk totaal lak heeft. Er is dus 0.0 intentie om de communicatie in dit kader te verbeteren. Tot slot moet je, voor je de trein in kunt, langs een uitgebreide paspoort en baggage controle waardoor het in feite net een vliegveld is. Het hele idee dat het dus 'veel efficienter' is dan vliegen, klopt helaas echt niet!

items.title: Voyage Londres-Paris train numéro 9032…
items.review_text:
Voyage Londres-Paris train numéro 9032 départ à 14h31-17h59 

Je suis très déçue du personnel, spécifiquement la dame anglaise qui parle français..Aucun respect des passagers, la dame parle tellement fort et ne respecte pas la tranquillité des passagers, repas servis de travers..Bref, très déçue

items.title: It's not what they're doing .....we've…
items.review_text: It's not what they're doing .....we've all been at the sharp end of their totally non-existent customer service....its how in the name of God are they getting away with it  !!!! Is there no accountability for these large companies....where is the Ombudsman  ????

items.title: loved it!
items.review_text: amazing experience from the beginning to the end last week-end when travelling to Paris. the staff has been so caring and helpful and be able to arrive in your destination right in the city center is a definite plus, no custom at arrival either made the overall journey fast and relaxing.

items.title: I would not wish Eurostar on my worst…
items.review_text:
I would not wish Eurostar on my worst enemy. Customer experience is completely alien to them. website doesnt work, app doesnt work. They dont answer the phones. Only book with eurostar if you are a masochist.

I have now been trying to call their customer service for 3 hours. They either hang up, the line says busy, or it takes your 3/4 of the way and then ends your call. I do not believe they have a customer service department.

items.title: Très mauvais service après vente
items.review_text: J'ai une réservation pour un combiné Eurostar Hôtel à Londres. Je suis blessé et je voudrais reporter ce voyage. Comment faire ??? Impossible au téléphone, longue attente puis Eurostar coupe la communication !!! Et sur le site Eurostar.com, on me dit de téléphoner à Eurostar... 😌 Pas sérieux, malhonnête, à éviter ! Je vais finalement devoir faire ce voyage, à regret sinon je perdais mes 630 euros !

items.title: Dogsh#t does not begin to describe…
items.review_text:
Dogs hit does not begin to describe this company.
You can't even speak to them. Nobody answers the phone!

items.title: Eurostar has given up, unfortunately
items.review_text: Eurostar is great, in theory but not in practice because Covid has torpedoed it - the company is apparently losing £500 million a year, or £1k every minute of every day. They've coped with that by slashing the timetable and basically shutting down their customer service department. But now things are opening up they seemed locked in a spiral of decline. They desperately need more passengers yet they are actively alienating them - e.g. by shutting down their phone lines. That seems like an odd strategy for corporate survival.

items.title: Not possible to contact by phone.
items.review_text: Not possible to contact by phone.

items.title: No refund for train cancelled by them
items.review_text: I had a train to Paris cancelled by Eurostar in December. I requested a refund then and have heard nothing back. I can’t get hold of anyone from any department and it seems increasingly like Eurostar have stolen my money.

items.title: A éviter, frauduleux
items.review_text:
J'ai acheté des billets récemment, en cliquant sur le lien rien n'apparaît, impossible d'obtenir mes billets. Je tappe mon numéro de réservation ainsi que mon nom de famille, le serveur me dit que mon billet n'existe pas. Impossible de contacter le service client et leur page d'information ne fonctionne pas... 
Cette société est un désastre absolu, j'ai très rarement vu un service aussi déplorable. La honte de la France.
Je voyage régulièrement à Paris pour des raisons professionnelles, il est grand temps de prendre l'avion.

items.title: No customer service to speak of
items.review_text: No customer service to speak of.  They make you listen to a long recorded message, Tell you how 'unprecedented' their waiting times are even though it's been like this for over a year.  Disgusting appalling behaviour.  I really well never travel with them again.

items.title: Unable to cancel or postpone a…
items.review_text:
Unable to cancel or postpone a train/hotel package on the website/app as it says to contact the travel agent used to book the trip, but this was booked directly with Eurostar!! The insurance ‘cancellation’ policy, taken out at the time of booking, is apparently not valid as the trip is changeable according to the insurance company, but we can’t change it via web as it is a package and not in fact flexible or changeable and we cannot get through to anyone at Eurostar despite endless efforts on phone/email.

I have been trying to cancel for over a month now and the trip is scheduled for Thursday. I fear we will lose all costs. 
I do not understand how a company cannot respond to a customer query for so long.

items.title: Slechtste communicatie ooit over de check-in deadline
items.review_text:
Levensgroot en dikgedrukt communiceert NS International en Eurostar de vertrektijd van de trein, en in kleine lettertjes buiten de layout van de reisplannen staat dat de check-in 30 minuten van te voren definitief SLUIT.
Elke dag staat dan ook 10% van de reizigers buiten en mogen niet mee... Wat een slechte communicatie, wat een achterhaalde marketing, wat een flut-service... En dan presenteert zich dan als een alternatief voor vliegen?!
Super duur en super onduidelijk. Verschrikking.

items.title: Customer service, where are you?
items.review_text:
Customer service does not exist. Something needs to happen here, this is simply unacceptable. Over the space of five days, I have tried calling the helpline a grand total of 18 times. Either they acknowledge they are too busy and end the call, or I go through minutes of painful audio about Coronavirus measures, only for the call to cut out after selecting my menu options. Helplines are open only 8h-17h, Mo-Fri, so calling early or late to avoid busy times is not possible. 

I only want to make a simple timetable/service enquiry, God forbid if I actually had to call them about an urgent issue regarding an upcoming journey, I would be tearing my hair out. Actually, the fact that there isn't a fixed timetable and "extra train times are sometimes added to our timetable at short notice due to increased demand for tickets" is ridiculous in itself, and no way to operate international rail travel.

items.title: Unacceptable and non existent customer…
items.review_text:
Unacceptable and non existent customer service. 

I have had a simple question for Eurostar about coming back from a different station. I have rung them several times but they say too busy to even put you in a queue. I have sent a message 2 months ago - they have sent an email a 2-3 weeks ago asking if I still have a question to tick the 'yes' box. I have still had no response. The on line bot is hopeless. This company should be taken over by a company that can have a customer service.

items.title: Terrible experience
items.review_text:
Terrible experience , I am still shocked how the website is still operational. I booked a train and hotel from there. The booking page has frozen after the payment was completed. No booking confirmation , no email nothing. A pending transaction of the sum is now shown on my bank statement. Tried to call on multiple number including their french and Belgium numbers after losing hope with the UK one , the standard response is to try later or simply the line to cut. The standard excuse Covid-19. 
I do not know if my booking went through or if the sum will be collected and can not book else where because the ticket is not refundable. I'm stuck.

items.title: Dreadful! - Avoid and take a plane instead!
items.review_text:
Eurostar were good enough to extend the period of validity of my voucher due to Covid, but trying to actually book a holiday using my voucher is proving to be impossible! 

I cant sign into my account because the website tool which sends you a link when you've forgotten password doesn't work. 

I tried booking as a guest but the website doesn't recognise my voucher number which they say should have either 9 or 16 digits, however my voucher has two groups of 7 digits??

I tried using their Bot facility but it was useless, the very worst I've ever experienced.  

Finally, I tried to phone their customer services, only to be greeted by a message telling me that they are too busy to speak to me........... 

Utter and complete rubbish.

items.title: Alt for langsom kundeservice
items.review_text: Var over to måneder om at svare på en mail om refundering af voucher - men da jeg henvendte mig om noget andet, kunne jeg få svar samme dag. Bruger derudover "Hvis det koster mere, skal du betale prisdifferencen, men hvis mindre får du intet retur"-metoden. Kom dog trodsalt fra London til Paris på under 2½ time, men jeg er samlet set utilfreds med Eurostar!

items.title: No free water refills. Buy single use plastic instead!
items.review_text:
Horrified to discover that you can’t get a free water refill at the cafe onboard. 

Forget minimising single-use plastic consumption. It’s all about the profit!

Genuinely appalling in this day & age.

items.title: LEFT STRANDED IN A DIFFERENT COUNTRY AND NO REFUND! AVOID IF POSSIBLE!
items.review_text:
I boarded a eurostar train from London to Amsterdam, during the journey the passengers were informed that the train would no longer be stopping at Amsterdam but that we could take a connecting train free of charge from Brussels. Getting off the train in Brussels there were no Eurostar staff to be seen and no further instruction on how to get get a connecting train. After a while it became clear that there were no connecting trains and that we were stranded in Belgium. 

Eurostar refused to refund my ticket and compensate me for my overnight hotel room AND even to acknowledge that they had done anything wrong. 

Truly a terrible experience. I will not use their services again.

items.title: No customer service
items.review_text:
No customer service 

Tried to call customer service to add child ticket to an existing ticket which is not possible online. The offices in Kings Cross still closed due to Covid. So there is no way for me to deal with this issue. 

The damage they do how this is handled is unbelievable. I love trains and love to support the journey however this is without words.

items.title: Pathetic…do not trust them
items.review_text: Pathetic…do not trust them. They ignore emails & phone calls. Just interested in taking your money. Will never travel on Eurostar again.

items.title: Slechte service die ik ken
items.review_text: Slechte service die ik ken, bij omboeken halen ze gewoon 260€ van je visa zonder duidelijke vermelding als je belt nemen ze niet op, op mails reageren ze niet en als je ze dan na 20 keer proberen aan de lijn krijgt is het je eigen schuld. Echt een corrupte organistie

items.title: Service déplorable :
items.review_text:
Service déplorable :
- contact en ligne infructueux, je n'ai même pas reçu de confirmation de réception de ma demande d'assistance
- contact par téléphone infructueux, cela fait 50 minutes que j'attends qu'on me réponde
Eurostar se fo** vraiment de la gue*** de son client, je n'ai jamais vu de service client mépriser autant son client.
Tant pis pour vous et pour la planète, je prendrai l'avion et m'emploierai à réitérer régulièrement les mauvaises critiques à votre égard

items.title: Eurostar is nooit bereikbaar
items.review_text:
Klantendienst Eurostar is DE slechte die ik ken, antwoorden niet op mail en telefonisch zijn ze niet bereikbaar in de eigen landstaal. Wachttijd +/- 25 min maar na enige tijd wordt de lijn gewoon afgesloten.
Ook geen reactie FB of Messenger.

items.title: Silence
items.review_text:
I had a complaint about Eurostar vouchers not being honoured in October.  I wrote immediately complaining and received an acknowledgment.  Further letters resulted in 2 more acknowledgments but now at the end of February no considered reply and no action. Customer Service is a misnomer.

ALERT My money has now been repaid. The moral is that you have to be very very patient.

items.title: Tried to phone and sent numerous…
items.review_text:
Tried to phone and sent numerous emails. Not a single reply. Paid over £300 for my trip and I can't travel due to covid restrictions. I couldn't even call them to Cancel as the automated message says "call back later". Tried for 3 weeks and its the same message.
Absolutely shocking customer service. I will never travel by Eurostar again.

items.title: Non existent customer service
items.review_text: Non existent customer service. Called and called for 2 weeks and couldn’t get in touch with anyone. They took my money and made off with it

items.title: Unexistent customer service and proper…
items.review_text: Unexistent customer service and proper stealers. They have my money and have been procrastinating giving me my refund since 2020. I've lost count of how many hours I wasted trying to get my money back. Scammers.

items.title: Big joke
items.review_text: Trying to get a refund is impossible. Customer service keeps ignoring you.

items.title: Horrendous company
items.review_text:
Horrendous company. 

I booked to go to Italy from the UK (via France) months before Christmas 2021, but as the time approached, found that I could not travel because the French government had closed its borders to the UK. I tried on several occasions to cancel my train ticket since travel was impossible through no fault of my own. The Italian and French train companies allowed me to cancel. Eurostar ignored all requests to cancel and didn't allow me to do so on their website. They have never replied and I still do not have my refund. I am now in the process of making a formal complaint to the regulator since my complaint to Eurostar has not been answered. 

That they own this monopoly is bad enough, but that they take advantage of people like this is the worst part.

items.title: Its impossible to speak to someone over…
items.review_text: Its impossible to speak to someone over the phone..it goes through 10mins of recorded info and then cuts you off..awful customer service

items.title: Schandelijk!
items.review_text: Mensen, boek never nooit bij Eurostar. Onze tickets van 18 april zijn geannuleerd door Eurostar zagen we per ongeluk in de app. Geen mail, helemaal niets. Ondanks dat er gezegd wordt dat je recht heb op teruggave kunnen we alleen omboeken. We willen geen andere datum, we willen gewoon ons geld terug. Wat een ontzettende k...maatschappij, schande!!! Neem maar gewoon het vliegtuig!

items.title: Customer service Eurostar beneden alle peil
items.review_text: Eurostar laat weten dat door mij geboekte trein niet rijdt. Dat ik een refund aan kan vragen en dat die binnen 28 dagen (!) verwerkt wordt. We zijn nu 5 weken verder. Eurostar is telefonisch onbereikbaar, op mails wordt niet gereageerd en betaling is niet terug gestort. Service niveau is beneden alle peil.

items.title: 2 jaar geleden treintickets naar Londen…
items.review_text: 2 jaar geleden treintickets naar Londen gekocht. Door covid kon dit niet doorgaan. Meerdere mails gestuurd met verzoek de geldigheidsduur van de voucher te verlengen. Nooit antwoord gekregen. Telefonisch wordt de verbinding steeds verbroken.

items.title: Slechtste ervaring ooit
items.review_text: Slechtste ervaring ooit! Niemand weet wat ie moet doen en kunnen nergens mee helpen. Alles geregeld en konden toch niet trein instappen omdat we geen test hadden geboekt voor dag 8 terwijl we maar 2 dagen daar zouden zijn!!! SCHANDALIG en waardeloze personeel!!

items.title: Unimpressed
items.review_text: We booked a weekend break with Eurostar thinking that if we booked the train + hotel we'd have better protections, but it turned out that it's actually a worse deal because even if you choose to cancel/change your train, your hotel isn't linked. Whilst the actual experience of the train was very nice, we found that in the lead up to our trip they changed our train times a couple of times, and then on our last night in Paris they cancelled our train (booked for first thing the next morning) with absolutely no new train or information on what to do. We ended up spending our last night trying to talk to Eurostar staff at the train station, who were friendly, but just told us that all we could do was turn up the next day and wait to get on the next available train, which didn't feel like a very secure option. We did manage to get the train back, but we just felt like it was generally chaotic. We returned many hours after our original booking, and we filled in their compensation form and months later we still haven't had a response. Plus, we booked our covid travel tests through their recommended retailers because they said we'd get a discount for being Eurostar customers, but it turns out you just pay the standard price. Generally unimpressed.

items.title: Non-existent customer service. Shame.
items.review_text: Non-existent customer service over the last two years. Apart from one fantastic women in the UK team, the rest is shocking. No phone support now. No human web chat. And you can only change once a ticket purchased with points. Not exactly a reward. Will start to fly from now on, sadly, unless someone changes how this company is managed.

items.title: Je suis très en colère car après avoir demandé l'annulation d'un billet remboursable, Eurostar fait le MORT. Aucune réponse.…
items.review_text: Je suis très en colère car après avoir envoyé un message pour annuler un voyage remboursable, Eurostar se paie le culot de me demander si mon voyage s'est bien passé ( voyage annulé par message via leur site plus de 48h avant le départ)...Aucun accusé de réception, aucune trace de mon annulation car c'est via leur formulaire... et je n'ai pas obtenu de rembousement: ce sont des VOLEURS! J'en suis à ma deuxième relance et n'ai toujours pas de réponse! C'est une HONTE.

items.title: Ripoff prices compared with airlines
items.review_text: Ripoff prices compared with airlines and they don’t accept dogs but you can travel all over Europe and uk with your pets just not on Eurostar… waiting for the time they go bust

items.title: Cancellation and horribly cramped journey.
items.review_text: My original train was cancelled and there were no later alternative trains that day which meant I had to change my incoming flight to catch the earlier train. This was overcrowded. It took an hour to get through immigration. My seat was open to just a third of a window and was as cramped as an airline economy seat. One does not expect this on a train. It was just horrible! It’s high time there was some competition for Eurostar. For a longer but much more pleasant travel experience go by SNCF and catch a ferry.

items.title: De klantenservice is zo beroerd dat de…
items.review_text: De klantenservice is zo beroerd dat de tranen je in de eigen springen. Ik krijg heimwee naar de DDR.

items.title: On the 23 of December 2021 I discovered…
items.review_text: On the 23 of December 2021 I discovered the following problems: As I was queuing to obtain information relating to my Eurostar ticket when I was treated with disrespect and a negative attitude by the Eurostar member of staff. At the given moment, I ask for clarification on travel matters the the Eurostar staff member is unable to respond to my questions while not caring about what I have to say. This person feels uncomfortable when I politely insist that I’m untitled to a service with skill and care as a consumer. He then calls his manager. The manager says the following statement without me provoking him when all the questions were reasonable and relevant: “We are not here to listen” very rudely

items.title: Would be minus 5 if there was an…
items.review_text: Would be minus 5 if there was an option.. Trying to sort out a booking nightmare caused by Eurostar.. Finally sorted after major stress and deleted coupons being finally admitted to after showing them screenshot, won't answer phone and I had to wait 28 days for each reply via email.. NOT LOOKING FORWARD TO THE TRIP TO PARIS NOW WITH MY WIFE.. WHO KNOWS WHAT'S NEXT.. after reading the other reviews !

items.title: Trains cancelled three times in a row
items.review_text:
Trains cancelled three times in a row, I get it given COVID.

But to not offer the tools for customers to manage their reservation (cannot change tickets online, 8 minute intro message on contact centre only to be told it is not operating "due to technical difficulties" - same issue as when my train was cancelled in December). Contact via their webpage gives me a thank you page with copyright still dated 2018. 

Shocking and sad monopoly from this company that I have always valued.

items.title: Refusal of monetary refund despite passenger rights
items.review_text:
Trains cancelled because of Covid.

I wasn't offered a refund, as would have been my right, but only vouchers with an expiry date.

I now contacted Eurostar again and was again not given the refund I was due then and am still due, but again just vouchers with an extended expiry date.

I've now tried to use these in a booking - even changing my own travel plans in order not to waste the vouchers - and they aren't accepted for trips from Germany to the UK!

Eurostar reference for the most recent contact was 07047818.

items.title: Beide treinen geannuleerd zonder bericht!
items.review_text: Op de heenweg wilden we opstappen in Brussel en daar kregen we pas te horen dat de trein geannuleerd was. Bijna een dag later konden we pas een andere trein nemen. Op de terugweg hetzelfde verhaal, maar gelukkig hebben wij zelf vooraf gevraagd of de trein nog zou vertrekken. Geen enkel bericht terug op onze klachten; geen enkele compensatie!!

items.title: Eurostar: waardeloos!
items.review_text: We hebben voor mei 2020 bij Eurostar 2 retours Rotterdam - Londen gekocht voor 160 euro. Wegens corona annuleerde Eurostar de reis. We kregen 4 vouchures, geldig tot 31 december 2021. Eurostar gaf geen enkele waarschuwing dat de vouchures zouden verlopen. Het verzetten van de reis zou 40 euro extra kosten per enkele reis plus het eventuele prijsverschil. Dus de vouchures zijn waardeloos. Ik heb mijn geld teruggevraagd. Geen enkele reactie. Schandalig. Frank den Herder

items.title: 4 months of waiting for a new voucher
items.review_text:
My updated rating and comments because I received a new voucher beginning of March with the following answer: Thank your for contacting us and I'm sorry for the delay in our response. We have sent you over an e-voucher with a value of £... which will expire in (...). We look forward to seeing you again soon. Please do not hesitate to get in contact if you have any further enquiries.

My previous comments (rating 1):
I have never used Eurostar before but booked a ticket in Sept 2020. Due to restrictions at that time, Eurostar gave a voucher to be used before 31rst Dec 2021. I booked my ticket for beginning of Dec (for which I paid an extra) but with new travel restrictions again in place, once more, I couldn't travel. I tried to contact Eurostar over the phone every day for more that 7 days and never got hold onto someone from their customer service. I also tried several time a day for more that 7 days to postpone my ticket but every single time, I couldn't pay the extra price for a new ticket. At the end, before my supposed travel date (10th Dec), I sent an email to Eurostar asking not for a refund but for a new voucher. Shockingly, I received this answer on the 16th Dec (3 days after my supposed return from France):
 "Dear Customer,
Thank you for contacting us and our sincere apologies for the delay in getting back to you. We have seen an influx of contacts coming our way which has impacted our response times.
We’re getting in touch as we see that you contacted us regarding a reservation for which the travel date has now passed. We hope that you had a pleasant journey and apologise that we have not been able to get back to you in time.
Please do let us know if further assistance is required by clicking the button below. There is no need to resubmit your question as your existing case will be passed on to one of our team who will gladly assist you further."

Shame on Eurostar!!! They have NO customer service and they are mocking their clients. Obviously, I pressed the button and am still waiting for a proper answer on their incompetence.

items.title: Worst customer service and buggy website
items.review_text:
Absolutely horrendous customer service. The website never works without bugs, the customer service line is never available, and it's a new bad experience each time. For example, this time they cancelled my journey and suggested a refund – not it's weeks without any confirmation of the refund. When you call them you have to listen to literally 6 minutes of useless robot information, and then the call hangs up! And there's nothing you can do to get through. Infuriating. Infuriating each and every time. And they KNOW it, otherwise they wouldn't put 6 minutes of information without a way to skip. 

Oh, and prevously when I had an issue b/c of their website not working properly and double-charging two bookings instead of one, I had to wait 45 minutes on the line to get that resolved. They tell you they are very busy due to covid, but guess what you could avoid a lot of these customer calls just by making your website work properly – which hasn't improved in months and still buggy every time. Folks, here's a tip, it's 2021 and your website is THE face of your brand, not the train rides themselves! We're gonna take the trains anyways due to you being the only train service between countries, but your website is what makes the difference between 1 and 5 star experience.

items.title: 0 customer service
items.review_text:
Customer service absent: I have a still pending request. After 4 weeks I get the following response: 

"We can see that more than 21 days has passed since you first e-mailed us. Please let us know if you still require our assistance by clicking the button below"

This is 3 weeks ago, still nothing. Can't call them, can't contact them anywhere. Only thing is a bot on their website that doesn't response. 

@eurostar: it shouldn't be hard. It probably takes 5 min to fix my request....

items.title: Finger weg! Abzocke!
items.review_text:
Finger weg! Hier wird man abgezockt, man hat einen unterirdisch schlechten Service und bekommt sein Geld nicht zurück, auch nicht in pandemischer Lage!

Besonders ärgerlich ist, dass jegliche Kommunikation unterbunden wird, indem man ausschließlich über Formulare auf der Website sein Anliegen mehr schlecht als recht hervorbringen kann. Da wir unsere Reise aufgrund von Corona und entsprechendem Lockdown nicht antreten durften, wurden wir mit einem zeitlich limitierten Voucher abgespeist, der nun, nach einer Verlängerung, am 30.12.2021 endete. Vielen Dank dafür!
Aufgrund der aktuell bescheidenen Corona-Lage fühlten wir uns sehr unter Druck gesetzt durch den Ablauf der Frist und haben letztlich auf eine Buchung ins Ungewisse hinein verzichtet. Ich kann nur abraten von einer Buchung bei diesem Unternehmen. Man wird einfach nur vertröstet und abgezockt!
UNTERSTE Schublade.

items.title: Disappointing in every aspect
items.review_text: The outlines in covid times for travelling to different countries were unclear and confusing on the website. I booked a train and found out the change in rules too late (yes my fault, I shouldn't have blindly trusted the website) however, I was not eligible for a refund (which I can understand) but asked if I wanted to reschedule the trip in order to not lose all the money I spent. The cost to reschedule the train was more expensive than the ticket itself! Which I think is ridiculous and extortionate. Not only that, but I was told to wait for over an hour at 7am just to be told why I was not allowed to travel ,even though it was just a lack of one form which I already understood. I was not told anything and was stuck sat in a small chair alone next to boarder control while being upset at the fact that I could not be able to see my family I was travelling to see. The point of the Eurostar was to create a more Eco-friendly, fast, convenient and accessible way to travel from the UK to France and I think that it has failed in every way here as the only reason I wanted to travel by train was to be more Eco-conscious. The service is appalling and changed need to be made

items.title: Customer service is unbelievably bad
items.review_text: Customer service is unbelievably bad. Eurostar cancelled my trains and over a month later have still not even responded to my request for a refund. Tried to call and after 5 minutes of pointless travel info on a paid line, I am automatically cut off when trying to connect.

items.title: Prompt and without fuss.
items.review_text:
We had a trip to Brussels over New Year. The day before we were due to return to the UK we got an email from Eurostar cancelling our early morning train from Brussels-Midi due to operational difficulties. We rebooked on a later train that day without any difficulty but our onward travel tickets from Kings Cross to Leeds ( which we paid £25 for) were no longer valid and our new connection tickets were £165.
We claimed the difference from Eurostar and they re-imbursed us, without fuss, within 2 working days.
Because of their prompt and professional action they have retained our custom. When things go wrong it is how they are put right that is a true measure of a company. Thank you Eurostar.

items.title: I wish i could give 0 stars.
items.review_text: I wish i could give 0 stars.. the service is crap. Customer service is crap.. staff are rude.. phone lines closed for 2 months since october 2021 until now january 2021.. agent at the gate had a sarcastic attitude and told us he cannot do anything for us and dont know the time we arrived but want to book us for the following day.. had 20 people who missed the train to paris from london and agents want to be rude to us.. no one answers emails since october 2021!!! Full crap

items.title: Just received an email saying my train…
items.review_text: Just received an email saying my train has been cancelled for my tomorrow’s journey. I am not able to contact your staff (waiting 6 minutes on the call to listen to all Covid regulations and once I select I want to speak to an agent you end the call? Seriously?) what am I supposed to do now? I have a hotel booked through your website and I have no option to get a refund or reschedule. Is anyone responding to all these reviews? How can we get in touch with you?

items.title: Un-contactable and no way to get refund for cancelled train and UK restrictions
items.review_text:
Absolutely horrified of the way Eurostar have chosen to handle the UK-France covid restrictions and refunds cancelling of trains. 

My train to return was cancelled and I was only offered option to change dates.

Appreciate they are probably receiving alot of contacts at the mo. But instead of making it easy to get a refund through their website (as is a customer right under their T&Cs), they have made it impossible to do anything. No response by email after several attempts. No response on Twitter. Contact number does not work. I even begrudgingly went onto the website to move the dates only to find there were no available dates in August and September. It's ridiculous. 

I am now just 2 weeks from the planned trip (which can't happen anyway under restrictions) and nervous that I will get no refund.

Sort it out Eurostar. This is criminal!

items.title: De la pure arnaque cette compagnie.
items.review_text:
De la pure arnaque cette compagnie.
Ils ont annulé notre train, on demande un remboursement mais ces voleurs nous donnent leurs misérables de Voucher.
Pourquoi Eurostar ne veut pas rembourser comme toutes les compagnies de transport sérieuses ? 
Plus jamais, je ne passerai par vous pour mes prochains voyages.

items.title: Finger weg!
items.review_text:
Aus ökologischen Gründen wollte ich mit meiner Familie mit dem Zug nach England. Daher habe zwei Reisen (jeweils Hin- und Rückfahrt) für meine Familie gebucht. 
1. Schon die Buchung ist eine Zumutung. Die Uhrzeiten werden nicht in den entsprechenden Zeitzonen angegeben, so dass man nicht weiß, zu welcher Zeit man ankommt, um dann den entsprechenden Anschlusszug zu buchen. 
2. Aufgrund von Covid konnte ich die erste Reise nicht antreten, daher bekam ich einen E-Voucher. Auch hier nur Probleme: die Kommunikation erfolgt nur über die Homepage. Man bekommt keine Mail mit seiner Anfrage. Damit kann sich Eurostar rausreden, dass sie keine Anfrage erhalten hätten. 
3. Für die zweite Reise habe ich die Voucher dann eingesetzt, jedoch musste ich auch diese wieder verschieben. Nun bestand ich auf die Erstattung, um die ich immer noch kämpfe. 

Daher: Finger weg. Auch wenn es aus ökologischen Gründen wirklich das Beste wäre. Aber so nicht.

items.title: E-Voucher Con
items.review_text: Due to Covid I was unable to travel in May 2020 and so was given a voucher which I could use to book a trip up to 5 November 2022. The only problem with this is that every trip now is significantly more expensive than the original trip I booked and I will have significantly less time on the day-trip I originally planned. So I will have to pay over double the original price for half the time! I understand that Covid has impacted everyone but this is not the service/product I originally paid for! So now I will lose my money, as I won't be using the voucher, and will never use Eurostar again!

items.title: Eurostar cancelled travel, refused a refund and forced me to take voucher.
items.review_text: Due to Covid Eurostar cancelled travel and I was forced to take a voucher as they refused to give me a refund. I have been promised I can use this voucher on travel up to 11 months prior but the dates within that period that I might actually want to book on I am not able to as train times aren't yet confirmed. I am therefore left with a voucher that I can not use but at risk of losing the money if I don't use it. I try and call Eurostar and get an automated message to say they have an un-precendented number of calls and long wait times and tell me I can not wait to connect but to try again later, so I am not even able to attempt to get hold of someone on the phone to speak with them.

items.title: Ga de volgende keer wel met het vliegtuig
items.review_text:
Groot monopolistisch bedrijf die schijt heeft aan klanten. Heb een reis geboekt. Uiteindelijk willen annuleren. Meerdere keren gebeld, altijd opgehangen en nooit een Nederlandse medewerker die je te woord kan staan.
Vervolgens gemaild en ook daar geen reactie op gezien. 2 dagen voor mijn kreeg ik de mogelijkheid om een voucher te krijgen d.m.v. het invullen van het formulier. Dit leek mij dan toch wel een goed idee maar iedere keer als ik dit formulier in wilde vullen werkte het niet. 
Ga de volgende keer wel met het vliegtuig.

items.title: Slechtste klantenservice ooit
items.review_text: Slechtste klantenservice ooit! Na 6 maanden een voucher ontvangen, die niet werkt. Reis niet via Eurostar!!!

items.title: Terrible customer service
items.review_text: Great station (St P) but the worst customer service online and on the phone for making and changing bookings. Can they pls fire management and IT and hire staff from an airline. It is worse than the Eurotunnel 10 yrs ago,  and that is an achievement…..

items.title: Voucher is niet in te wisselen
items.review_text: Na een jaar lang mailen kreeg ik eindelijk een voucher van Eurostar voor mijn trein-hotel-boeking. Die loopt op 30 december af, dus probeer ik nu de voucher te verzilveren, maar de website accepteert de code niet. De 'klantenservice' is gesloten en doet op de website de oproep om vooral niet te bellen. Op een mail krijg is het antwoord dat ze ernaar streven binnen 28(!) dagen te antwoorden. Ja duh, dan is mijn voucher dus verlopen, weg 374 euro! Wat een waardeloze club is dat Eurostar! Boek er vooral geen treinreis, je ben gegarandeerd te geld kwijt.

items.title: Amazing service from Dorette and her team at St Pancras
items.review_text: My 85 year old father was heading back to France after spending the Christmas festivities in London with me. I unfortunately had not realised he needed a PLF, creating panic for him at the immigration check. Thankfully the Station Chief - Dorette- and her team were amazing to help me send the requested document to them, and get Dad on board with only 30 sec to spare! 🙏 Thank you for an AMAZING service without which he would never have made it . Much appreciated. Sylvie Pickavance

items.title: Never again!
items.review_text:
Even one star doesn‘t describe how bad the customer service at Eurostar is. Absolutely no one available, waiting times around an hour and until you even get through you have to dail the number multiple times. 
I would say there are too many people in „home office“ or just not enough people to deal with the matters people have. The train doesn’t take dogs, so everyone who has a pet must find another way than Eurostar. Never again will I book over this train company. There are definately easier ways to travel to England than with Eurostar. What a mess.

items.title: Trains jamais à l'heure
items.review_text: Trains jamais à l'heure, des trains qui s'annulent et le client est prévenu au dernier moment, organisation catastrophique à la gare de Londres, sans compter des tarifs très élevés... Même si ce n'est pas écolo, prenez l'avion et fuyez les à tout prix

items.title: Eurostar à bannir
items.review_text:
Comme de nombreux voyageurs, nous avons reçu  des vounchers inutilisables suite au premier confinement. Avec les vagues Covid19 qui se succèdent, nous ne voulons pas de voucher mais d'un remboursement comme la plupart des compagnies aériennes ont pu pratiquer, et il est évidemment bien impossible de les joindre. 
Compagnie à éviter absolument, prendre le bateau ou l'avion. Eurostar devrait être renommée, la compagnie porte bien mal son nom...

items.title: Outrageously poor service. Should be closed down
items.review_text: Trying for 4 days to claim voucher for later date. I have tweeted, tried the website (get stuck on submit button), tried on line help - no response, tried calling - no answer or get cut off. Absolutely disgusting and appalling service. £1200 for a family of four. NEVER EVER USE EUROSTAR. The worst service I have ever received.

items.title: Unable to travel Lon to Paris as UK…
items.review_text: Unable to travel Lon to Paris as UK resident wishing to spend Xmas with relatives not being allowed. Refunds not allowed. Online forms to get an evoucher or to rebook not working. Stuck on the submit button..£230 gone down the drain. Thanks for nothing guys. (by the way both UK rail and SNCF gave full refunds... It's just eurostar ripping people off.) Never again, I'll fly.

items.title: Niemand bereikbaar?! HELP!
items.review_text: Niemand bereikbaar, zowel telefonisch (wordt opgehangen zodra je een keuze maakt in het menu) als per mail (wacht nu al 4 weken op een reactie) en mijn e-voucher verloopt binnenkort. Weg 247 euro!

items.title: Voyageur fréquent qui apprécie la…
items.review_text: Voyageur fréquent qui apprécie la simplicité de prendre un train vs un vol. Meilleure moyen de se déplacer entre le centre de Londres et de Paris - certes les prix peuvent être exagérés.

items.title: Eurostar - where your money is stolen
items.review_text: Zero stars if that was an option. Was due to travel next Wednesday to France but cannot due to travel restrictions for COVID. Received an email from Eurostar saying booking can be changed but when you retrieve your booking there is no option to change. I booked a hotel + train package and have filled in the online form to ask what happens to the hotel booking. Paid £700 to lose it completely. Tried calling, you just get cut off. Beware also of the insurance sold on the site. It is misleading and says it includes cancellation due to COVID. The policy only covers COVID specific to you and not when you can no longer travel because you won’t be allowed into a country. Misleading and dishonest! Basically, the Eurostar packages are robbery - just conning people out of money. Appalling.

items.title: Le service qui se moque du client
items.review_text:
Je paye un billet au prix fort (230 euros aller retour) puis change les dates pour une période à laquelle ils valent moitié moins : Eurostar fait le changement, sans frais mais sans aucune compensation alors que je paye environ 130 euros de plus...

Coup de fil au service client : la chargée clientèle se moque ouvertement et se débarrasse de moi en me conseillant, sur le ton de la bonne copine, de changer à nouveau la date pour me faire rembourser la différence, ce qui est impossible chez Eurostar.

Très désagréable impression de me faire plumer puis qu'on me prend pour un idiot.

items.title: Dialogo impossibile
items.review_text: Per colpa del Covid non ho potuto partire ma trainline non rimborsa nulla e dice di vedere con Eurostar per un viaggio Parigi Londra e Eurostar dice di vedere con trainline … insomma soldi persi e non è il primo viaggio catastrofico con loro ! Mai mai mai più !!! Riservazione 4KCPFN

items.title: DISGUSTING SERVICE - DO NOT USE EUROSTAR
items.review_text: Phone lines are closed, not answering emails. We are due to travel to Brussells next Thursday from the UK and your phone lines have been closed down for 2 weeks. Your website states that we can change our booking but need to call you but how can we if your line cuts us off?!?! Absolutely disgusting service. No care whatsoever for your customers. Myself and my Husband are suffering mentally from the thought of losing £700 from you and you can't have the decency to reply. DO NOT BOOK WITH THIS COMPANY

items.title: I can said the services is good but the…
items.review_text: I can said the services is good but the price won't match the services, very expensive compared airlines, or buses ...Eurostar from London can knocked out your pocket if you try to use to economic travel. That just good if you plan to take a bike or E-Scooter but the prices not suitable if you don't have much money, they will ripped you off.

items.title: Absolute con job.
items.review_text: Paid £220 for tickets to Amsterdam with an extra £16 for cancellation insurance. Now completely unable to get in touch with Eurostar as they won't pick up the phone, respond to email and their online services aren't working. Will not be able to cancel the tickets in time and have lost £220. Appalling.

items.title: Paid for tickets l’ve never got it
items.review_text: Paid for tickets l’ve never got it. My eurostar account got blocked, resetting a password doesn’t work. Phone line is busy all day every day, my emails are ignored, there is no one l can reach out. Such a horrible customer service. I lost £99

items.title: Horrible customer service
items.review_text:
Horrible customer service. 
They cancelled my train and cannot get the refund on-line. Impossible to get through the phone at any hour. Cannot believe how this big company has such a poor service

items.title: Non-existent customer service
items.review_text:
My wife is a care worker on minimum wage and limited ability to obtain time off. She bought a Eurostar ticket for Paris for a friend’s birthday in June 2021, but was unable to go due to lockdown and quarantine issues.
Eurostar offered her an evoucher with a 6 month expiry.
Due to continuing issues in the care sector, she is unable to use it by the end of December.
She has tried to contact Eurostar by phone, website messages, Facebook and even emailing Jacques Damas the CEO and she has had no reply.
Disgusting customer service!!!

items.title: Great experience
items.review_text:
I travelled London to Paris 1st - 3rd December 2021. Much easier than flying. Passport control all done at the departing station (so when you arrive in Paris or London you just walk straight out).

No major queues and service was on time. For city to city transport I would definitely recommend as a better option than flying.

items.title: SCANDALEUX
items.review_text:
SCANDALEUX
Nous avons réservé 6 billets pour notre fille, son mari, ses deux enfants et nous même: a l'impression des billets nous constatons que 3 des billets sont au nom de notre gendre et que le remplissage automatique a "effacé" nos deux noms! C'est un bug qui semble connu (car cité sur leur site). Depuis, impossible de les joindre par tous les moyens possibles. DES VOLEURS!!!!!

items.title: Absolutely shambolic
items.review_text: Absolutely shambolic,  no reply to emails   only recorded message on the phone " sorry we are not taking calls at the moment,",,,,rip off from start to finish   ,  I for one won't be bothering again,   £469  down the eurostar drain ,  RUBBISH...

items.title: Eurostar est le meilleur pour aller à London...
items.review_text:
Bon, mon expérience avec Eurostar est exceptionnelle.
Depuis 2020 que je voyage par train avec Eurostar, je n'ai pas eu des problèmes, même en ce temps de Covid, tous les voyages sont planifiés longtemps en avance...
Merci pour tout et bravo aux personnels courageux qui malgré toute cette situation sanitaire sont toujours près de leurs clients.
❤️❤️❤️

items.title: Comme beaucoup je me suis faite …
items.review_text: Comme beaucoup je me suis faite  balader depuis mars 2020, l'on m'envoie des vounchers inutilisables; je veux que l'on me rembourse mais impossible de les joindre; terminé Eurostar je prendrais le bateau lors de mes voyages ; cette compagnie est nulle;  aucun service client ;  une grande malhonnêteté

items.title: 24 hours plus technical mess. Useless service.
items.review_text: Hard to believe... we have a pandemic going on and Eurostars booking system has collapsed. Impossible to exchange or cancel tickets in the last 24 hours ! They are already having issues ! Not sure they can afford this mess. Scandalous and badly prepared by their direction...

items.title: Appalling
items.review_text: I have never known a company make it so difficult to allow their customers to speak with them.  4 minute long waffle before then pressing 1 to discuss your booking only then to be immediately cut off.  It's disgusting.  I urgently need to speak with someone about our booking.  They are beyond useless.

items.title: Disgusting customer service & communications
items.review_text:
I booked a Eurostar ticket in June 2021 and due to lockdown/no lockdown etc I had to cancel and ask for a refund. When I looked at my refund voucher in September I realised it was only valid for 6 months! As I am a care worker, I can't book leave unless I give 8 weeks notice, and it is now too late.
I have tried to call, and no response, I have sent message from their website for the past 2 months and no reply, I have written to the Director's office for the attention of Jacques Damas and no response. So what do I do? Loose all this money!?!?

items.title: Pourquoi maintenant je dois payer les…
items.review_text: Pourquoi maintenant je dois payer les frais de banque sur le paiement j'ai effectué pour mes billets de Eurostar?  J'essaye de les contacter par téléphone mais il n'y a pas de réponse et j'ai envoyé 2 emails sans réponse aussi.

items.title: Customer service disappearance (Autumn 2021)
items.review_text:
I have had issues with 2 vouchers expiring on 31 December. When trying to book online this past month, they appear as "already used" on the website  (which cannot be, since I haven't travelled with Eurostar in 14 months). 
I have tried calling (answering machine), went to St Pancras but officers on-site say they can't help as they don't have access to customers' profiles, and sent an email more than 28 days ago (aka their expected reply deadline) but still haven't had a reply. 
I was relieved in a sense to read that it is a general issue travellers are experiencing at the moment with Eurostar's customer service. 
It's no secret that times are hard for most companies and I just wish there was more transparency about what is truly going on.  It is also new for me to have such a bad experience with the company. Travelling with Eurostar used to be such a treat, and I hope it will be again at some point.
UPDATE: I did manage to talk to someone mid-December who was very patient, helpful and kind. My trips with Eurostar have been enjoyable again since. So, as I foresaw in my review, Eurostar probably went through a bit of a rough patch and are now coming back to their customer service excellence. Sweet!

items.title: Lost with Eurostar
items.review_text: Lost with Eurostar: I have an issue, you cannot call as an answering machine says that lines are busy, they do not reply to mails and website does not cover what I am looking for....

items.title: Awful customer service
items.review_text:
Awful customer service. 
Received an e-voucher due to a cancelled trip in 2020 due to COVID - no issues with that. However when I attempt to make a booking now with the e-voucher online I receive a message saying the booking cannot be made and to call customer service. Finally managed to get through to someone after 1 day of trying, only to be told he couldn't help and I should 'maybe try booking without the voucher, and use the voucher another time' or to call back again to speak to someone else. Why couldn't he transfer me himself?! Now after 10 times of attempting to call again and receiving the pre-recorded message saying they're too busy and disconnecting the call, I've been sat on hold for 3 hours waiting to speak to someone.
Also, don't bother trying to speak to them on Twitter/Facebook as they just ignore you.

items.title: I’m still waiting for my travel voucher!!
items.review_text:
I’m still waiting for my travel voucher!
I booked a trip back in March 2020 and I had an email from them in June 2020 apologising for the delay to my vouchers… yes, you guessed it still not received. No one will answer the phone, no one is replying to my emails either. I want to book my trip for July next year but I still can’t get hold of anyone! And the prices keep creeping up and now I’m stuck a d don’t know what to do. 
My online account doesn’t even show my booking in the ‘past trips’ section so I can’t do anything about it online either.
Could someone from Eurostar please respond to me ASAP!

items.title: Vreselijk personeel
items.review_text: Vreselijk personeel, gister gebeld half uurtje 20 minuten van re voren is prima. 28 minuten van te voren en ik mag (met jong kinderen en vrouw niet meer mee. HET IS EEN SCHANDE, wat een slecht on klantvriendelijk bedrijf!!

items.title: Disgusting or should I say absolutely…
items.review_text:
Disgusting or should I say absolutely NO customer service!!!!
We were planning a trip to Belgium and my toddler accidentally pressed submit before we had double check a few things. Called Suri star immediately after to cancel but they were closed. Sent an enquiry form asking them to help that day and the next as their phone lines were not working for 3 days! Still I one has replied. Have been on hold for an hour with them and no one picking up the phone! I’m appalled that such a large company has such terrible customer service. Will not be using them again!!!

items.title: I need urgent assistance from Eurostar
items.review_text: I need urgent assistance from Eurostar. I have a train booked for next week and have not received the email confirmation. I have not been successful at speaking to the customer services team; after being on hold for 45min + on the phone-line, sent emails, written on your website support feedback form. Could someone from Eurostar please reach out to me asap? Thanks

items.title: Eurostar no longer seem to be answering…
items.review_text: Eurostar no longer seem to be answering the phone.  The service they are giving is in sad contrast to the situation pre-pandemic.

items.title: Oh dear Eurostar… so many phone calls…
items.review_text: Oh dear Eurostar… so many phone calls that reach no one, emails left unanswered. I made a booking in January 2020 to travel in April 2020, which of course was cancelled because of Covid. My booking shows up online as being in the past and not possible to reschedule. You have my £267 and I have nothing in return except a waste of time emailing/phone calls which also cost me money. What to do?

items.title: 20 months still waiting for a refund!!
items.review_text:
22-11-2021 Update: no word from Eurostar yet... 

16-11-2021 Update: still no word from Eurostar...

I purchased a Eurostar ticket to travel from London to Bourg Saint Maurice on Friday 13 March 2020, returning one week later. A few days before I was due to travel I sent an email indicating that I was suffering from Covid 19 related symptoms and was following Eurostar's instructions not to travel. I received an automated response advising that my email had been received and that I should not try to contact anyone as it was very busy and that someone would get back to me in the following week/s. My return train was then cancelled, and I was offered a link to claim a voucher, which never worked. Since then I have emailed about 10 times over the course of the past 20 months, receiving only a few vague responses, with some assurance that I am entitled to a voucher, as the dates of my trip fall in the correct time window. The most recent response dates back to 6/9/2021 when someone from the customer service finally answered they had requested my voucher and that I would be contacted in the next few days. Needless to say, I haven't been contacted to date, despite my writing to the customer service once again on 25/10/2021. Recently my partner, who I was meant to travel with, received an email advising of a time limit of December 2021 to use their e-vouchers. I still have not received vouchers for my cancelled train. I am going to update this daily until someone contacts me. It is extremely unfair that no-one returns my email, especially after so long and several attempts at communication from my side. I will be writing to the Ombudsman if nothing is done to rectify this.

items.title: Eurostar refuses refunds due to…
items.review_text:
Eurostar refuses refunds due to ridiculous travel restrictions for fully vaccinated travellers.
if one goes to the UK for two days you need to take a flow test on day two, spending one day of your two day holiday running back and forth for a test. Nowhere in the EU fully vaccinated people are required to take a test at GBP 35 per test! The UK having left the EU is now in business harassing EU tourists.
The Eurostar refused to give a refund for travel not made yet. They hide behind their company policies are only interested in making money over the back of their customers. 
I would advises all travellers from the EU who plan a short city trip to the UK not to go.........its not worth it.

items.title: Terrible company website.
items.review_text: Terrible company website.. we are trying to use the travel voucher (from cancellation Eurostar made) for this August. I have never seen a more crazier website..  you try to put the birthdate of the travelers and the dates. Month and year section just keeps scrolling..   you would think they would give you your money back due to a global pandemic and since they cancelled the train. We didn’t get our money back and vouchers can be used due to their terrible website. I have sent emails and also tried calling.. no luck! Very frustrating!

items.title: Unethical company that I will never use again
items.review_text:
Have used them for years to go Skiing but will never be using them again.

The regular ski train directly to Bourg Saint Maurice is no longer running (2022) because they have chartered every single train to Travelski.

Being forced into a transfer in Paris we booked through them only to find out the 2nd train is with SNCF. It turns out we can get the same train for about £150 less if we had booked direct.

The final nail in the coffin is that there is no cancellation allowed with Eurostar, even though we are well over 2 months out.

items.title: Shambles
items.review_text: Shambles. From the minute I arrived at the queue to the point of arrival in Paris. Is zero stars an option??!

items.title: Fly or Sail
items.review_text:
Shockingly bad.

Poor really poor customer service.  Queuing for around 2hrs.
Rude staff and almost no information about changes.

Tiny seats really tightly packed 
Horribly bright lights
Sterile atmosphere 
Just a really unpleasant experience all round.

items.title: Forget it if you have to catch a connecting train
items.review_text: On 5 November, I used Eurostar's services for the first time, travelling from London back to Germany. It explicitly says on the ticket to get to St. Pancras International 120 minutes before departure, because of intensified checks related to Brexit and Covid. I arrived on time and went through the checks in less than 30 minutes. Apparently, other travelers didn't consider the extra time and arrived too late. Instead of Eurostar considering it these people's responsibility to be on time, we *waited* for all guests to pass the checks, resulting in a 19 minute delayed departure and a 27 delayed arrival in Brussels. A whole group of people, myself included, missed the connecting ICE to Cologne/Frankfurt - it was announced that the ICE would wait for us, but this turned out to be untrue. Why does Eurostar reward latecomers, thereby causing problems for people who have to travel farther? At least Eurostar booked me a hotel room in Brussels, as there were no more available connecting trains that day.

items.title: 106 EUR extra for administative mistake
items.review_text: On september 17th I've booked a ticket for a trip in november. The payment of 88 euros is deducted from my banking account. A ticket or confirmation is not e-mailed to me. As my trip approaches I call the costumer service. I am told that bookings often fail to be confirmed. I can recieve my payment back but the booking has to be made again. In the meanwhile the cost for the trip has increased to 194 euro. There's no help offered to rebook my trip. Stunningly, I also have to pay the increase in price. The agent says it is my fault because I didn't call earlier. But haven't I made all my obligations as a constumer by paying? Right now Eurostar makes 106 euro extra on my trip. I expect Eurostar to pay me this difference, as this is a perverse business model.

items.title: Just traveled with them from Rotterdam…
items.review_text:
Just traveled with them from Rotterdam to St Pancras and I must say, i was hesitant to book seeing all the negative reviews in here but considering I wanted to bypass Heathrow immigration on midterm school break in the UK, i felt cleared UK immigration at Rotterdam was the better way. And it was.
NL exit process was painless and then the UK passport control, just steps after the Dutch one, was quiet, queue-free and quick to clear (i am non-EU/non-UK passport holder).
The train journey was long but Wi-Fi worked well, strong enough to allow me to watch a few episodes on Netflix with little break to the signal.
Food was fine, toilets were cleaned regularly, announcements were plentiful.
Arrival into St Pancras was on time and painless. There is a border force gate you have to pass through (not sure why) although no officers standing. After that is the UK Customs and there were a few officers standing pulling travelers on the side for questioning and X-ray of their carryons.

OK I took off a star for:
- rude X-ray agent at Rotterdam (I mean she was aggressively rude)
